dataset_description: Computed ABC Analysis allows the optimal calculation of three disjoint subsets A,B,C in data sets containing positive values: subset A containing few most profitable values, i.e. largest data values ("the important few"), subset B containing data, where the profit gain equals effort required to obtain this gain, and the subset C of non-profitable values, i.e. the smallest data sets ("the trivial many"). This package calculates the three subsets A, B and C by means of an algorithm based on statistically valid definitions of thresholds for the three sets A,B and C.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Ultsch. A ., Lotsch J.: Computed ABC Analysis for Rational Selection of Most Informative Variables in Multivariate Data, PloS one, Vol. 10(6), pp. e0129767. doi 10.1371/journal.pone.0129767, 2015.

dataset_title: Sperm Precedence Data from the Fungus Beetle
dataset_description: Offspring counts and proportional paternity by mating order for a breeding experiment of the fungus beetle conducted by JK Conner (1995).
dataset_format:
A data frame with 12 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Female")), list("a numeric vector to identify females.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("P2")), list("proportional paternity of the second male.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total_Offspring")), list("total number of offspring for the female.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("No_2nd_Male")), list("number of offspring sired by the second male.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: J. K. Conner (1995) Extreme variability in sperm precedence in the fungus beetle, list("Bolitotherus cornutus") (Coleoptera Tenebrionidae), list("Ethology Ecology & Evolution") list("7") , 277-280.

", "    ", list(list(list("Female")), list("a numeric vector to identify females.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total_Offspring")), list("total number of offspring for the female.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("P2")), list("proportional paternity of the second male.")), "

", "  ")
dataset_source: T. Benken, A. Knaak, C. Gack, M. Eberle, and K. Peschke (1999) Variation of sperm precedence in the rove beetle, list("Aleochara curtula") (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae), list("Behaviour") list("136") , 1065-1077.

", "    ", list(list(list("Female")), list("a numeric vector to identify females.")), "

dataset_title: Sperm Precedence Data from the Rough-Skinned Newt
dataset_description: Offspring counts from two clutches and proportional paternity by mating order for a breeding experiment of the rough-skinned newt conducted by Jones et al., (2002)
dataset_format:
A data frame with 10 observations on the following 10 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Female")), list("a numeric code to identify females.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("No_1st_Clutch")), list("total offspring in the first clutch.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("P2_1")), list("proportional paternity of the second male for the first clutch.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("No_2nd_Male_1st_Clutch")), list("total offspring sired by the second male from the first clutch.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("No_2nd_Clutch")), list("total offspring in the second clutch.")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("P2_2")), list("proportional paternity of the second male for the second clutch.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("No_2nd_Male_2nd_Clutch")), list("total offspring sired by the second male from the second clutch.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total_2nd_Male")), list("total offspring sired by the second male from both clutches.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total_Offspring")), list("total offspring for both clutches.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total_P2")), 
        list("total overall proportional paternity of the second male for both clutches.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: A. G. Jones, E. M. Adams, and S. J. Arnold (2002) A mechanism of first-male precedence in a vertebrate. list("Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America") list("99") , 2078-2081.

dataset_title: Synthetic validation data set for use with abn library examples
dataset_description: 10000 observations simulated from a DAG with 10 variables from Poisson, Bernoulli and Gaussian distributions.
dataset_format:
A data frame, binary variables are factors.The relevant formulas are given below (note these do not give parameter estimates just the form of the relationships, like in glm(), e.g. logit()=1+p1 means a logit link function and comprises of an intercept term and a term involving p1). list("
", "     ", list(list("b1"), list("binary, logit()=1 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("p1"), list("poisson, log()=1 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("g1"), list("gaussian, identity()=1 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("b2"), list("binary, logit()=1")), "
", "     ", list(list("p2"), list("poisson, log()=1+b1+p1 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("b3"), list("binary, logit()=1+b1+g1+b2 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("g2"), list("gaussian, identify()=1+p1+g1+b2 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("b4"), list("binary, logit()=1+g1+p2")), 
    "
", "     ", list(list("b5"), list("binary, logit()=1+g1+g2 ")), "
", "     ", list(list("g3"), list("gaussian, identity()=1+g1+b2 ")), "
", "     
", "     ")

dataset_title: Functions for Processing Minute-to-Minute Accelerometer Data
dataset_description: A collection of functions that perform operations on time-series accelerometer data, such as identify non-wear time, flag minutes that are part of an activity bout, and find the maximum 10-minute average count value. The functions are generally very flexible, allowing for a variety of algorithms to be implemented. Most of the functions are written in C++ for efficiency.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: 1. Dirk Eddelbuettel and Romain Francois (2011). Rcpp: Seamless R and C++ Integration. Journal of Statistical Software, 40(8), 1-18. list("http://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/i08/") . 2. Dirk Eddelbuettel (2013). Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp. Springer, New York. ISBN 978-1-4614-6867-7. 3. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS). National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey Data. Hyattsville, MD: US Department of Health and Human Services, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 2003-6. Available at: list("http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/nhanes_questionnaires.htm") . Accessed July 31, 2014. 4. Dane R. Van Domelen, W. Stephen Pittard, and Tamara B. Harris (2014). nhanesaccel: Process accelerometer data from NHANES 2003-2006. R package version 2.1.1. list("http://R-Forge.R-project.org/projects/nhanesaccel") 5. National Cancer Institute. Risk factor monitoring and methods: SAS programs for analyzing NHANES 2003-2004 accelerometer data. Available at: list("http://riskfactor.cancer.gov/tools/nhanes_pam") Acknowledgment: This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship under Grant No. DGE-0940903.

") %itemize
dataset_reference: [1] Lee JA, Gill J (2016). Missing value imputation for physical activity data measured by accelerometer.  Statistical Methods in Medical Research.

dataset_description: This packages provides a statistical method to impute the missing values in accelerometer data. The methodology includes both parametric and semi-parametric multiple imputations under the zero-inflated poisson lognormal model. It also provides multiple functions to preprocess the accelerometer data previous to the missing data imputation. These includes detecting wearing and nonwearing time, selecting valid days and subjects, and creating plots.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Lee JA, Gill J (2016). Missing value imputation for physical activity data measured by accelerometer. Statistical Methods and Medical Research.

dataset_title: Data set for illustrating accrued data methods
dataset_description: Simulated dataset of 12 months of counts accrued over 12 days. This data set is a list("data.frame") . To use the dataset with any of the functions in the package, the user must first convert it to an list("accrued") object.
dataset_format: A data frame of influenza-like-illness count data showing the cumulative count data received, with each row representing an encounter date and columns representing the number of days after the encounter. The "final" column represents the final count for each encounter date.

dataset_format: A data frame of count data showing the cumulative count data received, with each row representing an encounter date and columns representing the number of days after the encounter. The "final" column represents the final count for each encounter date.

dataset_title: Estimating Age Modification Effect on Genetic and Environmental Variance Components in Twin Models

dataset_title: Placement and Searches for Carcasses at Altamont

", " ", list(list("Species"), list(list("character"), " - 4-letter AOU species code")), "

    "
")

dataset_title: Tract-level data from the 2006-2010 American Community Survey for Lawrence, MA for use in examples of acs package.
dataset_description: Tract-level data from the 2006-2010 American Community Survey for Lawrence, MA.  Contains median household income.  Used for examples in acs package.
dataset_format: An acs-class object with 18 rows/geographies and 1 variable, representing tract-level ACS data for the city of Lawrence, MA from 2006-2010.  Also includes geographic and other metadata.
dataset_source: U.S. Census American Community Survey, 2010; list("http://www.census.gov/")

dataset_description: Contains data on the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) for the years 1913-2015 from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.  Used by the acs package for currency conversion functions. Scaled for base (100) to be 1982-84.
dataset_format: A named vector containing 103 observations, one for each year from 1913 through 2015.

dataset_title: County-level data from the 2005-2009 American Community Survey for Kansas for use in examples of acs package.
dataset_description: County-level data from the 2005-2009 American Community Survey for Kansas. Contains demographic data on sex, age, and citizenship.  Used for examples in acs package. list("kansas09") , and the corresponding one-year survey data in list("kansas07") , provide acs objects to test and demonstrate various functions in the package.
dataset_format: An acs-class object with 105 rows/geographies and 55 demographic variables, representing county-level ACS data for the state of Kansas.  Also includes geographic and other metadata.
dataset_source: U.S. Census American Community Survey, 2009; list("http://www.census.gov/")

dataset_title: County-level data from the 2007 American Community Survey for Kansas for use in examples of acs package.
dataset_description: County-level data from the 2007 American Community Survey for Kansas. Contains demographic data on sex, age, and citizenship.  Used for examples in acs package. list("kansas07") and the corresponding five-year survey data in list("kansas09") provide acs objects to test and demonstrate various functions in the package.
dataset_format: An acs-class object with 7 rows/geographies and 55 demographic variables, representing county-level ACS data for the state of Kansas.  Also includes geographic and other metadata. Note that in comparison to list("kansas09") , list("kansas07") has far fewer rows, which illustrates the fact that the Census only provides ACS one-year data for the largest counties (over 65,000 population).
dataset_source: U.S. Census American Community Survey, 2007; list("http://www.census.gov/")

dataset_title: FIPS codes and geographic names for use in searching and creating geographies in the acs package.
dataset_description: FIPS codes and geographic names for use in searching and creating geographies in the acs package.  (Used internally.)

dataset_title: Download, Manipulate, and Present American Community Survey and Decennial Data from the US Census
dataset_description: Provides a general toolkit for downloading, managing, analyzing, and presenting data from the U.S. Census, including SF1 (Decennial "short-form"), SF3 (Decennial "long-form"), and the American Community Survey (ACS).  Confidence intervals provided with ACS data are converted to standard errors to be bundled with estimates in complex acs objects.  Package provides new methods to conduct standard operations on acs objects and present/plot data in statistically appropriate ways. Current version is 2.0 +/- .033.

dataset_description: The geo.set class provides a convenient wrapper for user-defined geographies, used for downloading data from the U.S. Census American Community Survey.  A geo.set may hold the designation of a single geography (say, a census tract, a county, or a state), or may bundle together multiple geographies of various levels, which may or may not be "combined" when downloaded.  Note that geo.sets may even contain nested geo.sets. Note: even a single geographic unit --- one specific tract or county --- must be wrapped up as a geo.set.  Technically, each individual element in the set is known as a "geo", but users will rarely (if ever) interact will individual elements such as this; wrapping all groups of geographies --- even groups consisting of just one element --- in geo.sets like this will help make them easier to deal with as the geographies get more complex. geo.set objects may be combined with the simple addition operator ( list("+") ).  By default, this will always return "flat" geo.sets with all the geographies in a single list.  The combination operator list("c") ), on the other hand, will generally return nested hierarchies, embedding sets within sets.  When working with nested sets like this, the "combine" flag can be set at each level to aggregate subsets within the structure (although be careful --- if a higher level of set includes "combine=T" you'll never actually see the unaggregated subsets deeper down). Using these different techniques, users are able to create whatever sort of new geographies they need --- aggregating some geographies, keeping others distinct (but still bundled as a set for convenience), mixing and matching different levels of Census geography, and so on.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Data from Experiment 2 in Gauvrit, Singmann, Soler-Toscano & Zenil

dataset_source: Gauvrit, Singmann, Soler-Toscano & Zenil (submitted). Complexity for psychology. A user-friendly implementation of the coding theorem method.

dataset_description: Hamilton depression scale factor IV is a measurement of mixed anxiety and depression and it is named after its inventor. In a double-blind experiment, this scale factor is obtained for 9 patients on their entry in a study, denoted by X. Post a tranquilizer T, the scale factor IV is again obtained for the same set of patients, which is denoted by Y. Here, an improvement due to tranquilizer T corresponds to a reduction in factor IV values.
dataset_format:

dataset_description: A data set that contains information about compounds used in drug discovery. Specifically, this data set consists of 5631 compounds on which an in-house solubility screen (ability of a compound to dissolve in a water/solvent mixture) was performed. Based on this screen, compounds were categorized as either insoluble (n=3493) or soluble (n=2138). Then, for each compound, 72 continuous, noisy structural descriptors were computed.
dataset_format: A data frame with 5631 observations on the following 73 variables. Some rows have missing data.

dataset_description: This is a cleaned gene expression data called Mantle cell lymphoma.
dataset_format: It contains total 577 columns namely, ID: array identifier for 92 patients, time: time of follow-up in year, cens: pateint status at follow up (1=death, 0=censored), and the remaining 574 columns are the gene expression value of 574 cDNA denoted by X37,..,X8893 which are the measurements of the log2 CY5/CY3 expression ratio for each feature. The dummy gene id X.... can be matched with the original gene UNIQID as stated at list("http://llmpp.nih.gov/MCL/") .
dataset_source: The full dataset is available at list("http://llmpp.nih.gov/MCL/") .

dataset_description: Accelerated destructive degradation tests (ADDT) are often used to collect necessary data for assessing the long-term properties of polymeric materials. Based on the collected data, a thermal index (TI) is estimated. The TI can be useful for material rating and comparisons. This package implements the traditional method based on the least-squares method, the parametric method based on maximum likelihood estimation, and the semiparametric method based on spline methods, and their corresponding methods for estimating TI for polymeric materials. The traditional approach is a two-step approach that is currently used in industrial standards, while the parametric method is widely used in the statistical literature. The semiparametric method is newly developed. The parametric and semiparametric approaches allow one to do statistical inference such as quantifying uncertainties in estimation, hypothesis testing, and predictions. Publicly available datasets are provided for illustrations. More details can be found in Jin et al. (2017).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: C. B. King, Y. Xie, Y. Hong, J. H. Van Mullekom, S. P. DeHart, and P. A. DeFeo, ``A comparison of traditional and maximum likelihood approaches to estimating thermal indices for polymeric materials,'' Journal of Quality Technology, in press, 2016. L. A. Escobar, W. Q. Meeker, D. L. Kugler, and L. L. Kramer, ``Accelerated destructive degradation tests: Data, models, and analysis,'' in Mathematical and Statistical Methods in Reliability, B. H. Lindqvist and K. A. Doksum, Eds. River Edge, NJ: World Scientific Publishing Company, 2003, ch. 21. M. Li and N. Doganaksoy, ``Batch variability in accelerated-degradation testing,'' Journal of Quality Technology, vol. 46, pp. 171-180, 2014. Y. Xie, C. B. King, Y. Hong, and Q. Yang, ``Semi-parametric models for accelerated destructive degradation test data analysis,'' Preprint: arXiv:1512.03036, 2015. Y. Xie, Z. Jin, Y. Hong, and J. H. Van Mullekom, ``Statistical methods for thermal index estimation based on accelerated destructive degradation test data,'' in Statistical Modeling for Degradation Data, D. G. Chen, Y. L. Lio, H. K. T. Ng, and T. R. Tsai, Eds. NY: New York: Springer, 2017, ch. 12. Z. Jin, Y. Xie, Y. Hong, and J. H. dataset_title: Compute the proportion of typed elements
dataset_description: The generic function list("propTyped") is devoted to investigating the structure of missing data in adegenet objects. list() Methods are defined for list("genind") and list("genpop") objects. They can return the proportion of available (i.e. non-missing) data per individual/population, locus, or the combination of both in with case the matrix indicates which entity (individual or population) was typed on which locus.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This accessor is used to retrieve a matrix of allele data. By default, a matrix of integers representing allele counts is returned. If list("freq") is TRUE, then data are standardised as frequencies, so that for any individual and any locus the data sum to 1. The argument list("NA.method") allows to replace missing data (NAs). This accessor replaces the previous function list("truenames") as well as the function list("makefreq") .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Manipulate the population factor of genind objects.
dataset_description: The following methods allow the user to quickly change the population of a genind object.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The simple function list("isPoly") can be used to check which loci are polymorphic, or alternatively to check which alleles give rise to polymorphism.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Converting genind/genpop objects to other classes
dataset_description: These S3 and S4 methods are used to coerce list("genind") and list("genpop") objects to matrix-like objects. In most cases, this is equivalent to calling the list("@tab") slot. An exception to this is the convertion to list(list("ktab")) objects used in the ade4 package as inputs for K-tables methods (e.g. Multiple Coinertia Analysis). list()
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Microsatellites genotypes of 237 cats from 17 colonies of Nancy (France)

dataset_reference: Devillard, S.; Jombart, T. & Pontier, D. Disentangling spatial and genetic structure of stray cat ( list("Felis catus") L.) colonies in urban habitat using: not all colonies are equal. submitted to list("Molecular\n", "Ecology")

dataset_description: The function list("new") has a method for building list("genpop") objects. See the class description of for more information on this data structure. The functions and list("as.genpop") are aliases for list("new(\"genpop\", ...)") .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Datasets illustrating the Discriminant Analysis of Principal Components (DAPC, Jombart et al. submitted). list()

dataset_source: Jombart, T., Devillard, S. and Balloux, F.  Discriminant analysis of principal components: a new method for the analysis of genetically structured populations. Submitted to list("BMC genetics") .
dataset_reference: Jombart, T., Devillard, S. and Balloux, F.  Discriminant analysis of principal components: a new method for the analysis of genetically structured populations. Submitted to list("Genetics") .

dataset_description: The dataset list("H3N2") consists of 1903 strains of seasonal influenza (H3N2) distributed worldwide, and typed at 125 SNPs located in the hemagglutinin (HA) segment. It is stored as an R object with class list("genind") and can be accessed as usual using list("data(H3N2)") (see example). These data were gathered from DNA sequences available from Genbank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Genbank/).
dataset_format:
list("H3N2") is a genind object with several data frame as supplementary components ( list("H3N2@other) slort") , which contains the following items: list(" ", list(list("x"), list("a ", list("data.frame"), " containing
", "miscellaneous annotations of the sequences.")), " ", list(list("xy"), list("a matrix with two
", "columns indicating the geographic coordinates of the strains, as longitudes
", "and latitudes.")), " ", list(list("epid"), list("a character vector indicating the epidemic of
", "the strains.")), " ")
dataset_source: This dataset was prepared by Thibaut Jombart (t.jombart@imperia.ac.uk), from annotated sequences available on Genbank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Genbank/).
dataset_reference: Jombart, T., Devillard, S. and Balloux, F. Discriminant analysis of principal components: a new method for the analysis of genetically structured populations. Submitted to list("BMC genetics") .

dataset_description: The function list("new") has a method for building list("genind") objects. See the class description of for more information on this data structure. The functions and list("as.genind") are aliases for list("new(\"genind\", ...)") .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This data set gives the genotypes of 704 cattle individuals for 30 microsatellites recommended by the FAO. The individuals are divided into two countries (Afric, France), two species (Bos taurus, Bos indicus) and 15 breeds. Individuals were chosen in order to avoid pseudoreplication according to their exact genealogy.
dataset_format:
list("microbov") is a genind object with 3 supplementary components: list(" ", list(list("coun"), list("a factor giving the country of each individual (AF:
", "Afric; FR: France).")), " ", list(list("breed"), list("a factor giving the breed of each
", "individual.")), " ", list(list("spe"), list("is a factor giving the species of each individual
", "(BT: Bos taurus; BI: Bos indicus).")), " ")
dataset_source: Data prepared by Katayoun Moazami-Goudarzi and Denis Lalo\"e (INRA, Jouy-en-Josas, France)
dataset_reference: Lalo\"e D., Jombart T., Dufour A.-B. and Moazami-Goudarzi K. (2007) Consensus genetic structuring and typological value of markers using Multiple Co-Inertia Analysis. list("Genetics Selection Evolution") . list("39") : 545--567.

dataset_description: The function list("seploc") splits an object ( list("genind") , list("genpop") or list("genlight") ) by marker. For and objects, the method returns a list of objects whose components each correspond to a marker. For objects, the methods returns blocks of SNPs.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Simulated genotypes of two georeferenced populations
dataset_description: This simple data set was obtained by sampling two populations evolving in a island model, simulated using Easypop (2.0.1). See list("source") for simulation details. Sample sizes were respectively 100 and 30 genotypes. The genotypes were given spatial coordinates so that both populations were spatially differentiated.
dataset_format: list("sim2pop") is a genind object with a matrix of xy coordinates as supplementary component.
dataset_source: Easypop version 2.0.1 was run with the following parameters: list() - two diploid populations, one sex, random mating - 1000 individuals per population - proportion of migration: 0.002 - 20 loci - mutation rate: 0.0001 (KAM model) - maximum of 50 allelic states - 1000 generations (last one taken)
dataset_reference: Balloux F (2001) Easypop (version 1.7): a computer program for oppulation genetics simulations list("Journal of Heredity") , list("92") : 301-302

dataset_description: The function list("makefreq") is a generic to compute allele frequencies. These can be derived for list("genind") or list("genpop") objects. In the case of objects, data are kept at the individual level, but standardised so that allele frequencies sum up to 1.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Microsatellites genotypes of 335 chamois (Rupicapra rupicapra) from the Bauges mountains (France)
dataset_description: This data set contains the genotypes of 335 chamois ( list("Rupicapra\n", "rupicapra") ) from the Bauges mountains, in France. No prior clustering about individuals is known. Each genotype is georeferenced. These data also contain a raster map of elevation of the sampling area.
dataset_format:
list("rupica") is a genind object with 3 supplementary components inside the list("@other") slot: list(" ", list(list("xy"), list("a matrix containing the
", "spatial coordinates of the genotypes.")), " ", list(list("mnt"), list("a raster map of elevation,
", "with the ", list("asc"), " format from the ", list("adehabitat"), " package.")), "
", list(list("showBauges"), list("a function to display the map of elevation with an
", "appropriate legend (use ", list("showBauges()"), ").")), " ")
dataset_source: Daniel Maillard, 'Office National de la Chasse et de la Faune Sauvage' (ONCFS), France.
dataset_reference: Cassar S (2008) Organisation spatiale de la variabilité génétique et phénotypique a l'échelle du paysage: le cas du chamois et du chevreuil, en milieu de montagne. PhD Thesis. University Claude Bernard - Lyon 1, France. list() Cassar S, Jombart T, Loison A, Pontier D, Dufour A-B, Jullien J-M, Chevrier T, Maillard D. Spatial genetic structure of Alpine chamois ( list("Rupicapra\n", "rupicapra") ): a consequence of landscape features and social factors? submitted to list("Molecular Ecology") .

dataset_description: The function list("seppop") splits a list("genind") or a list("genlight") object by population, returning a list of objects whose components each correspond to a population. list() For objects, the output can either be a list of (default), or a list of matrices corresponding to the list("@tab") slot.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The function list("selPopSize") checks the sample size of each population in a list("genind") object and keeps only genotypes of populations having a given minimum size.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Access and manipulate the population strata for genind or genlight objects.
dataset_description: The following methods allow the user to quickly change the strata of a genind or genlight object.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Access and manipulate the population hierarchy for genind or genlight objects.
dataset_description: The following methods allow the user to quickly change the hierarchy or population of a genind or genlight object.

dataset_description: The generic function list("scaleGen") is an analogue to the list("scale") function, but is designed with further arguments giving scaling options. list()
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This package is devoted to the multivariate analysis of genetic markers data. These data can be codominant markers (e.g. microsatellites) or presence/absence data (e.g. AFLP), and have any level of ploidy.  'adegenet' defines three formal (S4) classes: list() - list("genind") : a class for data of individuals ("genind" stands for genotypes-individuals). list("genpop") : a class for data of groups of individuals ("genpop" stands for genotypes-populations) list("genlight") genome-wide SNP data
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Jombart T. (2008) adegenet: a R package for the multivariate analysis of genetic markers list("Bioinformatics") 24: 1403-1405. doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btn129 list() Jombart T. and Ahmed I. (2011) adegenet 1.3-1: new tools for the analysis of genome-wide SNP data. . doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btr521 Jombart T, Devillard S and Balloux F (2010) Discriminant analysis of principal components: a new method for the analysis of genetically structured populations. BMC Genetics 11:94.  doi:10.1186/1471-2156-11-94 Jombart T, Eggo R, Dodd P, Balloux F (2010) Reconstructing disease outbreaks from genetic data: a graph approach. list("Heredity") 10.1038/hdy.2010.78. Jombart, T., Devillard, S., Dufour, A.-B. and Pontier, D. (2008) Revealing cryptic spatial patterns in genetic variability by a new multivariate method. , list("101") , 92--103. See adegenet website: list("http://adegenet.r-forge.r-project.org/") Please post your questions on 'the adegenet forum': adegenet-forum@lists.r-forge.r-project.org

dataset_description: Datasets illustrating the spatial Principal Component Analysis (Jombart et al. 2009).  These data were simulated using various models using Easypop (2.0.1).  Spatial coordinates were defined so that different spatial patterns existed in the data. The list("spca-illus") is a list containing the following list("genind") or list("genpop") objects: list() - dat2A: 2 patches - dat2B: cline between two pop - dat2C: repulsion among individuals from the same gene pool - dat3: cline and repulsion - dat4: patches and local alternance
dataset_format: list("spcaIllus") is list of 5 components being either genind or genpop objects.
dataset_source: Jombart, T., Devillard, S., Dufour, A.-B. and Pontier, D. Revealing cryptic spatial patterns in genetic variability by a new multivariate method. list("Heredity") , list("101") , 92--103.
dataset_reference: Jombart, T., Devillard, S., Dufour, A.-B. and Pontier, D. Revealing cryptic spatial patterns in genetic variability by a new multivariate method. list("Heredity") , list("101") , 92--103. Balloux F (2001) Easypop (version 1.7): a computer program for oppulation genetics simulations list("Journal of Heredity") list("92") : 301-302

dataset_description:
An accessor is a function that allows to interact with slots of an object in a convenient way. Several accessors are available for list("genind") or list("genpop") objects. The operator "\$" and "\$<-" are used to access the slots, being equivalent to "@" and "@<-". list() The operator "[" is a flexible way to subset data by individuals, populations, alleles, and loci. When using a matrix-like syntax, subsetting will apply to the dimensios of the @tab slot. In addition, specific arguments list("loc") and list("pop") can be used to indicate subsets of loci and populations. The argument list("drop") is a logical indicating if alleles becoming non-polymorphic in a new dataset should be removed (default: FALSE). Examples: list("
", "  ", list(), " "obj[i,j]" returns "obj" with a subset 'i' of individuals and 'j' of
", "  alleles.", list(), "
", "  
", "  ", list(), " "obj[1:10,]" returns an object with only the first 10 genotypes (if
", "  "obj" is a ", list("genind"), ") or the first 10 populations (if
", "  "obj" is a ", list("genpop"), ") ", list(), "
", "  
", "  ", list(), " "obj[1:10, 5:10]" returns an object keeping the first 10 entities and
", "  the alleles 5 to 10.", list(), "
", "  
", 
    "  ", list(), " "obj[loc=c(1,3)]" returns an object keeping only the 1st and 3rd
", "  loci, using ", list("locNames(obj)"), " as reference; logicals, or named loci
", "  also work; this overrides other subsetting of alleles.", list(), "
", "  
", " ", list(), " "obj[pop=2:4]" returns an object keeping only individuals from the
", "  populations 2, 3 and 4, using ", list("popNames(obj)"), " as reference;
", "  logicals, or named populations also work; this overrides other
", "  subsetting of individuals.", 
    list(), "
", "
", "  ", list(), " "obj[i=1:2, drop=TRUE]" returns an object keeping only the first
", "  two individuals (or populations), dropping the alleles no longer
", "  present in the data.", list(), "
") The argument list("treatOther") handles the treatment of objects in the list("@other") slot (see details). The argument can be set to TRUE to drop alleles that are no longer represented in the subset.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The class list("SNPbin") is a formal (S4) class for storing a genotype of binary SNPs in a compact way, using a bit-level coding scheme. This storage is most efficient with haploid data, where the memory taken to represent data can reduced more than 50 times. However, can be used for any level of ploidy, and still remain an efficient storage mode. A object can be constructed from a vector of integers giving the number of the second allele for each locus. stores a single genotype. To store multiple genotypes, use the list("genlight") class.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This dataset consists of 1350 individuals from native Human populations distributed worldwide typed at 678 microsatellite loci. The original HGDP-CEPH panel [1-3] has been extended by several native American populations [4]. This dataset was used to illustrate the Discriminant Analysis of Principal Components (DAPC, [5]).
dataset_format:
list("eHGDP") is a genind object with a data frame named list("popInfo") as supplementary component ( list("eHGDP@other$popInfo") ), which contains the following variables: list(" ", list(list("Population: "), list("a
", "character vector indicating populations.")), " ", list(list("Region: "), list("a character vector
", "indicating the geographic region of each population.")), " ", list(list("Label: "), list("a
", "character vector indicating the correspondence with population labels used
", "in the genind object (i.e., as output by ", list("pop(eHGDP)"), ").")), "
", list(list("Latitude,Longitude: "), list("geographic coordinates of the populations,
", "indicated as north and east degrees.")), 
    " ")
dataset_source: Original panel by Human Genome Diversity Project (HGDP) and Centre d'Etude du Polymorphisme Humain (CEPH). See reference [4] for Native American populations. This copy of the dataset was prepared by Francois Balloux.
dataset_reference: [1] Rosenberg NA, Pritchard JK, Weber JL, Cann HM, Kidd KK, et al. (2002) Genetic structure of human populations. list("Science") 298: 2381-2385. [2] Ramachandran S, Deshpande O, Roseman CC, Rosenberg NA, Feldman MW, et al. (2005) Support from the relationship of genetic and geographic distance in human populations for a serial founder effect originating in Africa. list("Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A") 102: 15942-15947. [3] Cann HM, de Toma C, Cazes L, Legrand MF, Morel V, et al. (2002) A human genome diversity cell line panel. 296: 261-262. [4] Wang S, Lewis CM, Jakobsson M, Ramachandran S, Ray N, et al. (2007) Genetic Variation and Population Structure in Native Americans. list("PLoS\n", "Genetics") 3: e185. [5] Jombart, T., Devillard, S. and Balloux, F.  Discriminant analysis of principal components: a new method for the analysis of genetically structured populations. Submitted to list("BMC genetics") .

dataset_description: The class list("genlight") is a formal (S4) class for storing a genotypes of binary SNPs in a compact way, using a bit-level coding scheme. This storage is most efficient with haploid data, where the memory taken to represent data can be reduced more than 50 times. However, can be used for any level of ploidy, and still remain an efficient storage mode. A object can be constructed from vectors of integers giving the number of the second allele for each locus and each individual (see 'Objects of the class genlight' below). stores multiple genotypes. Each genotype is stored as a list("SNPbin") object.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This data set contains the relocations of 3 porpoises
dataset_format: This data set is a regular object of class list("ltraj") (i.e. constant time lag of 24H).

dataset_description: This data set describes the use and availability of 5 habitat types for 17 squirrels monitored using radio-tracking.  See also the dataset list("squirreloc") .

This list has three components: list("
", "    ", list(list(list("studyarea")), list("a data frame giving the proportion of each
", "      habitat type (columns) on the study area. These proportions are
", "      repeated by rows, for all animals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("mcp")), list("a data frame giving the proportion of
", "      each habitat type (columns) in the home range of each animal (rows)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("locs")), list("a data frame giving the proportion of relocations
", "      of each animal (rows) reported in each habitat type (columns).")), 
    "
", "    ")
dataset_source: Aebischer, N. J., Robertson, P. A. and Kenward, R. E. (1993) Compositional analysis of habitat use from animal radiotracking data. list("Ecology") , list("74") , 1313--1325.

These data have been collected by Daniel Maillard (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage), and correspond to the activity period of the wild boar (during the night, when the animals forage. The data set list("puechabon") describes the resting sites).

dataset_source: Maillard, D. (1996). list("Occupation et utilisation de la garrigue et\n", "  du vignoble mediterraneens par le Sanglier") . Universite d'Aix-Marseille III: PhD thesis.

dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA Faune de Montagne, 95 rue Pierre Flourens, 34000 Montpellier, France.

dataset_title: Habitat Use by Three Species of Galliformes in the Vanoise National Parc
dataset_description: This data frame describes the habitat use by the Black Grouse ( list("Tetrao tetrix") ), the Rock Partridge ( list("Alectoris graeca") ) and the Rock Ptarmigan ( list("Lagopus mutus") ), in the Vanoise National Park (French Alps), from 1990 to 2000.
dataset_format: This data frame has 3110 rows and eight columns describing the habitat composition for each occurrence of three species of Galliformes. For each located occurrence (in rows), the employees of the national park have noted: the species, the elevation (in metres), the aspect (8 classes), the habitat type (7 categories, list("FR") means "fallen rocks") and the date (season, day, month and year).
dataset_source: Calenge, C., Martinot, J.P. and Lebreton, P. (2003) Ecological niche separation among mountain Galliformes in the Vanoise National Parc. list("Game and Wildlife Science") , 20, 259-285.

dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: adehabitat: a Package for the Analysis of the Space Use by Animals
dataset_description: The package adehabitat has been designed to allow the analysis of the space use by animals.  This package is organised in four main parts: (i) management of raster maps, (ii) habitat selection/ecological niche analysis,  (iii) home range estimation and (iv) analysis of animals trajectories.  These four parts interact with each other to facilitate the analysis.  Note that adehabitat strongly relies on the package ade4, which provides numerous functions for the analysis of multivariate data.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Calenge, C. (2006) The package adehabitat for the R software: a tool for the analysis of space and habitat use by animals. Ecological Modelling, 197, 516-519

dataset_title: Habitat Selection by the Wild Boar at Puechabon
dataset_description: This data set contains two data frames describing the use and the availability of 3 elevation classes for 6 wild boars ( list("Sus scrofa") L.) monitored using radio-tracking at Puechabon (South of France). These data have been collected by Daniel Maillard (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Maillard, D. (1996) list("Occupation et utilisation de la garrigue et du\n", "vignoble mediterraneens par le Sanglier") . Universite d'Aix-Marseille III:  PhD thesis.

dataset_title: Census of chamois (Rupicapra rupicapra) in the Bauges mountains
dataset_description: This data set contains the relocations of 198 chamois groups in the Bauges mountains, as well as maps of 7 environmental variables on the study area.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Daniel Maillard, Office National de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, 95 rue Pierre Flourens, 34000 Montpellier, France

dataset_title: Location of Chamois Groups in the Chartreuse Mountains
dataset_description: This data set describes the habitat use and availability by the chamois of the Chartreuse mountains (Isere, France), in 1992 and 1997. These data have been gathered during the hunting season (Fall).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Federation Departementale des Chasseurs de l'Isere, 65 av Jean Jaures, 38320 Eybens. France.

dataset_title: Habitat Use by Three Species of Galliformes in the Vanoise National Parc
dataset_description: This data frame describes the habitat use by the Black Grouse ( list("Tetrao tetrix") ), the Rock Partridge ( list("Alectoris graeca") ) and the Rock Ptarmigan ( list("Lagopus mutus") ), in the Vanoise National Park (French Alps), from 1990 to 2000.
dataset_format: This data frame has 3110 rows and eight columns describing the habitat composition for each occurrence of three species of Galliformes. For each located occurrence (in rows), the employees of the national park have noted: the species, the elevation (in metres), the aspect (8 classes), the habitat type (7 categories, list("FR") means "fallen rocks") and the date (season, day, month and year).
dataset_source: Calenge, C., Martinot, J.P. and Lebreton, P. (2003) Ecological niche separation among mountain Galliformes in the Vanoise National Parc. list("Game and Wildlife Science") , 20, 259-285.

dataset_description: This data set stores the results of the monitoring of 6 wild boar at Puechabon (Mediterranean habitat, South of France). These data have been collected by Daniel Maillard (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Maillard, D. (1996). list("Occupation et utilisation de la garrigue et\n", "    du vignoble mediterraneens par le Sanglier") . Universite d'Aix-Marseille III: PhD thesis.

dataset_description: This data set describes the habitat use and availability for 6 bighorn sheeps monitored by radio-tracking (Arnett et al. 1989, in Manly et al., 2003, p. 67-74). 10 habitat types are considered.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Manly, B.F.J., McDonald, L.L., Thomas, D.L., McDonald, T.L. & Erickson, W.P. (2003) list("Resource selection by animals - Statistical design and\n", "    Analysis for field studies. Second edition.") London: Kluwer academic publishers.

dataset_description: This data set contains the relocations of 3 porpoises
dataset_format: This data set is a regular object of class list("ltraj") (i.e. constant time lag of 24H).

dataset_title: GPS monitoring of one brown bear
dataset_description: These data contain the relocations of one female brown bear monitored using GPS collars during May 2004 in Sweden.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Scandinavian Bear Research Project. Skandinaviska Bjornprojektet. Tackasen - Kareliusvag 2. 79498 Orsa, Sweden. email: info@bearproject.info

dataset_description: This data set contains the trajectory of one hooded seal.
dataset_format: The dataset list("hseal") is an object of class list("ltraj") .  The coordinates are stored in meters (UTM - zone 21).
dataset_source: Jonsen, I.D., Flemming, J.M. and Myers, R.A. (2005). Robust state-space modeling of animal movement data. list("Ecology") , list("86") , 2874--2880.

dataset_description: This data set contains the relocations of one right whale.
dataset_format: This data set is a regular object of class list("ltraj") (i.e. constant time lag of 24H00)

dataset_title: GPS Monitoring of Four Ibex in the Belledonne Mountain
dataset_description: This dataset is an object of class "ltraj" (regular trajectory, relocations every 4 hours) containing the GPS relocations of four ibex during 15 days in the Belledonne mountain (French Alps).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA Faune de Montagne, 95 rue Pierre Flourens, 34000 Montpellier, France.

dataset_title: GPS Monitoring of One Mouflon in the Caroux Mountain
dataset_description: This dataset is an object of class "ltraj" (regular trajectory, relocations every 20 minutes) containing the GPS relocations of one mouflon during two week-ends in the Caroux mountain (South of France).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA Faune de Montagne, 95 rue Pierre Flourens, 34000 Montpellier, France.

dataset_title: GPS Monitoring of One Chamois in the Bauges Mountains
dataset_description: This dataset is an object of class "ltraj" (regular trajectory, relocations every 20 minutes) containing the GPS relocations of two chamois during one day in the Bauges mountain (French Alps).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA Faune de Montagne, 95 rue Pierre Flourens, 34000 Montpellier, France.

dataset_title: Argos Monitoring of Adult Albatross Movement
dataset_description: This data set contains the relocations of 6 adult albatross monitored in the Crozets Islands by the team of H. Weimerskirch from the CEBC-CNRS (Centre d'Etudes Biologiques de Chize, France).
dataset_format: This data set is an object of class list("ltraj") .

dataset_title: GPS Monitoring of one Roe Deer in Chize (France)
dataset_description: This dataset contains the relocations of a roe deer collected using GPS collars in the Chize reserve (Deux-Sevres, France) by the ONCFS (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage).
dataset_format: This dataset is a data.frame containing the relocations and metadata on these relocations (DOP, status, etc.).
dataset_source: Sonia Said, Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA-CS, 1 place Exelmans, 55000 Bar-le-Duc (France).

dataset_title: GPS Monitoring of one Roe Deer in Trois-Fontaines (France)
dataset_description: This dataset contains the relocations of a roe deer collected from May 1st to May 4th 2004 (every 5 minutes) using GPS collars in the wildlife reserve of Trois-Fontaines (Haute Marne, France) by the ONCFS (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage).
dataset_format: This dataset is a regular object of class list("ltraj") (i.e. constant time lag).
dataset_source: Sonia Said, Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA-CS, 1 place Exelmans, 55000 Bar-le-Duc (France).

dataset_description: This data set contains the relocations of an African buffalo (Syncerus caffer) monitored in the W National Park (Niger) by D. Cornelis, as well as the habitat map of the study area.
dataset_format: This dataset is a list containing an object of class list("ltraj") and a SpatialPixelsDataFrame.
dataset_source: Cornelis D., Benhamou S., Janeau G., Morellet N., Ouedraogo M. & de Vissher M.-N. (submitted). The spatiotemporal segregation of limiting resources shapes space use patterns of West African savanna buffalo. Journal of Mammalogy.

dataset_title: Movements of wild boars tracked at Puechabon
dataset_description: This data set is an object of class list("ltraj") , giving the results of the monitoring of 2 wild boars by radio-tracking at Puechabon (Mediterranean habitat, South of France).  These data have been collected by Daniel Maillard (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage), and correspond to the activity period of the wild boar (during the night, when the animals forage. The data set list("puechabonsp") in the package list("adehabitatMA") describes the resting sites).
dataset_format: This object has, in total, 204 relocations distributed among two animals and three bursts of relocations ( list("CH930803") , list("CH930824") list("CH930827") , and list("JE930827") ).
dataset_source: Maillard, D. (1996). list("Occupation et utilisation de la garrigue et\n", "  du vignoble mediterraneens par le Sanglier") . Universite d'Aix-Marseille III: PhD thesis.

dataset_title: GPS Monitoring of Four Ibex in the Belledonne Mountain (irregular data)
dataset_description: This dataset is an object of class "ltraj" (irregular trajectory, relocations roughly every 4 hours) containing the raw GPS relocations of four ibex during 15 days in the Belledonne mountain (French Alps).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage, CNERA Faune de Montagne, 95 rue Pierre Flourens, 34000 Montpellier, France.

dataset_description: This dataset describes the location and date of recovery of 800 teal ringed in Camargue, southern France between January 1952 and February 1978 using standard dabbling duck funnel traps hidden in the vegetation.
dataset_format:
The following variables are given for each recovery: list("
", "    ", list(list(list("x")), list("a numeric vector giving the longitude of the
", "      recovery")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("y")), list("a numeric vector giving the latitude of the
", "      recovery")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("date")), list("a vector of class POSIXct containing the date of
", "      recovery.  Actually, only the day and month have been indicated.
", "      The year of recovery has been set to 1900 or 1901, and should not
", "      be taken into account in the analysis.")), 
    "
", "  ")
dataset_source: La Tour du Valat. A research centre for the conservation of Mediterranean wetlands. Le Sambuc - 13200 Arles, France. http://en.tourduvalat.org/

dataset_title: Print Functions for Objects of the Package 'sp' Used in 'adehabitatMA'
dataset_description: These are functions allowing a shorter print of the content of objects of class list("SpatialPolygonsDataFrame") , list("SpatialPixelsDataFrame") list("SpatialPixels") , and list("SpatialGridDataFrame") .  Original printing methods can be recovered by setting list("adeoptions(shortprint=FALSE)") .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This data set stores the results of the monitoring of 4 wild boars at Puechabon (Mediterranean habitat, South of France). These data have been collected by Daniel Maillard (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Maillard, D. (1996). list("Occupation et utilisation de la garrigue et\n", "  du vignoble mediterraneens par le Sanglier") . Universite d'Aix-Marseille III: PhD thesis.

dataset_description: This data set stores the results of the monitoring of lynx in the French Jura between 1980 and 1999.  These data have been collected by the Lynx Network of the french wildlife management office (Office national de la chasse et de la faune sauvage).
dataset_format: The list list("lynxjura") has two components: list("map") is an object of class list("SpatialPixelsDataFrame") (see list("help(SpatialPixelsDataFrame)") ) that describes several variables on the study area: list("forets") is the density of forests, list("hydro") is the density of rivers, list("routes") is the density of roads and list("artif") is the distance from urbanized areas. list() list("locs") list("SpatialPointsDataFrame") containing the locations of presence indices of the lynx. list("X") and list("Y") are the x and y coordinates, list("Date") is the date of the collection of the indice and list("Type") represents the type of data ( list("C") : alive lynx captured, list("D") : attacks on livestock, list("E") : prints or tracks, list("F") : feces, list("J") : hairs, list("L") : corpse of lynx, list("O") : sightings and list("P") : attacks on wild prey).
dataset_source: Vandel, J.M. (2001) list("Repartition du Lynx (Lynx lynx) en France (Massif\n", "Alpin, Jurassien et Vosgien). Methodologie d'etude et statut\n", "actuel") . Ecole Pratique des Haute Etudes de Montpellier II: Dissertation.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantative trait of carnivora
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of carnivora as reported by Diniz-Filho et al. (1998). It also gives the body mass of these 19 species.
dataset_format: list("carni19") is a list containing the 2 following objects : list(" ", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in\n", "Newick format.")), " ", list(list("bm"), list("is a numeric vector which values correspond to the\n", "body mass of the 19 species (log scale).")), " ")
dataset_source: Diniz-Filho, J. A. F., de Sant'Ana, C.E.R. and Bini, L.M. (1998) An eigenvector method for estimating phylogenetic inertia. list("Evolution") , list("52") , 1247--1262.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of birds
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 19 birds as reported by Bried et al. (2002). It also gives 6 traits corresponding to these 19 species.
dataset_format: list("procella") is a list containing the 2 following objects: list(" ", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in\n", "Newick format.")), " ", list(list("traits"), list("is a data frame with 19 species and 6 traits")), "\n")
dataset_reference: Bried, J., Pontier, D. and Jouventin, P. (2002) Mate fidelity in monogamus birds: a re-examination of the Procellariiformes. list("Animal\n", "Behaviour") , list("65") , 235--246. See a data description at list("http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/R/pdf/pps037.pdf") (in French).

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of flowers
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 17 flowers as reported by Ackerly and Donoghue (1998). It also gives 31 traits corresponding to these 17 species.
dataset_format: list("tithonia") is a list containing the 2 following objects : - tre: a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in Newick format. list() - tab: a data frame with 17 species and 31 traits.
dataset_reference: Ackerly, D. D. and Donoghue, M.J. (1998) Leaf size, sappling allometry, and Corner's rules: phylogeny and correlated evolution in Maples (Acer). list("American Naturalist") , list("152") , 767--791.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of teleos fishes
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 49 teleos fishes as reported by Rochet et al. (2000). It also gives life-history traits corresponding to these 49 species.
dataset_format: list("mjrochet") is a list containing the 2 following objects : list(" ", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in\n", "Newick format.")), " ", list(list("tab"), list("is a data frame with 49 rows and 7 traits.")), " ")
dataset_reference: Rochet, M. J., Cornillon, P-A., Sabatier, R. and Pontier, D. (2000) Comparative analysis of phylogenic and fishing effects in life history patterns of teleos fishes. list("Oikos") , list("91") , 255--270.

dataset_title: Phylogenetic and quantitative traits of amazonian palm trees
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 66 amazonian palm trees. It also gives 7 traits corresponding to these 66 species.
dataset_format:
list("palm") is a list containing the 2 following objects: list("
", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in Newick
", "format.")), " ", list(list("traits"), list("is a data frame with 66 species (rows) and 7 traits
", "(columns).")), " ")
dataset_source: This data set was obtained by Clementine Gimaret-Carpentier.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of ungulates.
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 18 ungulates as reported by Pelabon et al. (1995). It also gives 4 traits corresponding to these 18 species.
dataset_format: list("fission") is a list containing the 2 following objects : list(" ", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in\n", "Newick format.")), " ", list(list("tab"), list("is a data frame with 18 species and 4 traits")), " ")
dataset_source: Data were obtained from Pelabon, C., Gaillard, J.M., Loison, A. and Portier, A. (1995) Is sex-biased maternal care limited by total maternal expenditure in polygynous ungulates? list("Behavioral Ecology and\n", "Sociobiology") , list("37") , 311--319.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of carnivora
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 70 carnivora as reported by Diniz-Filho and Torres (2002). It also gives the geographic range size and body size corresponding to these 70 species.
dataset_format:
list("carni70") is a list containing the 2 following objects: list(" ", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in
", "Newick format.  Branch lengths are expressed as divergence times (millions
", "of years)")), " ", list(list("tab"), list("is a data frame with 70 species and two traits: size
", "(body size (kg)) ; range (geographic range size (km)).")), " ")
dataset_source: Diniz-Filho, J. A. F., and N. M. Torres. (2002) Phylogenetic comparative methods and the geographic range size-body size relationship in new world terrestrial carnivora. list("Evolutionary Ecology") , list("16") 351--367.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of flowers
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 11 flowers as reported by Morales (2000). It also gives morphologic and demographic traits corresponding to these 11 species.
dataset_format: list("tithonia") is a list containing the 2 following objects : list(" ", list(list("tre"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree in\n", "Newick format.")), " ", list(list("tab"), list("is a data frame with 11 species and 14 traits (6\n", "morphologic traits and 8 demographic).")), " ")
dataset_source: Data were obtained from Morales, E. (2000) Estimating phylogenetic inertia in Tithonia (Asteraceae) : a comparative approach. list("Evolution") , list("54") , 2, 475--484.

dataset_title: Phylogeny and quantitative traits of lizards
dataset_description: This data set describes the phylogeny of 18 lizards as reported by Bauwens and D\'iaz-Uriarte (1997). It also gives life-history traits corresponding to these 18 species.
dataset_format:
list("lizards") is a list containing the 3 following objects : list(" ", list(list("traits"), list("is a data frame with 18 species and 8 traits.")), "
", list(list("hprA"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree (hypothesized
", "phylogenetic relationships based on immunological distances) in Newick
", "format.")), " ", list(list("hprB"), list("is a character string giving the phylogenetic tree
", "(hypothesized phylogenetic relationships based on morphological
", "characteristics) in Newick format.")), " ")
dataset_reference: Bauwens, D., and D\'iaz-Uriarte, R. (1997) Covariation of life-history traits in lacertid lizards: a comparative study. list("American Naturalist") , list("149") , 91--111. See a data description at list("http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/R/pdf/pps063.pdf") (in French).

dataset_description: This package is devoted to exploratory analysis of phylogenetic comparative data. It re-implements and extends phylogenetic procedures from the list("ade4") package (which are now deprecated). list()
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Adequacy of probabilistic models and and general purpose optimization
dataset_description: The main application concerns to a new robust optimization package with two major contributions. The first contribution refers to the assessment of the adequacy of probabilistic models through a combination of several statistics, which measure the relative quality of statistical models for a given data set. The second one provides a general purpose optimization method based on meta-heuristics functions for maximizing or minimizing an arbitrary objective function.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Aarset, M. V. (1987). How to identify bathtub hazard rate. IEEE Transactions Reliability, 36, 106-108. Becker, R. A., Chambers, J. M. and Wilks, A. R. (1988) The New S Language. Wadsworth & Brooks/Cole. Beni G, Wang J (1993). Swarm intelligence in cellular robotic systems. pp. 703-712. Chen, G., Balakrishnan, N. (1995). A general purpose approximate goodness-of-fit test. Journal of Quality Technology 27, 154-16. Eberhart RC, Kennedy J (1995). A new optimizer using particle swarm theory. In Proceedings of the sixth international symposium on micro machine and human science, volume 1, pp. 39-43. New York, NY. Kennedy J, Kennedy JF, Eberhart RC, Shi Y (2001). Swarm intelligence. Morgan Kaufmann. Nichols, M.D, Padgett, W.J. (2006). A Bootstrap control chart for Weibull percentiles. Quality and Reliability Engineering International 22, 141-151. Shi Y, Eberhart R (1998). A modified particle swarm optimizer. In Evolutionary Computation Proceedings, 1998. IEEE World Congress on Computational Intelligence., The 1998 IEEE International Conference on, pp. 69-73. IEEE.

dataset_title: DNA sequences of Tephritids to use as an example dataset for package adhoc.
dataset_description: DNA sequences (326 sequences of 656 base pairs) of the cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (COI) gene of Tephritids (Diptera) (see Virgilio et al. 2012) to use as an example dataset for package adhoc (Sonet et al. 2013).
dataset_format: 326 DNA sequences in binary format stored in a matrix.
dataset_reference: Sonet G, Jordaens K, Nagy ZT, Breman FC, De Meyer M, Backeljau T & Virgilio M", "(2013) Adhoc: an R package to calculate ad hoc distance thresholds for DNA barcoding identification, Zookeys, 365:329-336. http://zookeys.pensoft.net/articles.php?id=3057. Virgilio M, Jordaens K, Breman FC, Backeljau T, De Meyer M. (2012) Identifying insects with incomplete DNA barcode libraries, African Fruit flies (Diptera: Tephritidae) as a test case. PLoS ONE 7(2) e31581. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0031581.

dataset_title: Calculation of ad hoc distance thresholds for DNA barcoding identification.
dataset_description: The ad hoc distance threshold (see Virgilio et al. 2012) can be calculated for each particular reference library of DNA barcodes. Using this distance threshold in the "best close match method" (a method where a species name assignment is rejected when the distance between the query and its best match in a reference dataset is above the threshold) will provide identifications with an estimated relative error probability that is fixed by the user (e.g. 5%).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Sonet G, Jordaens K, Nagy ZT, Breman FC, De Meyer M, Backeljau T & Virgilio M", "(2013) Adhoc: an R package to calculate ad hoc distance thresholds for DNA barcoding identification, Zookeys, 365:329-336. http://zookeys.pensoft.net/articles.php?id=3057. Virgilio M, Jordaens K, Breman FC, Backeljau T, De Meyer M. (2012) Identifying insects with incomplete DNA barcode libraries, African Fruit flies (Diptera: Tephritidae) as a test case. PLoS ONE 7(2) e31581. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0031581.

dataset_format: A list of functions on seven leaves. The outputs of these functions are list(list("agraph")) objects.

dataset_description: Kind of obsolete since the introduction of list(list("all_graphs")) . A comprehensive listing of all the four unrooted trees with eight leaves. The position of the root can be moved later with the function list(list("make_an_outgroup"))
dataset_format: A list of functions on eight leaves. The outputs of these functions are list(list("agraph")) objects.

dataset_description: Kind of obsolete since the introduction of list(list("all_graphs")) . A comprehensive listing of all the list(list("132")) admixture graphs with five leaves and at most two admixture events. Our convention is that the position of the root does not matter (as long as it's not after an admixture event) and that graphs that have list("eyes") , two inner nodes with the property that all the paths between any two leaves visits both or neither of them, are excluded. The reason is that the list(list("f")) statistics can't detect the exact position of the root or distinguish between an eye and a simple branch. The position of the root can be moved later with the function list(list("make_an_outgroup"))
dataset_format: A list of functions on five leaves and a parameter list("permutations") which is list("FALSE") by default. The outputs of these functions are either single list(list("agraph")) objects with the input vector as leaves, or if list("TRUE") , lists of all the possible objects with that leaf set up to symmetry.

dataset_description: Kind of obsolete since the introduction of list(list("all_graphs")) . A comprehensive listing of all the list(list("37")) admixture graphs with four leaves and at most two admixture events. Our convention is that the position of the root does not matter (as long as it's not after an admixture event) and that graphs that have list("eyes") , two inner nodes with the property that all the paths between any two leaves visits both or neither of them, are excluded. The reason is that the list(list("f")) statistics  can't detect the exact position of the root or distinguish between an eye and a simple branch. The position of the root can be moved later with the function list(list("make_an_outgroup"))
dataset_format: A list of functions on four leaves and a parameter list("permutations") which is list("FALSE") by default. The outputs of these functions are either single list(list("agraph")) objects with the input vector as leaves, or if list("TRUE") , lists of all the possible objects with that leaf set up to symmetry.

dataset_description: Kind of obsolete since the introduction of list(list("all_graphs")) . A comprehensive listing of all the list(list("48")) admixture graphs with seven leaves and at most one admixture event. Our convention is that the position of the root does not matter (as long as it's not after an admixture event) and that graphs that have list("eyes") , two inner nodes with the property that all the paths between any two leaves visits both or neither of them, are excluded. The reason  is that the list(list("f")) statistics can't detect the exact position of the root or distinguish between an eye and a simple branch. The position of the root can be moved later with the function list(list("make_an_outgroup"))
dataset_format: A list of functions on seven leaves and a parameter list("permutations") which is list("FALSE") by default. The outputs of these functions are either single list(list("agraph")) objects with the input vector as leaves, or if list("TRUE") , lists of all the possible objects with that leaf set up to symmetry.

dataset_description: Kind of obsolete since the introduction of list(list("all_graphs")) . A comprehensive listing of all the list(list("21")) admixture graphs with six leaves and at most one admixture event. Our convention is that the position of the root does not matter (as long as it's not after an admixture event) and that graphs that have list("eyes") , two inner nodes with the property that all the paths between any two leaves visits both or neither of them, are excluded. The reason  is that the list(list("f")) statistics can't detect the exact position of the root or distinguish between an eye and a simple branch. The position of the root can be moved later with the function list(list("make_an_outgroup"))
dataset_format: A list of functions on six leaves and a parameter list("permutations") which is list("FALSE") by default. The outputs of these functions are either single list(list("agraph")) objects with the input vector as leaves, or if list("TRUE") , lists of all the possible objects with that leaf set up to symmetry.

dataset_description: 38 by 243 matrix. Each row represents a patient. Each column represents a gene.

dataset_title: Artificial Data Point Pattern from list("spatstat") package.
dataset_description: This is an artificial dataset, for use in testing and demonstrating compatibility between list("spatstat") and list("ads") objects. It is a multitype point pattern in an irregular polygonal window. There are two types of points. The window contains a polygonal hole.
dataset_format: An object of class "ppp" representing a list("spatstat") point pattern.

dataset_title: Spatial pattern of Couepia caryophylloides in Paracou, a canopy tree species of French Guiana.
dataset_description: Spatial pattern of 34 mature individuals and 173 young individuals of the tree species list("Couepia caryophylloides") (Chrysobalanaceae) in a 25-ha forest plot in Paracou, French Guiana.
dataset_format: A list with 4 components: list() list("$rect  ") is a vector of coordinates list(list("(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax)")) of the origin and the opposite corner of a 500 by 500 m rectangular plot. list("$tri   ") is a list of vertice coordinates list(list("(ax,ay,bx,by,cx,cy)")) of contiguous triangles covering swampy parts of the plot. list("$trees ") is a list of tree coordinates list(list("(x,y)")) . list("$stage ") is a factor with 2 levels list(list("(\"mature\",\"young\")"))
dataset_source: Collinet, F. 1997. list("Essai de regroupement des principales espèces structurantes d'une foret dense humide d'après l'analyse de leur répartition spatiale (foret de Paracou - Guyane).") Thèse de doctorat, Université Claude Bernard, Lyon, France.
dataset_reference: Goreaud, F. & Pélissier, R. 2003. Avoiding misinterpretation of biotic interactions with the intertype list("K12") -function: population independence vs. random labelling hypotheses. list("Journal of Vegetation Science") , 14: 681-692.

dataset_title: Spatial pattern of oaks suffering from frost shake in Allogny, France.
dataset_description: Spatial pattern of sound and splited oaks ( list("Quercus petraea") ) suffering from frost shake in a 2.35-ha plot in Allogny, France.
dataset_format: A list with 4 components: list() list("$rect   ") is a vector of coordinates list(list("(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax)")) of the origin and the opposite corner of a 125 by 188 m square plot. list("$trees  ") is a list of tree coordinates list(list("(x,y)")) . list("$status ") is a factor with 2 levels list(list("(\"splited\",\"sound\")"))
dataset_source: Grandjean, G., Jabiol, B., Bruchiamacchie, M. and Roustan, F. 1990. list("Recherche de corrélations entre les paramètres édaphiques, et plus spécialement texture, hydromorphie et drainage interne, et la réponse individuelle des chenes sessiles et pédonculés à la gélivure.") Rapport de recherche ENITEF, Nogent sur Vernisson, France.
dataset_reference: Goreaud, F. & Pélissier, R. 2003. Avoiding misinterpretation of biotic interactions with the intertype list("K12") -function: population independence vs. random labelling hypotheses. list("Journal of Vegetation Science") , 14: 681-692.

dataset_title: Tree spatial pattern in control plot 15, Paracou experimental station, French Guiana
dataset_description: Spatial pattern of 4128 trees of 332 diffrent species in a 250 m X 250 m control plot in Paracou experimental station, French Guiana.
dataset_format: A list with 5 components: list() list("$rect     ") is a vector of coordinates list(list("(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax)")) of the origin and the opposite corner of a 250 by 250 m rectangular plot. list("$trees    ") is a list of tree coordinates list(list("(x,y)")) . list("$species  ") is a factor with 332 levels corresponding to species names of the trees. list("$spdist ") is an object of class list("\"dist\"") giving between-species distances based on functional traits (see Paine et al. 2011).
dataset_source: Gourlet-Fleury, S., Ferry, B., Molino, J.-F., Petronelli, P. & Schmitt, L. 2004. list("Exeprimental plots: key features.") Pp. 3-60 In Gourlet-Fleury, S., Guehl, J.-M. & Laroussinie, O. (Eds.), Ecology and Managament of a Neotropical rainforest - Lessons drawn from Paracou, a long-term experimental research site in French Guiana. Elsevier SAS, France.
dataset_reference: Paine, C. E. T., Baraloto, C., Chave, J. & HÃ©rault, B. 2011. Functional traits of individual trees reveal ecological constraints on community assembly in tropical rain forests. list("Oikos") , 120: 720-727. list()

dataset_title: Tree spatial pattern in Beau Poirier plot, Haye forest, France
dataset_description: Spatial pattern of 162 beeches, 72 oaks and 3 hornbeams in a 1-ha 140 yr-old temperate forest plot in Haye, France.
dataset_format: A list with 8 components: list() list("$rect    ") is a vector of coordinates list(list("(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax)")) of the origin and the opposite corner of a 110 by 90 m rectangular plot. list("$tri1    ") is a list of vertice coordinates list(list("(ax,ay,bx,by,cx,cy)")) of contiguous triangles covering the denser part of the plot. list("$tri2    ") of contiguous triangles covering the sparser part of the plot. list("$poly1   ") list(list("(x,y)")) of the polygon enclosing list("BPoirier$tri1") . list("$poly2   ") is a list of two polygons vertice coordinates enclosing list("BPoirier$tri2") list("$trees   ") is a list of tree coordinates list("$species ") is a factor with 3 levels list(list("(\"beech\",\"oak\",\"hornbeam\")")) corresponding to species names of the trees. list("$dbh     ") is a vector of tree size (diameter at breast height in cm).
dataset_source: Pardé, J. 1981. De 1882 à 1976/80 : les places d'expèrience de sylviculture du hetre en foret domainiale de Haye. list("Revue Forestière Française") , 33: 41-64.
dataset_reference: Goreaud, F. 2000. list("Apports de l'analyse de la structure spatiale en foret tempérée à l'étude et la modélisation des peuplements complexes") . Thèse de doctorat, ENGREF, Nancy, France. list() Pélissier, R. & Goreaud, F. 2001. A practical approach to the study of spatial structure in simple cases of heterogeneous vegetation. list("Journal of Vegetation Science") , 12: 99-108.

dataset_description: The data set provides simulated allele calls for 50 individuals from 3 populations. We consider a simple admixture scenario where two ancestral populations, popA (sample size list(list("n_A = 15")) ) and popB (sample size list(list("n_B = 15")) ), merged 160 generations ago to form the admixed population, popAB (sample size list(list("n_{AB} = 20")) ). The ancestral populations contributed to the admixed population with probability 0.5.
dataset_format:
List with the following entries list("
", "  ", list(), " ", list(list("data")), ":  3,000 x 50 data matrix with 3,000 genotype calls (rows) versus 50 individuals (columns). Raw entries take the value 0 if heterozygous, and -1 or 1 if homozygous. SNPs are ordered by their physical positions. Column names list individual IDs, row names list SNP IDs.
", "  ", list(), " ", list(list("map")), ":  3,000 x 2 data matrix providing mapping to genetic distance (", list("recombination distance"), ") for each SNP.
", "  ", list(), " ", 
    list(list("colplot")), ":  vector of length 50. Plotting color for each individual. 
", "  ", list(), " ", list(list("populations")), ":  list of length 3. Character vectors giving the IDs of individuals in each population. IDs must map to the column names of the data matrix.
")
dataset_reference: Sanderson, J., H. Sudoyo, T.M. Karafet, M.F. Hammer and M.P. Cox. 2015. Reconstructing past admixture processes from local genomic ancestry using wavelet transformation. list("Genetics") 200:469-481. Chen G.K., P. Marjoram and J.D. Wall. 2009. Fast and flexible simulation of DNA sequence data. list("Genome Research") 19:136-142. doi:10.1101 gr.083634.108.

dataset_title: Wavelet Analysis of Genomic Data from Admixed Populations
dataset_description: Implements wavelet-based approaches for describing population admixture. Principal Components Analysis (PCA) is used to define the population structure and produce a localized admixture signal for each individual. Wavelet summaries of the PCA output describe variation present in the data and can be related to population-level demographic processes. For more details, see Sanderson et al. (2015).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Sanderson, J., H. Sudoyo, T.M. Karafet, M.F. Hammer and M.P. Cox. 2015. Reconstructing past admixture processes from local genomic ancestry using wavelet transformation. list("Genetics") 200:469-481.

dataset_description: A sample data set containing trading interval price and demand data sourced from the AEMO website on or about 21 June 2014. This was downloaded and collated using list(list("collate_aemo_data")) .
dataset_format: list("\"REGION\"") (factor), list("\"SETTLEMENTDATE\"") (POSIXct), list("\"TOTALDEMAND\"") (numeric), list("\"RRP\"") (numeric) and list("\"PERIODTYPE\"") (factor).

dataset_description: Allows to compute the affluence (richness) indices (affluence gap, income share of the top p %, richness headcount ratio, concave and convex measures of affluence) and to construct the confidence intervals for affluence indices. The richness line is defined by the user as multiple of the income median. Additionally, this package allows also to compute the Wolfson polarization index.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: 1. Alichi A., Kantenga K., Sol<e9> J. (2016) Income polarization in the United States. IMF Working Paper, WP/16/121. list() 2. Brzezi<f1>ski M. (2010) Income affluence in Poland. list("Social Indicators Research") , 99, pp. 285-299. 3. Medeiros M. (2006) The rich and the poor: the construction of an affluence line from the poverty line. , 78, pp. 1-18. 4. Peichl A., Schaefer T., Scheicher C. (2008) Measuring richness and poverty - A micro data application to Europe and Germany. IZA Discussion Paper No. 3790, Institute for the Study of Labor (IZA). 5. S<b1>czewska-Piotrowska A. (2015) Identification of determinants of income richness using logistic regression model. list("Zarz<b1>dzanie i Finanse. Journal of Management and Finance") , 4, Part 2, pp. 241-259 (in Polish). 6. Wolfson M.C. (1994) When inequalities diverge, list("The American Economic Review") , 84, pp. 353-358.

dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Calculate the 1D Power Spectral Density; returns a data table of PSD 1D and PSD 2D values against spatial frequencies. list() As mentionned in Sidick2009, this function calculates the PSD against spatial frequencies in 1D from list(list("PSD2DAgainstFrequency")) by using breaks in the log space to sum PSD 2D and frequency values.
dataset_description: Calculate the 1D Power Spectral Density; returns a data table of PSD 1D and PSD 2D values against spatial frequencies. list() As mentionned in Sidick2009, this function calculates the PSD against spatial frequencies in 1D from list(list("PSD2DAgainstFrequency")) by using breaks in the log space to sum PSD 2D and frequency values.
