dataset_description: The arf3DS4 "fmri.data" class contains the header information and data of an ANALYZE/NIFTI functional volume. It is essentially a list(list("nifti.header")) object with an added "datavec" slot.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: See the Nifti homepage ( list("http://nifti.nimh.nih.gov/") ) for more information on the nifti filetype.

dataset_description: The "data" class contains all information on the fMRI data of one condition of a subject. Specifically it contains filenames of the datafiles (with full paths) and some basic information of the data, the number of runs, and additional files used by ARF. Each instance of a list(list("model")) class object inherits a "data" object. The "data" class also uses some slots of the list(list("experiment")) class.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Simulated dataset for the ARF3DS4 package. Run list("makeExample(path)") to create an ARF directory structure in 'path'. The experiment is automatically loaded.
dataset_format: An ARF experiment for one subject ('wouter'), and one condition ('A').

dataset_title: Activated Region Fitting fMRI data analysis
dataset_description: Activated Region Fitting (ARF) is an analysis method for fMRI data. The ARF method uses Gaussian shaped functions to model active brain regions. An entire fMRI volume can be described by multiple parameterized Gaussian regions of activation. This parameterization allows for hypotheses on the location of an active region, the spatial extent of an active region, and the amplitude of an active region. ARF can be invoked after standard GLM analysis, and uses the beta-values or t-values from this analysis. In addition ARF can be used to estimate functional connectivity, for this the raw time-series (on which the GLM was performed) are also needed. The arf3DS4 package can read and write fMRI data in Nifti format ( list(list("fmri.data")) ). It is build to be compatible with fMRI analysis packages (e.g. FSL or SPM). The package uses a predefined directory- and file-structure to store its data. All objects (S4-class) and fMRI data files are stored in this directory- and file-structure.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference:
list(list("l"), list("
", "Wouter D. Weeda, Lourens J. Waldorp, Ingrid Christoffels and Hilde M. Huizenga (2009). Activated Region Fitting: A Robust High-Power Method for fMRI Analysis Using Parameterized Regions of Activation. Human Brain Mapping, 30(8), 2595-2605.", list(), "
", "Wouter D. Weeda, Lourens J. Waldorp, Raoul P.P.P. Grasman, Simon van Gaal and Hilde M. Huizenga (2011). Functional Connectivity Analysis of fMRI Data Using Parameterized Regions of Interest. NeuroImage, 54(1), 410-416.", 
    list(), "
", "Wouter D. Weeda, Frank de Vos, Lourens J. Waldorp, Raoul P.P.P. Grasman, Hilde M. Huizenga (2011). arf3DS4: An Integrated Framework for Localization and Connectivity Analysis of fMRI Data. Journal of Statistical Software, 44(14), 1-33. URL ", list("http://www.jstatsoft.org/v44/i14/"), " ", list(), "
"))

dataset_description: The arf3DS4 class "settings" contains the names of all directories and files used by the arf3DS4 package. Default values are available for the "settings" class and adjusting the slot values is usually not necessary. An object of class "settings" is contained in the list(list("experiment")) class.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The "experiment" class is the backbone of the arf3DS4 package. The class contains information on the names of all relevant directories and files (these are inherited from an "settings" object (see list(list("settings")) )). Before running an ARF analysis an object of class "experiment" must be loaded (using list(list("loadExp")) ). Experiment directories can be created using list(list("makeExpDirs")) . To view information on an experiment call list(list("getExp")) .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The arf3DS4 "functional" class contains information on the functional volume where the fMRI beta-files were estimated on. It links the data of the different runs with the raw time-series files, primarily for connectivity analysis. To link runs to raw time-series call list(list("setFuncTimings")) .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The arf3DS4 "nifti.fileinfo" class contains the basic file information needed to read/write an ANALYZE/NIFTI header.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: See the Nifti homepage ( list("http://nifti.nimh.nih.gov/") ) for more information on the nifti filetype.

dataset_description: The arf3DS4 "nifti.header" class contains the header information of an ANALYZE/NIFTI functional volume.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: See the Nifti homepage ( list("http://nifti.nimh.nih.gov/") ) for more information on the nifti filetype.

dataset_description: The arf3DS4 model class contains all information on a (fitted) model. It extends the "data" class directly, since it uses the files specified there to fit the model. The "model" class contains information on file locations and filenames. More importantly it contains information on the fitted model: parameter estimates, parameter (co)variance matrix, statistical test information, fit indices, convergence information, warnings, etc.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: The arf3DS4 registration class contains information on the conversion matrices for brain registration purposes. It is used to convert ARF models to standard space (MNI152), and to structural (T1) images. It is also used to look up the location of activated regions in standard atlases (Harvard-Oxford and Talairach). The "registration" class is optional, for it to work properly a functioning installation of FSL is required.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: See list("http://www.fmrib.ox.ac.uk/fsl/") on how to obtain FSL and licences. See list("http://www.fmrib.ox.ac.uk/fsl/data/atlas-descriptions.html") on information on the atlases.

dataset_description: This dataset was synthetically generated for a 3x3 completely randomized design, as shown in Table 1 of the paper: Higgins, J. J., Blair, R. C. and Tashtoush, S. (1990). The aligned rank transform procedure. Proceedings of the Conference on Applied Statistics in Agriculture. Manhattan, Kansas: Kansas State University, pp. 185-195. Columns Aligned_Row_Column and Ranks_Row_Column of the result correspond to the values of Table 3 of the same paper.
dataset_format: A table of 3 columns: two factors called Row and Column, and the Response variable. Loading this file gives access to the dataframe object list("data.higgins1990")
dataset_source: File Higgins1990-Table1.csv of the ARTool zipped downloadable file: list("http://depts.washington.edu/aimgroup/proj/art/ARToolExe.zip")
dataset_reference: Higgins, J. J., Blair, R. C. and Tashtoush, S. (1990). The aligned rank transform procedure. Proceedings of the Conference on Applied Statistics in Agriculture. Manhattan, Kansas: Kansas State University, pp. 185-195. Wobbrock, J.O., Findlater, L., Gergle, D. and Higgins, J.J. (2011). The Aligned Rank Transform for nonparametric factorial analyses using only ANOVA procedures. Proceedings of the ACM Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI '11). New York: ACM Press, pp. 143-146. ARTool: free visual software tool implementing ART, written in the C# language : list("http://depts.washington.edu/aimgroup/proj/art/")

dataset_description: Beveridge Wheat Price Index which gives annual price data from 1500 to 1869.
dataset_reference: R. T. Baillie (1996): Long Memory Processes and Fractional Integration in Econometrics. Journal of Econometrics, 73, 5-59.

dataset_title: Series A from Box and Jenkins
dataset_description: Chemical process concentration readings every two hours is comprised of 197 consecutive observations. Box and Jenkins fit ARMA(1,1) and ARIMA(0,1,1) to this data.
dataset_source: listed in Box and Jenkins book
dataset_reference: Box and Jenkins (1970). Time Series Analysis: Forecasting and Control.

dataset_description: Mean Annual unregulated riverflows of the St.  Lawrence River at Ogdensburg, N.Y. from 1860 to 1957 is comprised of 97 consecutive observations.
dataset_format: The format is: Time-Series [1:97] from 1860 to 1956: 7788 8040 7733 7528 7528 ...
dataset_source: Hipel, K.W. and McLeod, A.I., (1994, 2005). Time Series Modelling of Water Resources and Environmental Systems. Electronic reprint of our book orginally published in 1994. list("http://www.stats.uwo.ca/faculty/aim/1994Book/") .

dataset_title: Turbulent flow data from Station SB32
dataset_description: Turbulent flow water time series, Lake Huron, during 2009-2010. Sampled every second.
dataset_reference: M.M. Meerschaert, Farzad Sabzikar, M.S. Phanikumar, and A. Zeleke, Tempered fractional time series model for turbulence in geophysical flows, Journal of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment, Vol. 2014 p. P09023 (13 pp.) doi:10.1088/1742-5468/2014/09/P09023.

dataset_title: Tree-ring indicies for Douglas Fir, Colorado, 1107-1964.
dataset_description: Tree-ring indicies for Douglas Fir, Colorado, 1107-1964. There are 858 consecutive values. When the environment is suboptimal, tree ring growth is limited by the climate, usually either ambient temperature or precipitation. For this tree-ring time series, the tree is located on a mountain and the limiting growth factor is temperature.
dataset_source: Laboratory of Tree-ring Research (LTRR), The University of Arizona list("http://ltrr.arizona.edu/")
dataset_reference: Fritts, H.C. et al. (1971) Multivariate techniques for specifying tree-growth and climatic relationships and for reconstructing anomalies in Paleoclimate. Journal of Applied Meteorology, 10, pp.845-864. Hipel, K.W. and McLeod, A.I. (1994). Time Series Modelling of Water Resources and Environmental Systems. Elsevier. list("http://www.stats.uwo.ca/faculty/aim/1994Book/default.htm") McLeod, A.I. & Hipel, K.W. (1978), Preservation of the rescaled adjusted range, Water Resources Research 14, 491-516.

dataset_title: Nile Annual Minima, 622 AD to 1284 AD
dataset_description: Annual Minimum flow of Nile River. See below for details.
dataset_format: The format is: Time-Series [1:663] from 622 to 1284: 11.57 10.88 11.69 11.69 9.84 ... - attr(*, "title")= chr "#Nile River minima series"
dataset_source: Toussoun, O. (1925). Memoire sur l'Histoire du Nil. In Memoires a l'Institut d'Egypte, 18, 366-404.
dataset_reference: Beran, J. (1994). Statistics for Long-Memory Processes. Chapman and Hall, New York. Percival, D.B. and Walden, A.T. (2000) Wavelet Methods for Time Series Analysis. Cambridge University Press.

dataset_title: Drosphila life cycyle time series by Arbeitman et al 2002.
dataset_description: Gene expression time series for 4028 genes involved in the life cycle of Drosophila melanogaster. The microarray data measured gene expression levels during all four major stages of morphogenesis: embryo, larva, pupa and adult (67 time points). Data published in Arbeitman et al. (2002) and used in Lebre et al. (2010)
dataset_format: A matrix of 4028 row (genes) by 67 columns (timepoints) containing the gene expression time series.
dataset_source: The data has been published in Arbeitman et al (2002).
dataset_reference: Gene expression during the life cycle of Drosophila melanogaster. M.N Arbeitman, E.E.M. Furlong, F. Imam, E. Johson, B.H. Null, B.S. Baker, M.A. Krasnow, M.P. Scott, R.W. Davis and K.P. White.  Science, 297(5590):2270-2275, 2002. Statistical inference of the time-varying structure of gene-regulation networks S. Lebre, J. Becq, F. Devaux, M. P. H. Stumpf, G. Lelandais, BMC Systems Biology, 2010, 4:130.

dataset_description: Simulated gene expression time series for 55 genes and 30 timepoints generated as in Lebre et al (2010). In the simulation model, every gene may be target gene but only genes 51 to 55 are parent genes.
dataset_format: A matrix of 55 row (genes) by 30 columns (timepoints).
dataset_reference: Statistical inference of the time-varying structure of gene-regulation networks S. Lebre, J. Becq, F. Devaux, M. P. H. Stumpf, G. Lelandais, BMC Systems Biology, 2010, 4:130.

dataset_title: Set of possible priors for the number of changepoints (CPs) or incoming edges.
dataset_description: Set of possible priors used in the list(list("ARTIVAsubnet")) function for the number of changepoints (resp. incoming edges) according to a given number of maximum changepoints list("maxCP") (resp. incoming Edges list("maxPred") ) when parameters ( list("alphaCP") , list("betaCP") for the CPs or list("alphaEdges") list("betaEdges") for the edges) in function are set to default (alpha=1, beta=0.5). In the procedure, the number of CPs (respectively the number of incoming edges) is sampled from a truncated Poisson with mean lambda, where lambda is  drawn from an Inverse Gamma distribution (alpha, beta), see Lebre et al. (2010) for more details.
dataset_format: A matrix of 96 rows by 44 columns (kmax, alpha, beta and the probability for k=0 to 40 according to the chosen values of kmax, alpha and beta).
dataset_reference: Statistical inference of the time-varying structure of gene-regulation networks S. Lebre, J. Becq, F. Devaux, M. P. H. Stumpf, G. Lelandais, BMC Systems Biology, 2010, 4:130.

dataset_description: This dataset was produced by Lucau-Danila et al. (2005). In this study the authors measured the changes in the mRNA concentrations for each gene at successive times after addition of an antimitotic drug (benomyl), in the growth media of Saccharomyces cerevisiae cells. Parallel experiments were conducted in different genetic contexts: the wild type strain and knock out (KO) strains in which the genes coding for different transcription factors connected to drug response (YAP1, PDR1, PDR3 and YRR1) were deleted. For 78 genes, the measured expression values for 5 different time points (at 30s, 2min, 4min, 10min and 20min) are available, in each yeast strains (WT, DeltaYAP1, DeltaPDR1, DeltaPDR3 and DeltaYRR1). These genes are divided into 18 clusters of genes with condordant transcription profiles. In this context, regulatory associations between parent and target genes are proposed if the deletion of a parent gene significantly alters the expression measurements of the target genes.
dataset_format:
A list that comprises information for the 18 clusters of genes whose expression is identically modified in strains deleted for YAP1, PDR1, PDR3 and YRR1 transcription factors, compared to the wild type strain. Detailed description and more information concerning these clusters can be found in Lebre et al. (2010). list("
", " ", list(list(list("Cluster 1")), list("
", "Experimental data for genes that belong to the Cluster 1.
", list("yeast$Cluster1"), " is a list composed of the following elements:
", "1) ", list("yeast$Cluster1$InitialCluster"), ": A matrix with in row the genes that belong to 
", "Cluster 1 and in column the different experimental measurements related to the 
", "wild type strain (WT), and strains deleted for the transcription factor YAP1 
", "(DeltaYAP1), PDR1 (DeltaPDR1), PDR3 (DeltaPDR3) and YRR1 (DeltaYRR1). For each
", 
    "genetic context, 5 time points are available T1 = 30s, T2 = 2min, T3 = 4min,
", "T4 = 10min and T5 = 20min.
", "2) ", list("yeast$Cluster1$targetData"), ": A vector with all gene expression measurements 
", "correctly formatted to be analyzed with the ", list(list("ARTIVAsubnet")), " function.
", "3) ", list("yeast$Cluster1$targetName"), ": The name of the analyzed cluster.
", "4) ", list("yeast$Cluster1$GeneList"), ": A vector with the names of the genes that belong to 
", "the analyzed cluster.
", 
    "5) ", list("yeast$Cluster1$parentData"), ": A matrix with in row the four transcription factors 
", "for which the corresponding genes were deleted (independantly) in knock out 
", "strains. 1 = the gene coding for the transcription factor is present and 0 = 
", "the gene coding for the transcription factor is deleted. This matrix is 
", "correctly formatted to be analyzed with the ", list(list("ARTIVAsubnet")), " function, therefore
", "searching for regulatory interactions between YAP1, PDR1, PDR3 and YRR1 
", 
    "transcription factors and the genes that belong to the analyzed cluster.
", "6) ", list("yeast$Cluster1$dataDescription"), " : A vector indicating the
", "ordering of the time measurements in the ", list("targetData"), " and
", list("parentData"), " variables.
")), "
", list(list(list("Cluster2 to 18")), list("Experimental data for genes that belong to the Cluster 2 to 18 (see the documentation for Cluster 1).")), "
")
dataset_source: Expression data were obtained from the website: list("http://www.biologie.ens.fr/lgmgml/publication/benomyl/")
dataset_reference: The Early Expression of Yeast Genes Affected by Chemical Stress A. Lucau-Danila, G. Lelandais, Z. Kozovska, V. Tanty, T. Delaveau, F. Devaux and C. Jacq., Mol Cell Biol., 25(5):1860-8, 2005. Statistical inference of the time-varying structure of gene regulation networks S. Lebre, J. Becq, F. Devaux, MP Stumpf, G. Lelandais., BMC Systems Biology 4:130, 2010.

dataset_title: Split-plot Experiment Examining Effect of Moisture and Fertilizer on Dry Matter in Peat Pots
dataset_description: This dataset comes from a split-plot experiment examining list("Tray") s of 4 peat pots each. list("Moisture") was varied between s (i.e. it was the whole-plot treatment) and list("Fertilizer") was varied within s (i.e. it was the sub-plot treatment). The outcome measure was list("DryMatter") .

", "     ", list(list("DryMatter"), list("a numeric vector")), " 
")

dataset_description: The list to describe the options that are used in list(list("sARTP")) , list(list("rARTP")) . It will be set by function list(list("options.default")) by default.
dataset_format:
The format is a list. list("
", "  ", list(list(list("out.dir")), list("output directory for temporary and output files. The default is the working directory ", list(list("getwd")), ". ")), "
", "  ", list(list(list("id.str")), list("character string that is appended to temporary file names. The default is "PID". ")), "
", "  ", list(list(list("seed")), list("integer for random number generation. The default is 1. ")), "
", "  ") list("Options for testing an association: ") list("
", "  ", list(list(list("method")), list("1 = AdaJoint, 2 = AdaJoint2, 3 = ARTP. The default is 3. It can also be 'AdaJoint', 'AdaJoint2', or 'ARTP'. The package will convert it into upper case, so for example, 'Adajoint' is also accepted. The ARTP method was the proposed in Yu et al. (2009) Genet Epi, while AdaJoint and AdaJoint2 methods were proposed in Zhang et al. (2014) EJHG. Note that AdaJoint2 could be more powerful if (1) two functional SNPs are negative correlated and have effects in the same direction; or (2) two functional SNPs are positively correlated and have opposite directions of their effects. ")), 
    "
", "  ", list(list(list("nperm")), list("the number of permutations. The default is 1E5. ")), "
", "  ", list(list(list("nthread")), list("the number of threads for multi-threaded processors in Unix/Linux OS. The default is ", list("detectCores()"), " to use all available processors. ")), "
", "  ") list("Options for controlling data cleaning: ") list("
", "    ", list(list(list("snp.miss.rate")), list("any SNP with missing rate greater than ", list("snp.miss.rate"), " will be removed from the analysis. The default is 0.05. ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("maf")), list("any SNP with minor allele frequency less than ", list("maf"), " will be removed from the analysis. The default is 0.05. ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("HWE.p")), list("any SNP with HWE exact p-value less than ", list("HWE.p"), " will be removed from the analysis. The test is applied to the genotype data or reference data. The test is ignored if the imputed genotype are not encoded as 0/1/2. The default is 1E-5. ")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("gene.R2")), list("a number between 0 and 1 to filter out SNPs that are highly correlated within each gene. The ", list(list("cor")), " function will be called to compute the R^2 values between each pair of SNPs and remove one SNP with lower MAF in each pair with R^2 greater than ", list("gene.R2"), ". The default is 0.95. ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("chr.R2")), list("a number between 0 and 1 to filter out SNPs that are highly correlated within each chromosome. The ", 
        list(list("cor")), " function will be called to compute the R^2 values between each pair of SNPs and remove one SNP with lower MAF in each pair with R^2 greater than ", list("chr.R2"), ". The default is 0.95. ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("gene.miss.rate")), list("threshold to remove genes based on their missing rate. Genes with missing rate greater than ", list("gene.miss.rate"), " will be removed from the analysis. dataset_description: The list("Groceries") data set contains 1 month (30 days) of real-world point-of-sale transaction data from a typical local grocery outlet.  The data set contains 9835 transactions and the items are aggregated to 169 categories. If you use this data set in your paper, please refer to the paper in the references section.
dataset_format: Object of class list("transactions") .
dataset_source: The data set is provided for arules by Michael Hahsler, Kurt Hornik and Thomas Reutterer.
dataset_reference: Michael Hahsler, Kurt Hornik, and Thomas Reutterer (2006) Implications of probabilistic data modeling for mining association rules. In M. Spiliopoulou, R. Kruse, C. Borgelt, A. Nuernberger, and W. Gaul, editors, list("From Data and\n", "Information Analysis to Knowledge Engineering, Studies in Classification, Data\n", "Analysis, and Knowledge Organization") , pages 598--605. Springer-Verlag.

dataset_description: The list("Epub") data set contains the download history of documents from the electronic publication platform of the Vienna University of Economics and Business Administration. The data was recorded between Jan 2003 and Dec 2008.
dataset_format: Object of class list(list("transactions")) with 15729 transactions and 936 items. Item labels are document IDs of the from list("\"doc\\_11d\"") . Session IDs and time stamps for transactions are also provided.
dataset_source: Provided by Michael Hahsler from ePub-WU at list("http://epub.wu-wien.ac.at") .

dataset_description: The list("Mushroom") data set includes descriptions of hypothetical samples corresponding to 23 species of gilled mushrooms in the Agaricus and Lepiota Family. It contains information about 8124 mushrooms (transactions). 4208 (51.8%) are edible and 3916 (48.2%) are poisonous. The data contains 22 nomoinal features plus the class attribure (edible or not). These features were translated into 114 items.
dataset_format: Object of class list("transactions") .
dataset_source: The data set was obtained from the UCI Machine Learning Repository at list("http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Mushroom") .
dataset_reference: Alfred A. Knopf (1981). Mushroom records drawn from The Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Mushrooms. G. H. Lincoff (Pres.), New York.

dataset_description: A small example database for weighted association rule mining provided as an object of class list(list("transactions")) .
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: K. Sun and F. Bai (2008). Mining Weighted Association Rules without Preassigned Weights. list("IEEE Transactions on Knowledge\n", "    and Data Engineering") , 4 (30), 489--495.

dataset_description: The list("IncomeESL") data set originates from an example in the book list("The Elements of Statistical Learning") (see Section source).  The data set is an extract from this survey.  It consists of 8993 instances (obtained from the original data set with 9409 instances, by removing those observations with the annual income missing) with 14 demographic attributes. The data set is a good mixture of categorical and continuous variables with a lot of missing data.  This is characteristic of data mining applications. list("Income") data set contains the data already prepared and coerced to list(list("transactions")) .

dataset_title: Class associations - A Set of Associations
dataset_description: The list("associations") class is a virtual class which is extended to represent mining result (e.g., sets of itemsets or rules).  The class provides accessors for the quality slot and a method for sorting the associations.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class transactions --- Binary Incidence Matrix for Transactions
dataset_description: The list("transactions") class represents transaction data used for mining itemsets or rules.  It is a direct extension of class list(list("itemMatrix")) to store a binary incidence matrix, item labels, and optionally transaction IDs and user IDs.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class itemsets --- A Set of Itemsets
dataset_description: The list("itemsets") class represents a set of itemsets and the associated quality measures. Note that the class can also represent a multiset of itemsets with duplicated elements. Duplicated elements can be removed with list(list("unique")) .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class tidLists --- Transaction ID Lists for Items/Itemsets
dataset_description: Transaction ID lists contains a set of lists.  Each list is associated with an item/itemset and stores the IDs of the transactions which support the item/itemset. list("tidLists") uses the class list(list("ngCMatrix")) to efficiently store the transaction ID lists as a sparse matrix.  Each column in the matrix represents one transaction ID list. can be used for different purposes.  For some operations (e.g., support counting) it is efficient to coerce a list(list("transactions")) database into where each list contains the transaction IDs for an item (and the support is given by the length of the list). The implementation of the Eclat mining algorithm (which uses transaction ID list intersection) can also produce transaction ID lists for the found itemsets as part of the returned list(list("itemsets")) object.  These lists can then be used for further computation.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class itemMatrix --- Sparse Binary Incidence Matrix to Represent Sets of Items
dataset_description: The list("itemMatrix") class is the basic building block for transactions, itemsets and rules in package list("arules") . The class contains a sparse Matrix representation of items (a set of itemsets or transactions) and the corresponding item labels.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Methods for "[": Extraction or Subsetting in Package 'arules'
dataset_description: Methods for list("\"[\"") , i.e., extraction or subsetting in package list("arules") . Subsetting can be done by integers containing column/row numbers, vectors of logicals or strings containing parts of item labels.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class rules --- A Set of Rules
dataset_description: The list("rules") class represents a set of rules. Note that the class can also represent a multiset of rules with duplicated elements. Duplicated elements can be removed with list(list("unique")) .
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class APappearance --- Specifying the appearance Argument of Apriori to Implement Rule Templates
dataset_description: Specifies the restrictions on the associations mined by list(list("apriori")) . These restrictions can implement certain aspects of rule templates described by Klemettinen (1994). Note that appearance is only supported by the implementation of .
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Christian Borgelt (2004) list("Apriori --- Finding Association Rules/Hyperedges with the Apriori\n", "    Algorithm") . list("www.borgelt.net/apriori.html") M. Klemettinen, H. Mannila, P. Ronkainen, H. Toivonen and A. I. Verkamo (1994). Finding Interesting Rules from Large Sets of Discovered Association Rules. In list("Proceedings of the Third International Conference \n", "    on Information and Knowledge Management,") 401--407.

dataset_description: This dataset is generated by the method described by Agrawal and Srikant (1994) using the reimplementation in list("arules") which also retains the patterns used in the generation process.
dataset_format: The format is: list("transactions") list("Agrawal.db") list("itemsets") list("Agrawal.pat")
dataset_reference: Rakesh Agrawal and Ramakrishnan Srikant (1994). Fast algorithms for mining association rules in large databases. In Jorge B. Bocca, Matthias Jarke, and Carlo Zaniolo, editors, list("Proceedings\n", "    of the 20th International Conference on Very Large Data Bases,\n", "    VLDB") , pages 487-499, Santiago, Chile.

dataset_description: A small example database for sequence mining provided as an object of class list(list("transactions")) and as a text file.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: M. J. Zaki. (2001). SPADE: An Efficient Algorithm for Mining Frequent Sequences. list("Machine Learning Journal") , list("42") 31--60.

dataset_description: Induce a set of strong sequence rules from a set of frequent sequences, i.e. which (1) satisfy the minimum confidence threshold and (2) which contain the last element of the generating sequence as the right-hand side (consequent) sequence.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Compute the relative or absolute support of an arbitrary collection of sequences among a set of transactions with additional sequence and temporal information.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: list("sequenceInfo") gets or sets information on the elements of a collection of sequences list("ruleInfo") collection of sequence rules. list("itemInfo") gets or sets information on the set of distinct items associated with a collection of sequences. list("timeInfo") gets or sets information on the event times of a collection of timed sequences.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Provides control parameters for the cSPADE algorithm for mining frequent sequences.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Provides the constraint parameters for the cSPADE algorithm for mining frequent sequences.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Represents a collection of sequential rules and their associated quality measure. That is, the elements in the consequent occur at a later time than the elements of the antecedent.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: list("subset") extracts a subset of a collection of sequences or sequence rules which meet conditions specified with respect to their associated (or derived) quality measures, additional information, or patterns of items or itemsets. list("[") extracts subsets from a collection of (timed) sequences or sequence rules. list("unique") extracts the unique set of sequences or sequence rules from a collection of sequences or sequence rules. list("lhs, rhs") extract the left-hand (antecedent) or right-hand side (consequent) sequences from a collection of sequence rules.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Class "timedsequences" --- Collections of Sequences with Timing Information
dataset_description: Represents a collection of (observed) sequences and the associated timing information.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Represents a collection of sequences and the associated quality measures.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: list("timeFrequency") counts the number of occurrences of event times, of the time gaps between the events of a sequence, the minimum or maximum gap of a sequence, or the span of a sequence. list("timeTable") cross-tabulates the above statistics for items or itemsets. For items the sequences are reduced to the events containing the item. list("firstOrder") computes a first order model, i.e. a table of counts of state changes among a collection of timed sequences, where the elements or the times can be the states.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Provides the generic function list("similarity") and the S4 method to compute similarities among a collection of sequences. list("is.subset, is.superset") find subsequence or supersequence relationships among a collection of sequences.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: Data from a Phase II clinical trial of Xeloda and exaliplatin given before surgery to advanced gastric cancer patients with para-aortic lymph node metastasis.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 48 observations on the following 2 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("timeWeeks")), list("survival time in weeks")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("delta")), list("1 for death, 0 for censored")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: This data set contains survival times for two competing causes: time from prostate cancer diagnosis to death from prostate cancer, and time from prostate cancer diagnosis to death from other causes. The data set also contains information on several risk factors. The data in this data set are simulated from detailed competing risk survival curves and counts of numbers of patients per group presented in Lu-Yao et al. (2009). Thus, the simulated data presented here contain many of the characteristics of the original SEER-Medicare prostate cancer data used in Lu-Yao et al. (2009).
dataset_format:
A data frame with 14294 observations on the following 5 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("grade")), list("a factor with levels ", list("mode"), " (moderately differentiated) and  ", list("poor"), " (poorly differentiated)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("stage")), list("a factor with levels ", list("T1ab"), " (Stage T1, clinically diagnoseed),
", "          ", list("T1c"), " (Stage T1, diagnosed via a PSA test), and  
", "          ", list("T2"), " (Stage T2)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("ageGroup")), list("a factor with levels ", list("66-69"), 
    " ", list("70-74"), " ", list("75-79"), " ", list("80+"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("survTime")), list("time from diagnosis to death or last date known alive")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("status")), list("a censoring variable, ", list("0"), ", (censored),
", "               ", list("1"), " (death from prostate cancer), and ", list("2"), " (death from other causes) ")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Lu-Yao, GL, Albertsen PC, Moore DF, Shih W, Lin Y, DiPaola RS, Barry MJ, Zietman A, O'Leary M, Walker-Corkery E, Yao S-L (2009) Outcomes of localized prostate cancer following conservative management. Journal of the American Medical Association 302, 1202 - 1209.)

dataset_description: This is a random subset of data from the Struewing et al. (1997) study of Ashkenazi jews and breast cancer. The subset consists of pairs of first-degree female relatives who are also first degree relatives of a proband.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 3920 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("famID")), list("family ID indicator")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("brcancer")), list("1 if subject had breast cancer, 0 if not")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("age")), list("Age at onset of breast cancer, or current age if no breast cancer")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("mutant")), list("1 if first degree relative proband was a BRCA mutation carrier, 0 if not")), "
", "  ")
dataset_reference: Moore DF, Chatterjee N, Pee D, and Gail MH (2001) Pseudo-likelihood estimates of the cumulative risk of an autosomal dominant disease from a kin-cohort study. Genetic Epidemiology 20, 210-227.) Struewing JP, Hartge P, Wacholder S, Baker SM, Berlin M, McAdams M, Timmerman MM, Brody LC, and Tucker MA (1997) The risk of cancer associated with specific mutations of BRCA1 and BRCA2 among ashkenazi jews. New England Journal of Medicine 336, 1401-1408.)

dataset_description: The list("ChanningHouse") data frame has 457 rows and 5 columns. This is 5 fewer than the parent channing data frame in the boot package. These 5 were removed because the exit time was not smaller than the entry time. Channing House is a retirement centre in Palo Alto, California. These data were collected between the opening of the house in 1964 until July 1, 1975. In that time 97 men and 365 women passed through the centre. For each of these, their age on entry and also on leaving or death was recorded. A large number of the observations were censored mainly due to the resident being alive on July 1, 1975 when the data was collected. Over the time of the study 130 women and 46 men died at Channing House. Differences between the survival of the sexes, taking age into account, was one of the primary concerns of this study.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 457 observations on the following 5 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("sex")), list("a factor for the sex of each resident with levels ", list("Female"), " ", list("Male"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("entry")), list("The residents age (in months) on entry to the center)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("exit")), list("The age (in months) of the resident on death, leaving the center or July 1, 1975, whichever event occurred first.)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("time")), list("The length of time (in months) that the resident spent at Channing House. (", 
    list("time=exit-entry"), ")))")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("cens")), list("The indicator of reight censoring. 1 indicates that the resident died at Channing House, 0 indicates that they left the house prior to July 1, 1975 or that they were still alive and living in the center at that date.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: The current data were derived from the "channing" data frame in the "boot" package. The original source for the data was Hyde, J. (1980) Testing survival with incomplete observations. Biostatistics Casebook. R.G. Miller, B. Efron, B.W. Brown and L.E. Moses (editors), 31-46. John Wiley.
dataset_reference: Davison, A.C. and Hinkley, D.V. (1997) Bootstrap Methods and Their Application. Cambridge University Press. Canty, A. and Ripley, B. (2015) boot package.

One treatment was assigned to each subject. Thus each drug was administered to eight subjects.

A data frame with 96 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("rate")), list("A numeric vector describing heart rate (bpm).")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("time")), list("A factor with levels ", list("t1"), " ", list("t2"), " ", list("t3"), " ", list("t4"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("drug")), list("A factor with levels ", list("AX23"), " ", list("BWW9"), " ", list("Ctrl"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("subject")), list("A factor describing which subject (in drug) that measurements were made on.")), "

", "    ", list(list(list("ord.snoring")), list("Agresti (21012) transformed the explanatory levels to ordinal values in his analysis of this data.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("disease")), list("Presence/absence of heart disease")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Norton, P. G., and E. V. Dunn  (1985)  Snoring as a risk factor for disease: an epidemiological survey. list("British Medical Journal") 291: 630-632.

dataset_description: A subset of a dataset collected by Aho (2006) which describes  the distribution of communities of lichens and vascular and avascular plant species on montane cliffs in Northeast Yellowstone National Park.  Of particular interest was whether substrate (limestone or andesitic conglomerate) or water supply influenced community composition.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Aho, K.(2006) list("Alpine Ecology and Subalpine Cliff Ecology in the Northern Rocky \n", "Mountains") .  Doctoral dissertation, Montana State University, 458 pgs.

dataset_description: Gurevitch et al. (1986) demonstrated time series analysis with data describing change in CO list(list("_2")) concentration of airstreams passing over a list("Sedum wrightii") test plant.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 24 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("exchange")), list("CO", list(list("_2")), " exchange, measured as: [change in CO", list(list("_2")), " concentration (g/mg)]/ plant fresh mass (g).  Thus units are 1/mg.  
", "    Positive values indicate net CO", list(list("_2")), " uptake while negative values indicate net CO2 output. ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("time")), list("A numeric vector indicating two hour intervals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("treatment")), list(list("Dry"), " = water withheld for several week, ", 
    list("Wet"), " = plant well watered.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Gurevitch, J. and S. T. Chester, Jr  (1986)  Analysis of repeated measures experiments. list("Ecology") 67(1): 251-255.

dataset_description: Thirteen sites in the Great Lakes were selected for a study to quantify PCB concentrations in 1982 and 1996 (Hughes et al. 1998).  At each site 9-13 American herring gull ( list("Larus smithsonianus") ) eggs were randomly collected and tested for PCB content.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 26 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("nest")), list("Nest number")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("level")), list("PCB levels microgram/gram of dry weight")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("year")), list("a numeric vector")), "
")
dataset_source: Ott, R. L., and M. T. Longnecker  (2004) list("A First Course in Statistical Methods") .  Thompson.
dataset_reference: Hughes, K. D., Weselogh, D. V., and B. M. Braune (1998) The ratio of DDE to PCB concentrations in Great Lakes herring gull eggs and its use in interpreting contaminants data. list("Journal of Great Lakes Research") 24(1): 12-31.

dataset_title: Alpine soil temperature and moisture time series
dataset_description: Soil temperature and water availabilty from Mt. Washburn in Yellowstone National Park.  Data were taken at depth of 5cm from a late snowmelt site at UTM 4960736.977	544792.225 zone 12T NAD 83, elevation 3070m.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 30 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("year")), list("A numeric vector describing year.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("day")), list("The "day of year", whereby Jan 1 = day 1 and Dec 32 = day 365 (366 for leap years).")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Temp_C")), list("Temperature in degrees celsius.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Moisture")), list("Soil water availability sensor reading.  A reading of 35 is approximately equal to -1.5 MPa.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Aho, K. (2006) list("Alpine Ecology and Subalpine Cliff Ecology in the Northern Rocky \n", "Mountains") .  Doctoral dissertation, Montana State University, 458 pgs.

dataset_description: The veterans administration studied the effect of AZT on AIDS symptoms for 338 HIV-positive military veterans who were just begining to express AIDS.  AZT treatment was withheld on a random component until helper T cells showed even greater depletion while the other group received the drug immediately.  The subjects were also classified by race.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 338 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("race")), list("A factor with levels ", list("black"), ", ", list("white"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("AZT")), list("A factor with levels ", list("N"), ", ", list("Y"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("symptoms")), list("Presence/absence of AIDS symptoms.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Agresti, A. (2012) list("Categorical Data Analysis, 3rd edition") .  New York.  Wiley.

dataset_description: Schoener (1968) examined the resource partitioning of anolis lizards on the Caribbean island of South Bimini. He cross-classified lizard counts in habitats (branches in trees) with respect to three variables: lizard species list(list("A. sargei"), " and ", list("A. distichus")) , branch height list("high and low") , and branch size list("small and large") .
dataset_format:
A data frame with 8 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("height")), list("Brach height.  A factor with levels ", list("H"), ", ", list("L"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("size")), list("Brach size.  A factor with levels ", list("L"), ", ", list("S"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("species")), list("Anolis species. A factor with levels ", list("distichus"), ", ", list("sagrei"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("count")), list("Count at the cross classification.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Schoener, T. W.  (1968)  The Anolis lizards of Bimini: resource partitioning in a complex fauna. list("Ecology") 49(4): 704-726.

dataset_description: Saint Germain et al. (2007) modeled the presence absence of a saprophytic wood boring beetle ( list("Anthophylax attenuatus") ) as a function of the wood density of twenty-four decaying aspen trees ( list("Populus tremuloides") ) in Western Quebec Canada.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 24 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Snag")), list("Snag identifier")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Yrs.since.death")), list("The number of years since death, determined using dendrochronological methods.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Wood.density")), list("The density of the decaying wood (dry weight/volume) in units of g cm", list(list("-3")), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("ANAT")), list("Beetle presence/absence (1/0)")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Saint-Germain, M., Drapeau, P., and C. Buddle  (2007)  Occurrence patterns of aspen- feeding wood-borers (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae) along the wood decay gradient: active selection for specific host types or neutral mechanisms? list("Ecological Entomology") 32: 712-721.

dataset_description: Neter et al. (1996) described an experiment in which researchers investigated the confounding effect of gender and bone development on growth hormone therapy for prepubescent children.  Gender had two levels: "M" and "F". The bone development factor had three levels indicating the severity of growth impediment before therapy: 1 = severely depressed, 2 = moderately depressed, and 3 = mildly depressed. At the start of the experiment 3 children were assigned to each of the six treatment combinations. However 4 of the children were unable to complete the experiment, resulting in an unbalanced design.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 14 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("gender")), list("A factor with levels ", list("F"), " ", list("M"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("devel")), list("A factor with levels ", list("1"), " ", list("2"), " ", list("3"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("growth")), list("A numeric vector descibing the growth difference before and after hormone therapy")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Neter, J., Kutner, M. H., Nachtsheim, C. J., and Wasserman, W  (1996) list("Applied Linear Statistical Models") .  McGraw-Hill, Boston MA, USA.

dataset_description: Stratified random sampling was used to estimate the size of the Nelchina herd of Alaskan caribou ( list("Rangifer tarandus") ) in February 1962 (Siniff and Skoog 1964). The total population of sample units (for which responses would be counts of caribou) consisted of 699 four mile list(list("^2")) areas.  This population was divided into six strata, and each of these was randomly sampled.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 6 observations on the following 5 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("stratum")), list("Strata; a factor with levels ", list("A"), " ", list("B"), " ", list("C"), " ", list("D"), " ", list("E"), " ", list("F"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("N.h")), list("Strata population size")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("n.h")), list("Strata sample size")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("x.bar.h")), list("Strata means")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("var.h")), list("Strata variances")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Siniff, D. B., and R. O. Skoog (1964)  Aerial censusing of caribou using stratified random sampling. list("Journal of Wildlife Management") 28: 391-401.

dataset_description: Hoshmand (2006) described a split plot design to test grain yield of corn with respect to corn hybrids (split plots) and nitrogen (in whole plots).  The experiment was replicated at two blocks.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 40 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("yield")), list("Corn yield in bushels per acre.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("hybrid")), list("Type of hybrid, P = pioneer, levels were: ", list("A632xLH38"), " ", list("LH74xLH51"), " ", list("Mo17xA634"), " ", list("P3732"), " ", list("P3747"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("N")), list("Nitrogen addition in lbs/acre ", list("0"), " ", list("70"), " ", list("140"), " ", list("210"), ".")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("block")), list("A blocking factor with levels ", 
    list("1"), " ", list("2"), ".")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Hoshmand, A. R.  (2006) list("Design of Experiments for Agriculture and the Natural Sciences 2nd Edition") .  Chapman and Hall.

dataset_title: An unconstructed marker set for a doubled haploid wheat population
dataset_description: An unconstructed marker set for a doubled haploid wheat population in the form of a constructed R/qtl object.
dataset_format: This data is the unconstructed version of list(list("mapDH")) and consists of 599 markers genotyped on 218 individuals. 584 markers are from the orignal map with an additonal 12 co-located markers and 3 slightly distorted markers. The data is in a list("data.frame") format with genotypes in columns and randomly assorted markers in rows. See list(list("mstmap.data.frame")) documentation for more details on the format of this object.

dataset_title: An unconstructed marker set for a backcross barley population
dataset_description: An unconstructed marker set for a backcross barley population in the form of an R/qtl object.
dataset_format: This data relates to an unconstructed version of list(list("mapBC")) and consists of 3023 markers genotyped on 326 individuals with markers randomly assorted on one large linkage group. The data is in R/qtl format with a class structure list("c(\"bc\",\"cross\")") . See list("read.cross()") documentation for more details on the format of this object. This data set forms the basis of the worked example in Chapter 3 of the vignette (see vignette("ASMap") for complete details

dataset_title: A constructed linkage map for a backcross barley population
dataset_description: A constructed linkage map for a backcross barley population in the form of a constructed R/qtl object.
dataset_format: This data relates to a fully constructed linkage map of 3019 markers genotyped on 300 individuals spanning the 7 linkage groups of the barley genome. The map was constructed using the MSTmap algorithm integrated in list(list("mstmap.cross")) with geentic distances estimated using the list("\"kosambi\"") mapping function. The data is in R/qtl format with a class structure list("c(\"bc\",\"cross\")") . See list("read.cross()") documentation for more details on the format of this object.

dataset_title: A constructed linkage map for a doubled haploid wheat population
dataset_description: A constructed linkage map for a doubled haploid wheat population in the form of a constructed R/qtl object.
dataset_format: This data relates to a fully constructed linkage map of 599 markers genotyped on 218 individuals. The linkage map consists of 23 linkage groups spanning the whole genome. 584 markers are from the orignal map with an additonal 12 co-located markers and 3 slightly distorted markers. The map was constructed using the MSTmap algorithm integrated in list(list("mstmap.cross")) with geentic distances estimated using the list("\"kosambi\"") mapping function. The data is in R/qtl format with a class structure list("c(\"bc\",\"cross\")") . See list("read.cross") documentation for more details on the format of this object.

dataset_title: Simulated constructed linkage map for a self pollinated F2 barley population
dataset_description: Simulated constructed linkage map for a self pollinated F2 barley population in the form of an R/qtl object.
dataset_format: This data relates to a fully constructed linkage map of 700 simulated markers genotyped on 250 individuals. The map consists of 7 linkage groups, each contaning 100 markers spanning an approximate linkage group length of 200cM. The map was constructed using list(list("mstmap.cross")) from the list("ASMap") package and map distances were estimated using the list("\"kosambi\"") mapping function. The data is in R/qtl format with a class structure list("c(\"bcsft\",\"cross\")") .

dataset_title: Additional functions for linkage map construction and manipulation of R/qtl objects.
dataset_description: Additional functions for linkage map construction and manipulation of R/qtl objects. This includes extremely fast linkage map clustering and marker ordering using MSTmap (see Wu et al., 2008).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Y. Wu, P. Bhat, T.J. Close, S. Lonardi, Efficient and Accurate Construction of Genetic Linkage Maps from Minimum Spanning Tree of a Graph Plos Genetics, Volume 4, Issue 10, 2008.

dataset_title: Observation Time for each Flock Contained in the Group by Individual data
dataset_description: The start time for each flock in the group by individual data since the first flock observed.
dataset_format: An integer array with the time (in seconds since the first flock of the day).
dataset_source: Farine, D.R., Garroway, C.J., Sheldon, B.C. (2012) Social Network Analysis of mixed-species flocks: exploring the structure and evolution of interspecific social behaviour. Animal Behaviour 84: 1271-1277.

dataset_title: Raw Observation Data of Individual Birds Feeding at Flocks
dataset_description: Contains the raw observation data, of which the first day was used to form the group by individual file. IDs correspond to TAG in the "individuals" data (note that some tags are error codes, which have not been removed, and thus do not occur in the individuals data).
dataset_format: Data frame containing 4 columns: Date - The observation day (1 to 8, where days 1-2 are the first weekend, 3-4 the second weekend, etc..) Time - The time in seconds since the very first observation ID - The PIT tag code of the individual Location - The location where the detection was made (1B, 1C, 1D, 1E)
dataset_source: Farine, D.R., Garroway, C.J., Sheldon, B.C. (2012) Social Network Analysis of mixed-species flocks: exploring the structure and evolution of interspecific social behaviour. Animal Behaviour 84: 1271-1277.

dataset_title: Data on the Individual Birds Contained in the Group by Individual data
dataset_description: Information about the PIT tag number, ring number, species, and sex (where available) for each individual in the group by individual data. Each row represents one column in the group by individual file, and the order is maintained.
dataset_format: Data frame containing: TAG - A 10 character hexadecimal code unique to each individual RING.NUMBER - A 7 character unique ring (or band) number for each individual SPECIES - Each species, where BLUTI=blue tit, COATI=coal tit, GRETI=great tit, MARTI=marsh tit, and NUTHA=nuthatch
dataset_source: Farine, D.R., Garroway, C.J., Sheldon, B.C. (2012) Social Network Analysis of mixed-species flocks: exploring the structure and evolution of interspecific social behaviour. Animal Behaviour 84: 1271-1277.

dataset_title: Detections of Individuals Forming Flocks at Bird Feeders
dataset_description: Dataset consisting of 151 individuals of 5 passerine species in Wytham Woods, UK: 78 blue tits (Cyanistes caeruleus), 7 coal tits (Periparus ater), 51 great tits (Parus major), 11 marsh tits (Poecile palustris), 3 nuthatches (Sitta europaea) and 1 individual of unknown species. Individuals were all fitted with individually-encoded passive integrated transponder (PIT) tags  that were logged by radio frequency identification (RFID) antennae fitted to each hole on regular sunflower feeders (we used unhusked sunflower seed). Data were collected from 4 feeders spaced approximately 300m over the course of one day. Feeders logged the presence of individuals at a sub-second resolution, and detections were assigned to flocks using a machine learning algorithm (a Gaussian Mixture Model).
dataset_format: Data are formatted in a group by individual matrix. Each row represents one flock, each column represents one individual.
dataset_source: Farine, D.R., Garroway, C.J., Sheldon, B.C. (2012) Social Network Analysis of mixed-species flocks: exploring the structure and evolution of interspecific social behaviour. Animal Behaviour 84: 1271-1277.

dataset_description: This is a single column vector for weighting the importance of point locations.
dataset_format: A single column vector of numeric values.
dataset_source: This demonstration data has been manufactured for illustrative purposes only.

dataset_title: Demo Data: x and y coordinates of 10 specified point locations
dataset_description: This is a simple two-column data frame (or matrix) containing x,y coordinates for a series of point locations. These data mimic UTM coordinates such that the first column contains Easting (x), and the second Northing (y) coordinates for the set of unique points.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 10 observations on the following 2 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("col1")), list("A numeric vector of x-coordinates")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("col2")), list("A numeric vector of y-coordinates")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: This demonstration data has been manufactured for illustrative purposes only.

dataset_title: Demo Data: x and y coordinates of 10 specified point locations
dataset_description: This is a simple two-column data frame (or matrix) containing x,y coordinates for a series of point locations. These data mimic UTM coordinates such that the first column contains Easting (x), and the second Northing (y) coordinates for the set of unique points.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 10 observations on the following 2 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("col1")), list("A numeric vector of x-coordinates")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("col2")), list("A numeric vector of y-coordinates")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: This demonstration data has been manufactured for illustrative purposes only.

dataset_title: Demo Data: Coordinates of a single source, centre, location
dataset_description: This is a simple two-element vector containing x,y coordinates for a source or central location associated with a spatial point pattern. In this example, the center location represents a point of importance in an individuals daily activity pattern. Surrounding point locations are places physically contacted by an individual during a particular time interval. Demonstration data mimics UTM coordinates such that the first element represents Easting (x), and the second, Northing (y).
dataset_format: The format is a two-element vector of numeric entries.
dataset_source: This demonstration data has been manufactured for illustrative purposes only.

dataset_title: Demo Data: Standard Deviation Distance Output Object
dataset_description: Results from the Standard Deviation Distance Calculator (calc_sdd) are stored in a list object. This object is required for the plot function (plot_sdd).
dataset_format:
The list object contains the following results: list("

dataset_description: Simulations of 1000 controls and 1000 affected sib pairs with 22 SNPs. There is one causal SNP with an OR of 2.
dataset_format:
A list with the following elements. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Control")), list("21 genotypes of controls no including causal SNP")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Index")), list("21 genotypes of index cases no including causal SNP")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("IBD")), list("Vector of IBD states for each affected sib pairs")), "
", "	", list(list(list("Causal")), list("The name of the causal SNP")), "
", "  ")

dataset_title: Bayesian method with affected sib pairs
dataset_description: This package permits to select in a genomic region a subset of SNPs which is likely to contain the true causal SNPs or a SNPs which tag them. Then, we exploite the linkage information contained in affected sib-pairs data to make inference on the causal SNPs in the region using Bayesian method.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Perdry, Herve, Muller-Myhsok, Bertram, et Clerget-Darpoux, Francoise. list("Using affected sib-pairs to uncover rare disease variants.") Hum Hered, 2013. Dandine-Roulland, Claire and Perdry, Herve. list("Where is the causal variant? On the advantage of the family design over the case-control design in genetic association studies.") Submitted to Eur J Hum Genet

dataset_description: At 4 points in time the objects (n = 1204 adolescents) were asked to rate cigarette, marijuana, and alcohol consumption on a 5-point scale.
dataset_format: Data frame with marijuana (POT), cigarette (CIG), and alcohol (ALC) consumption. Category labels: 1 ... never consumed 2 ... previous but no use over the last 6 months 3 ... current use of less than 4 times a month 4 ... current use of between 4 and 29 times a month 5 ... current use of 30 or more times a month
dataset_reference: Duncan, S. C., Duncan, T. E., and Hops, H. (1998). Progressions of alcohol, cigarette, and marijuana use in adolescence. Journal of Bahavioral Medicine, 21, 375-388.

dataset_description: The objects (individuals) are 1290 school children in the sixth grade of elementary school in the city of Groningen (Netherlands) in 1959.
dataset_format: Data frame with the five variables Gender, IQ, Advice, SES (fathers occupation) and School. IQ (original range 60 to 144) has been categorized into 9 ordered categories and the schools are enumerated from 1 to 37. SES: LoWC = Lower white collar; MidWC = Middle white collar; Prof = Professional, Managers; Shop = Shopkeepers; Skil = Schooled labor; Unsk = Unskilled labor. Advice: Agr = Agricultural; Ext = Extended primary education; Gen = General; Grls = Secondary school for girls; Man = Manual, including housekeeping; None = No further education; Uni = Pre-University.
dataset_reference: Peschar, J.L. (1975). School, Milieu, Beroep. Groningen: Tjeek Willink.

dataset_description: The dataset is about the use of public Internet terminals. For this package we extracted a subset of 8 items.
dataset_format: A data frame (n = 215) with the following items: Do you know at least one place where you can finnd such a terminal? (yes/no) Have you already used such a terminal? (yes/no) How often do you use the Internet on each of the following locations: home, work, cafe, terminal, cellphone? (5-point scales; see below) Which of the following descriptions fits you best? (I'm here on vacation/I am from here/I'm here on business travel) The 5-point items we have the following categories: daily (1), almost daily (2), several times a week (3), several times a month (3), once a month (4), less frequently (5).
dataset_reference: Wurzer M (2006). An Application of congural frequency analysis: Evaluation of the Usage of Internet Terminals. Master's thesis, University of Vienna, Austria.

dataset_description: This package consists of two main functions: The first function is corAspect() performs (optimal) scaling by maximizing an aspect (i.e. target function such as sum eigenvalues, sum of squared correlations, squared multiple correlations, etc.) of the corresponding correlation matrix. The second function is lineals() which performs scaling by mimimization a non-correlational aspect based on pairwise correlations and correlation ratios. The resulting correlation matrix and category scores can be used for further multivariate methods such as SEM.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Mair, P., & de Leeuw, J. (2010). A general framework for multivariate analysis with optimal scaling: The R package aspect. Journal of Statistical Software, 32(9).

dataset_description: The exdat data set is list of three objects. exdat$Y is a vector of length 1000, 500 0s and 500 1s. exdat$X is a matrix of 1000 by 10. This simulated X matrix is assumed to be rare variants. All eliments are 0, 1 or 2. exdat$SNP0indx is a vector of length 10. The values are 1 or 0, 0 indicate corresponding column of X matrix have no association with Y vector.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: An example data for MTaSPUsSet test
dataset_description: Genetic Investigation of ANthropometric Traits (GIANT) consortium data contain P-values of 2.7 million SNPs with six anthropometric traits that are well established to represent body size and shape: height, weight, BMI, waist circumference (WC), hip circumference(HIP). The data is downloadable from https://www.broadinstitute.org/collaboration/giant/index.php/GIANT_consortium_data_files We mapped SNPs on gene SAMD11. This subdata contains P values, Z scores of SNPs mapped on gene SAMD11. It also contains correlation among SNPs and correlation among phenotypes for demostrated example of MTaSPUsSet test.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Shungin D, Winkler TW, Croteau-Chonka DC, Ferreira T, Locke AE, Magi R, Strawbridge R, Pers TH, Fischer K, Justice AE, Workalemahu T, Wu JM, et al. (2015). New genetic loci link adipose and insulin biology to body fat distribution. Nature 518: 187-196.

dataset_title: An example data for MTaSPUsSet test
dataset_description: Genetic Investigation of ANthropometric Traits (GIANT) consortium data contain P-values of 2.7 million SNPs with six anthropometric traits that are well established to represent body size and shape: height, weight, BMI, waist circumference (WC), hip circumference(HIP). The data is downloadable from https://www.broadinstitute.org/collaboration/giant/index.php/GIANT_consortium_data_files We mapped SNPs on gene LCORL, RASA2, STK33 and RPGRIP1L. This subdata contains P values, correlation matrices for demostrated example of MTaSPUsSet test.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Shungin D, Winkler TW, Croteau-Chonka DC, Ferreira T, Locke AE, Magi R, Strawbridge R, Pers TH, Fischer K, Justice AE, Workalemahu T, Wu JM, et al. (2015). New genetic loci link adipose and insulin biology to body fat distribution. Nature 518: 187-196.

dataset_title: A subset of coronary artery disease (CAD) data
dataset_description: Data on coronary artery disease, myocardial infarction have been contributed by CARDIoGRAMplusC4D investigators and have been downloaded from www.CARDIOGRAMPLUSC4D.ORG The data set contains P value data for coronary artery disease (CAD). We mapped these SNPs to the 9th KEGG pathway. gene.info is a contains 16 gene information of 9th Kegg pathway. The 1st column is the name of the gene, 2nd column is the chromosome number, 3rd column is where the gene starts and 4th column is where the gene ends. snp.info contains 330 snp informations mapped on this Kegg pathway. The 1st column is the rsID of the SNP, 2nd column is the chromosome number and the 3rd column is the location of the SNP. Ps is a vector containing p-value information for mapped SNPs. The `PPs` is a list object contains the SNP information for each genes. For example, PPs$CEL contains snp.info matrix mapped on gene `CEL`. The 1st column is the rsID of the SNP, 2nd column is the chromosome number, the 3rd column is the location of the SNP and the 4th column is p-value of the SNP. nP is a subvector of Ps. These are SNPs on reference population(Hapmap CEU phase 2 data, downloadable from plink, SNPs with MAF less than 5 percent omitted) ldmatrix is a correaltion matrix of SNPs from the reference population.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Schunkert H, Konig IR, Kathiresan S, Reilly MP, Assimes TL, Holm H et al. (2011) Large-scale association analysis identifies 13 new susceptibility loci for coronary artery disease. Nat Genet. 43: 333-338

dataset_title: Data for an experiment to investigate the quality of water runoff over time
dataset_description: This data is from an experiment to investigate the quality of water runoff. However, it has been modified to hide the true identity of the Species and Sources. It is used to provide executable examples of the functions listed under list("See Also") .
dataset_format: A data.frame containing 440 observations of 13 variables.

dataset_title: Data for an experiment to investigate 25 varieties of wheat
dataset_description: The data appears in Gilmour et al. [1995] and is from a field experiment designed to compare the performance of 25 varieties of wheat. An analysis of it using asreml is presented by Butler et al. (2010, Sectoion 8.6), although they suggest that it is a barley experiment. It is used in list(list("asremlPlus-package")) as an executable example of the use of the list("asremlPlus") to analyse a data set. The experiment was conducted at Slate Hall Farm, UK, in 1976 and was designed as a balanced lattice square with 6 replicates laid out in a 10 list(list("\\times"), list("x")) 15 rectangular grid. The columns in the data frame are: Rep, Row, Column, WithinColPairs, Variety, yield. The response variable is the grain yield.
dataset_format: A data.frame containing 150 observations of 6 variables.
dataset_source: Butler, D. G., et al. (2010). list("Analysis of Mixed Models \n", "            for ", list("S"), " language environments: ", list("ASReml-R"), " reference manual.") Brisbane, DPI Publications. Gilmour, A. R., et al. (1995) Average Information REML: An efficient algorithm for variance parameter estimation in linear mixed models. list("Biometrics") , list("51") , 1440-1450.

dataset_description: c("\\Sexpr[results=rd,stage=build]{tools:::Rd_package_description(\"#1\")}", "asremlPlus") list("tools:::Rd_package_description(\"asremlPlus\")") list("Version:") list(c("\\Sexpr[results=rd,stage=build]{utils::packageDescription(\"#1\", fields=\"Version\")}", "asremlPlus"), list("utils::packageDescription(\"asremlPlus\", fields=\"Version\")")) list("Date:") c("\\Sexpr[results=rd,stage=build]{utils::packageDescription(\"#1\", fields=\"Date\")}", "asremlPlus") list("utils::packageDescription(\"asremlPlus\", fields=\"Date\")")
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Butler, D. G., et al. (2010). list("Analysis of Mixed Models \n", "            for ", list("S"), " language environments: ", list("ASReml-R"), " reference manual.") dataset_format: The data frame contains the following columns: stacode a numeric vector of the unique station code formed by combining the two-digit state number [state numbers range from 1 to 48] and the four-digit station number (values range from 0008 to 9933); lat, long numeric vectors identifying the lattitudes and longitudes of the stations in decimal degree. year a numeric vector comprising the year for the records month a numeric vector of values 1 to 12, represeting the month for the data mmtemp a numeric vector of monthly average temperature in Fahrenheit scale.

", "    "), "

", "    ", list("

    "2\times J")), " matrix of standard deviations, the first row for the

", "  ")), "

")

dataset_title: A class to encapsulate the adaptive clinical trial design of Lai, Lavori and Liao

dataset_format: An list(list("R6Class")) generator object
dataset_reference: Adaptive Choice of Patient Subgroup for Comparing Two Treatments by Tze Leung Lai and Philip W. Lavori and Olivia Yueh-Wen Liao. Contemporary Clinical Trials, Vol. 39, No. 2, pp 191-200 (2014). list("http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1551714414001311") .

dataset_title: A fixed sample design to compare against the adaptive clinical trial design of Lai, Lavori and Liao.
dataset_description: list("ASSISTDesignB") objects are used to design a trial with certain characteristics provided in the object instantiation method. This design differs from list("ASSISTDesign") in only how it computes the critical boundaries, how it performs the interim look, and what quantities are computed in a trial run.
dataset_format: An list(list("R6Class")) generator object
dataset_reference: Adaptive Choice of Patient Subgroup for Comparing Two Treatments by Tze Leung Lai and Philip W. Lavori and Olivia Yueh-Wen Liao. Contemporary Clinical Trials, Vol. 39, No. 2, pp 191-200 (2014). list("http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1551714414001311") .

dataset_title: A fixed sample RCT design to compare against the adaptive clinical trial design of Lai, Lavori and Liao.
dataset_description: list("ASSISTDesignC") objects are used to design a trial with certain characteristics provided in the object instantiation method. dataset_format: An list(list("R6Class")) generator object
dataset_reference: Adaptive Choice of Patient Subgroup for Comparing Two Treatments by Tze Leung Lai and Philip W. Lavori and Olivia Yueh-Wen Liao. Contemporary Clinical Trials, Vol. 39, No. 2, pp 191-200 (2014). list("http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1551714414001311") .

dataset_description: list("DEFUSE3Design") is a slight variant of the the adaptive clinical trial design of Lai, Lavori and Liao. Simulation is used to compute the expected maximum sample size and the boundary for early futility is adjusted to account as well.
dataset_format: An list(list("R6Class")) generator object
dataset_reference: Adaptive design of confirmatory trials: Advances and challenges by Tze Leung Lai and Philip W. Lavori and Ka Wai Tsang. Contemporary Clinical Trials, Vol. 45, Part A, pp 93-102 (2015). list("http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1551714415300239") .

dataset_description: Data on life history traits for four years and five fitness components
dataset_format:
Loads nine objects. The objects list("beta.true") , list("mu.true") list("phi.true") , and list("theta.true") are the simulation truth parameter values in different parametrizations. list("
", "      ", list(list("beta.true"), list("Regression coefficient vector for model
", "      ", list("resp ~ varb + 0 + z1 + z2 + I(z1^2) + I(z1*z2) + I(z2^2)"), ".")), "
", "      ", list(list("mu.true"), list("Unconditional mean value parameter vector for same
", "      model.")), " 
", "      ", list(list("phi.true"), list("Unconditional canonical value parameter vector for
", "      same model.")), " 
", "      ", list(list("theta.true"), list("Conditional canonical value parameter vector for
", 
    "      same model.")), "
", "    ") list("fam") list("pred") list("vars") specify the aster model graphical and probabilistic structure. list("
", "      ", list(list("fam"), list("Integer vector giving the families of the variables in
", "      the graph.")), "
", "      ", list(list("pred"), list("Integer vector giving the predecessors of the variables in
", "      the graph.")), "
", "      ", list(list("vars"), list("Character vector giving the names of the variables in
", "      the graph.")), "
", "    ") list("ladata") and list("redata") are the simulated data in two forms list(""wide"") list(""long"") in the terminology of the list("reshape") function. list("
", "      ", list(list("ladata"), list("Data frame with variables ", list("y"), ", ", list("z1"), ",
", "      ", list("z2"), " used for Lande-Arnold type estimation of fitness landscape.
", "      ", list("y"), " is the response, fitness, and ", list("z1"), " and ", list("z1"), " are
", "      predictor variables, phenotypes.")), "
", "      ", list(list("redata"), list("Data frame with variables ", list("resp"), ", ", list("z1"), ",
", "      ", list("z2"), ", ", list("varb"), ", ", 
    list("id"), ", ", list("root"), "
", "      used for aster type estimation of fitness landscape.
", "      ", list("resp"), " is the response, containing all components of fitness,
", "      and ", list("z1"), " and ", list("z1"), " are predictor variables, phenotypes.
", "      ", list("varb"), " is a factor whose levels are are elements of ", list("vars"), "
", "      indicating which elements of ", list("resp"), " go with which nodes of the
", "      aster model graphical structure.  The variables ", 
    list("z1"), " and ", list("z2"), "
", "      have been set equal to zero except when ", list("grep("nseed", varb)"), " is
", "      ", list("TRUE"), ".  For the rationale see Section 3.2 of TR 669 referenced
", "      below.
", "    ")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Geyer, C. J and Shaw, R. G. (2008) Supporting Data Analysis for a talk to be given at Evolution 2008. Technical Report No. 669.  School of Statistics, University of Minnesota. list("http://www.stat.umn.edu/geyer/aster/") .
dataset_reference: Geyer, C. J and Shaw, R. G. (2009) Hypothesis Tests and Confidence Intervals Involving Fitness Landscapes fit by Aster Models. Technical Report No. 671.  School of Statistics, University of Minnesota. list("http://www.stat.umn.edu/geyer/aster/") .

dataset_title: Life History Data on Manduca sexta
dataset_description: Data on life history traits for the tobacco hornworm list("Manduca sexta")
dataset_format:
An object of class list(""asterdata"") (see list(list("asterdata")) ) comprising records for 162 insects (54 female, 68 male, and 40 for which there was no opportunity to determine sex) observed over 40 days. Nodes of the graph for one individual are associated with the variables (levels of the factor list("hornworm$redata$varb") ) in dependence groups list("
", "    ", list(list("P"), list("Bernoulli.  Predecessor 1 (initial node).  Indicator of pupation.")), "
", "    ", list(list("T330, T331, T332"), list("Three-dimensional multinomial dependence group.
", "      Predecessor ", list("P"), ".")), "
", "      ", list("
", "      ", list(list("T330"), list("Indicator of death after pupation.  In these data,
", "        all deaths after pupation are considered to have happened on
", "        day 33 regardless of when they occurred (because the actual
", 
    "        day of death was not recorded in the original data).")), "
", "      ", list(list("T331"), list("Indicator of survival to day 33 but still pre-eclosion.")), "
", "      ", list(list("T332"), list("Indicator of eclosion (emergence from pupa as adult moth
", "         on day 33.")), "
", "      "), "
", "    ", list(list("B33"), list("Zero-truncated Poisson.  Predecessor ", list("T332"), ".
", "       Count of ovarioles on day 33.  Only females have this node in their
", "       graphs.")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list("Tx1, Tx2"), list("For ", list("x"), " = 34, ", list(), ", 40. Two-dimensional multinomial
", "      dependence group.  Predecessor ", list("Tw1"), ", where ", list("w = x - 1"), ".")), "
", "      ", list("
", "        ", list(list("Tx1"), list("Indicator of survival to day ", list("x"), " but still
", "          pre-eclosion.")), "
", "        ", list(list("Tx2"), list("Indicator of eclosion (emergence from pupa as adult moth
", "          on day ", list("x"), 
        ".")), "
", "      "), "
", "    ", list(list("Bx"), list("Zero-truncated Poisson.  Predecessor ", list("Tx2"), ".
", "       Count of ovarioles on day ", list("x"), ".  Only females have these nodes in
", "       their graph.")), "
", "   ") Covariates are list("
", "    ", list(list("Sex"), list("a factor.  ", list("F"), " is known female, ", list("M"), " is known male,
", "      ", list("U"), " is unknown (no opportunity to observe).")), "
", "    ", list(list("Time_2nd"), list("time (in weeks) to reach the 2nd instar stage.  Larval
", "      instars are stages between molts (shedding of exoskeleton) of the larval
", "      form (caterpillar).")), "
", "    ", list(list("Mass_2nd"), list("mass (in grams) at the 2nd instar stage.")), "
", "    ", 
    list(list("Mass_Repro"), list("mass (in grams) at eclosion.")), "
", "    ", list(list("LarvaID"), list("name of an individual in the original data.")), "
", "  ")
