dataset_title: Tea Party Rallies in Florida Counties
dataset_description: This data set gives Census, voting, religion, and Tea Party organization and rallies for 67 counties in Florida.
dataset_format: A matrix containing 67 observations and 13 variables.
dataset_source: Subset of data created by Rory McVeigh, Kraig Beyerlein, Burrel Vann Jr., and Priyamvada Trivedi
dataset_reference: McVeigh, Rory, Kraig Beyerlein, Burrel Vann Jr., and Priyamvada Trivedi. ``Educational Segregation, Tea Party Organizations, and Battles over Distributive Justice.'' list("American Sociological Review 79") : 630-652.

dataset_title: Sample recording of SICM pipette breakage
dataset_description: Position and current data recorded using a scanning ion conductance microscope in hopping mode. An elevated fall rate drove the pipette to overshoot its detection range and collide with the cover slip surface and break, altering its resistance.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 9999 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("s")), list("The time of each data point, in milliseconds from the start of the recording.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("pA")), list("The ion current passing through the pipette, in picoamps.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Z")), list("The pipette position, in microns, recorded within the frame of reference of the SICM piezo actuator.")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Caldwell, M., Del Linz, S. J. L., Smart, T. G. S. and Moss, G. W. J. 2012 Method for estimating the tip geometry of scanning ion conductance microscope pipets. list("Anal. Chem.") (in press)

dataset_title: Estimating SICM pipette tip geometry from breakage data
dataset_description: Functions to estimate the interior half-cone angle and tip radius of a scanning ion conductance microscope (SICM) pipette by fitting recorded changes in pipette conductance as the pipette tip is broken. See the referenced paper for a full discussion of this technique.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Caldwell, M., Del Linz, S. J. L., Smart, T. G. S. and Moss, G. W. J. 2012 Method for estimating the tip geometry of scanning ion conductance microscope pipets. list("Anal. Chem.") 84(21):8980--8984

dataset_description: Chromosome 1 of cell line GM03563
dataset_format: A single column data frame with 135 observations corresponds to chromosome 1 of cell line GM03563. list("\n", "    ", list(list(list("log2ratio")), list("normalized average of the log base 2 test over reference ratio data")), "\n", "  ")
dataset_reference: Snijders,A.M. et al. (2001) Assembly of microarrays for genome-wide measurement of DNA copy number. Nature Genetics, 29, 263-26.

dataset_title: Multiple Break-Point Detection via the Cross-Entropy Method
dataset_description: The breakpoint package implements variants of the Cross-Entropy (CE) method proposed in Priyadarshana and Sofronov (2015, 2012a and 2012b) to estimate both the number and the corresponding locations of break-points in biological sequences of continuous and discrete measurements. The proposed method primarily built to detect multiple break-points in genomic sequences. However, it can be easily extended and applied to other problems.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Priyadarshana, W. J. R. M., Sofronov G. (2015). Multiple Break-Points Detection in Array CGH Data via the Cross-Entropy Method, IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, 12 (2), pp.487-498. Priyadarshana, W. J. R. M. and Sofronov, G. (2012a). A Modified Cross- Entropy Method for Detecting Multiple Change-Points in DNA Count Data. In Proc. of the IEEE Conference on Evolutionary Computation (CEC), 1020-1027, DOI: 10.1109/CEC.2012.6256470. Priyadarshana, W. J. R. M. and Sofronov, G. (2012b). The Cross-Entropy Method and Multiple Change-Points Detection in Zero-Inflated DNA read count data. In: Y. T. Gu, S. C. Saha (Eds.) The 4th International Conference on Computational Methods (ICCM2012), 1-8, ISBN 978-1-921897-54-2. Rubinstein, R., and Kroese, D. (2004) The Cross-Entropy Method: A Unified Approach to Combinatorial Optimization, Monte-Carlo Simulation and Machine Learning. Springer-Verlag, New York. Zhang, N.R., and Siegmund, D.O. (2007) A modified Bayes information criterion with applications to the analysis of comparative genomic hybridization data. Biometrics, 63, 22-32.

dataset_description: This dataset is provided as part of the list("bReeze") package for use with the examples in the documantation. It contains measured wind speed and wind direction in a 10 minute interval, collected by a meteorological mast.

dataset_description: A collection of functions to analyse, visualize and interpret wind data and to calculate the potential energy production of wind turbines.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: The following handbook gives a detailed thematic overview and is available online: Brower, M., Marcus, M., Taylor, M., Bernadett, D., Filippelli, M., Beaucage, P., Hale, E., Elsholz, K., Doane, J., Eberhard, M., Tensen, J., Ryan, D. (2010) Wind Resource Assessment Handbook. http://www.renewablenrgsystems.com/TechSupport/~/media/Files/PDFs/wind_resource_handbook.ashx Further references are given under the specific functions of the package.

dataset_description: The dict dataset includes the parsed names of many popular statistics graduate programs. It is used to standardize the graduate program names, enabling aggregate analysis.
dataset_format: The format is: chr [1:111, 1] "arizona state univ" "auburn univ" "baylor univ" ... - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 ..$ : NULL ..$ : chr "name"

dataset_title: Table of Common or Shortened University Names
dataset_description: parseSchools uses this table to try matching a nickname to the formal university or department name. This table corresponds to the second stage of processing.
dataset_format: The format is: chr [1:384, 1:2] "a&m" "alberta" "asu" "au" "baylor" "bc" ... - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 ..$ : NULL ..$ : chr [1:2] "slang" "name"

dataset_description: findScorePercent uses the saw_score_table (Score/Analytical Writing Table) to look up the percent of test takers scorig lower than a specified scores using tables 1A and 1B on page 22 of the GRE score guide.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 13 observations on the following 2 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("score")), list(" Current GRE score scale, i.e. 0-6 ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("aw")), list(" Percent of scores below the associated input ")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: Brewdata is a package built to lookup, parse, and analyze statistics and biostatistics graduate admissions data reported in the Grad Cafe Results Search.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Grad Cafe: http://forum.thegradcafe.com/, GRE score guide: https://www.ets.org/s/gre/pdf/gre_guide.pdf

dataset_title: Table Used to Convert Pre-2011 Quantitative Scores to Current Scaled Score
dataset_description: translateScore uses this dataset to convert pre-2011 GRE scores to the current scale using the concordance tables 1D and 1E on pages 23-24 of the GRE score guide.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 61 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("old")), list(" Pre-2011 GRE scaled score, i.e. 200-800 ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("new")), list(" Current GRE score scale, i.e. 130-170 ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("pct")), list(" Percent of scores below the associated input ")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: findScorePercent uses the svq_score_table (Verbal-Quantitative Section Score Table) to look up the percent of test takers scorig lower than specified scores using tables 1A and 1B on page 22 of the GRE score guide.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 41 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("score")), list(" Post-2011 GRE scaled score, i.e. 130-170 ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("v")), list(" Verbal score percentile ranking  ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("q")), list(" Quantitative score percentile ranking  ")), "
", "  ")

dataset_format:
A data frame with 61 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("old")), list(" Pre-2011 GRE scaled score, i.e. 200-800 ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("new")), list(" Current GRE score scale, i.e. 130-170 ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("pct")), list(" Percent of scores below the associated input ")), "

dataset_description: The error_key dataset includes several regular expressions used to parse school names. This dataset is used to parse commonly mis-spelled terms (e.g. university). It also maps several specific department names into a standardized university name assigned to targets matching the search patterns. For example, any entry name that includes the term 'Booth' is mapped to the standardized name 'univ chicago'. This dataset supports brewdata's parseSchools helper function.
dataset_format: The format is: chr [1:37, 1:2] "boston|bu " "carnegie|mellon|cmu" "fort collins" ... - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 ..$ : NULL ..$ : chr [1:2] "regex" "corrected"

dataset_description: The list("lizards") data frame has 23 rows and 6 columns. Variables list("grahami") and list("opalinus") are counts of two lizard species at two different perch heights, two different perch diameters, in sun and in shade, at three times of day.
dataset_format:
This data frame contains the following columns: list("
", "    ", list(list(list("grahami")), list("count of grahami lizards")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("opalinus")), list("count of opalinus lizards")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("height")), list("a factor with levels ", list(""<5ft""), ", ", list("">=5ft""))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("diameter")), list("a factor with levels ", list(""<=2in""), ", ", list("">2in""))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("light")), list("a factor with levels ", list(""sunny""), ", ", list(""shady""))), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("time")), list("a factor with levels ", list(""early""), ", ", list(""midday""), ",
", "	", list(""late""))), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: McCullagh, P. and Nelder, J. A. (1989) list("Generalized Linear\n", "    Models") (2nd Edition).  London: Chapman and Hall. Originally from Schoener, T. W. (1970)  Nonsynchronous spatial overlap of lizards in patchy habitats. list("Ecology") list("51") , 408--418.

dataset_description: This dataset contains 21 body dimension measurements as well as age, weight, height, and gender on 507 individuals. The 247 men and 260 women were primarily individuals in their twenties and thirties, with a scattering of older men and women, all exercising several hours a week. Source: Measurements were initially taken by Grete Heinz and Louis J. Peterson - at San Jose State University and at the U.S. Naval Postgraduate School in Monterey, California. Later, measurements were taken at dozens of California health and fitness clubs by technicians under the supervision of one of these authors.
dataset_format:
The data frame has the following components: list("
", " ", list(), list("BiacSk"), ":  Biacromial diameter (cm)
", " ", list(), list("BiilSk"), ":  Biiliac diameter, or "pelvic breadth" (cm)
", " ", list(), list("BitrSk"), ":  Bitrochanteric diameter (cm)
", " ", list(), list("CheDeSk"), ":  Chest depth between spine and sternum at nipple level, 
", "            mid-expiration (cm)
", " ", list(), list("CheDiSk"), ":    Chest diameter at nipple level, mid-expiration (cm)
", " ", list(), list("ElbowSk"), ":  Elbow diameter, sum of two elbows (cm)
", 
    " ", list(), list("WristSk"), ": Wrist diameter, sum of two wrists (cm)
", " ", list(), list("KneeSk"), ": Knee diameter, sum of two knees (cm)
", " ", list(), list("AnkleSk"), ": Ankle diameter, sum of two ankles (cm)
", " ", list(), list("ShoulGi"), ": Shoulder girth over deltoid muscles (cm)
", " ", list(), list("ChestGi"), ": Chest girth, nipple line in males and just above breast 
", "            tissue in females, mid-expiration (cm)
", " ", list(), list("WaistGi"), ": Waist girth, narrowest part of torso below the rib cage, 
", 
    "            average of contracted and relaxed position (cm)
", " ", list(), list("NavelGi"), ": Navel (or "Abdominal") girth at umbilicus and iliac crest, 
", "            iliac crest as a landmark (cm)
", " ", list(), list("HipGi"), ": Hip girth at level of bitrochanteric diameter (cm)
", " ", list(), list("ThighGi"), ": Thigh girth below gluteal fold, average of right and left 
", "            girths (cm)
", " ", list(), list("BicepGi"), ": Bicep girth, flexed, average of right and left girths (cm)
", 
    " ", list(), list("ForeaGi"), ": Forearm girth, extended, palm up, average of right and 
", "            left girths (cm)
", " ", list(), list("KneeGi"), ": Knee girth over patella, slightly flexed position, average 
", "            of right and left girths (cm)
", " ", list(), list("CalfGi"), ": Calf maximum girth, average of right and left girths (cm)
", " ", list(), list("AnkleGi"), ": Ankle minimum girth, average of right and left girths
", " (cm)
", " ", list(), list("WristGi"), ": Wrist minimum girth, average of right and left girths (cm)
", 
    "
", " ", list(), list("Age"), ":  (years)
", " ", list(), list("Weight"), ":  (kg)
", " ", list(), list("Height"), ":  (cm)
", " ", list(), list("Gender"), ": (1 - male, 0 - female)
", " 
")
dataset_source: Heinz, G., Peterson, L.J., Johnson, R.W. and Kerk, C.J. (2003), ``Exploring Relationships in Body Dimensions'', list("Journal of Statistics Education ") , 11.
dataset_reference: The information on this page has been taken from the web site list("http://www.amstat.org/publications/jse/datasets/body.txt") . The dataset is download from list("http://www.amstat.org/publications/jse/datasets/body.dat.txt")

dataset_title: Simulated data for a simple mixed model with Poisson response
dataset_description: Simulated data with a fixed factor cult (4 levels), with 8 randomized replications each, a (fixed) factor time (6 levels), which are repeated measurements taken from the same experimental units. The 32 experimental (plotid) units differ in their mean response follwing a gaussian distribution. The response Y follows a Poisson distribution.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 192 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("plotid")), list("a factor with 32 levels, representing the 32 experimental units (plots)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("cult")), list("a factor with 4 levels (", list("C1"), " ", list("C2"), " ", list("C3"), " ", list("C4"), "), representing a fixed factor (e.g. the cultivar)")), "

    "
", "    ", list(list(list("Y")), list("a numeric vector, following a Poisson distribution")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: Data of a field trial concerning the impact of a genetically modified variety on the abundance of Planthoppers and Leafhoppers. The trial was designed as a randomized complete block design with 8 blocks (Row). In each block, three treatments were randomized: a conventional variety treated with insecticides (Insecticide), a genetically modified variety (GM), and the near-isogenic line (Iso) the to genetically modified line.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 24 observations on the following 6 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Field")), list("a factor with levels ", list("1"), " ", list("2"), ", separating the two major sites of the trial. On field 1, the blocks 1-5 were situated, on field 2, blocks 6-8 were situated. ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Row")), list("a factor with 8 levels, specifying the blocks:", list("R1"), " ", list("R2"), " ", list("R3"), " ", list("R4"), " ", list("R5"), " ", list("R6"), " ", list("R7"), " ", list("R8"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Year")), list(
    "a numeric vector, for year 1 of the trial")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Treatment")), list("a factor with 3 levels, specifying the genetically modified variety ", list("GM"), ",
", " the conventional variety treated with insecticides ", list("Insecticide"), ",
", " and the variety that was near-isogenic to the GM variety ", list("Iso"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Au_Bonitur")), list("Counts of Auchenorryhncha by visual assessment")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Zs_sweep_netting")), 
    list("Counts of the major species Zyginidia scutellaris, catched by sweep nets")), "
", "  ")

dataset_title: Soil eklektor data for some families of Diptera
dataset_description: Hatching of some families of Diptera was recorded in summer 2005 using eklektors covering 2 square meters of soil surface each. A total of 32 eklektors were arranged in a randomized field trial. Total counts of individuals over the whole season are reported. Aim was to assess the impact of a novel treatment on the abundance of Diptera with larval development in the soil, compared to three standard treatments.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 32 observations on the following 7 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Callip")), list("a numeric vector")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Chloro")), list("a numeric vector")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Ephyd")), list("a numeric vector")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Droso")), list("a numeric vector")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Ges")), list("a numeric vector, total number of species")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Chiro")), list("a numeric vector")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Treatment")), list("a factor, specifying the four different treatments,
", 
    " with levels ", list("S1"), " ", list("S2"), " for two standard treatments, ", list("SNovum"), " for the standard treatment most similar to the novel treatment, and ", list("Novum"), ", for the novel treatment")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: personal communications S. Prescher, JKI Braunschweig, Germany

dataset_title: Pupation and Hatching rate in a feeding experiment with four varieties
dataset_description: Larvae of a non-target organism were fed with plant material derived from a novel variety(Novum), material from three standard varieties (NStandard: the standard variety most similar to Novum, and two additional standard varieties S1 and S2). Objective was to assess the impact of Novum on the pupation and hatching rate of an animal that potentially feeds on plant material compared to accepted standard varieties.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 32 observations on the following 5 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Rep")), list("a factor with 32 levels indexing the 32 replications")), " 
", "    ", list(list(list("Variety")), list("a factor with 4 levels: ", list("S1"), " and ", list("S2"), " are two standard varieties, ", list("Novum"), " is a novel variety, and ", list("NStandard"), " is the standard variety most similar to ", list("Novum"), " ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total")), list("the total number of animals in each experimental unit")), "
", "    ", list(
    list(list("Pupating")), list("number of individuals pupating in each unit, the others died")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Hatching")), list("number of individuals hatching from the pupae")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: Data of a field trial concerning the impact of a genetically modified variety on the abundance of Planthoppers and Leafhoppers. The trial was designed as a randomized complete block design with 8 blocks (Row). In each block, three treatments were randomized: a conventional variety treated with insecticides (Insecticide), a genetically modified variety (GM), and the near-isogenic line (Iso) the to genetically modified line. These data originate from the second year of the trial in Cica1.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 24 observations on the following 8 variables. list("
", "   ", list(list(list("Field")), list("a factor with 2 levels, ", list("1"), " ", list("2"), ", separating the two major sites of the trial. On field 1, the blocks 1-5 were situated, on field 2, blocks 6-8 were situated.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Row")), list("a factor with 8 levels, specifying the blocks: ", list("R1"), " ", list("R2"), " ", list("R3"), " ", list("R4"), " ", list("R5"), " ", list("R6"), " ", list("R7"), " ", list("R8"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Year")), 
    list("a numeric vector, with value 2 for the second year ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Treatment")), list("a factor with 3 levels, specifying the genetically modified variety ", list("GM"), ",
", " the conventional variety treated with insecticides ", list("Insecticide"), ",
", " and the variety that was near-isogenic to the GM variety ", list("Iso"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Au_Bonitur")), list("counts of Auchenorryhncha by visual assessment")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Zs_sweep_netting")), 
    list("counts of the major species Zyginidia scutellaris, catched by sweep nets")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Zs_yellow_traps")), list("counts of Zyginidia scutellaris, catched by yellow traps")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Zs_stick_traps")), list("counts of Zyginidia scutellaris, catched by sticky traps")), "

dataset_description: Simulated data, inpired by a real field investigating the potential impact of genetically modified crop on several insect species belonging to the same order. The trial was designed as a randomized complete block design with 8 blocks (Block), and a total of 24 plots. In each block, three treatments (Treatment) were randomized: a conventional variety treated with insecticides (Ins), a genetically modified variety (GM) without insecticide treatment, and the near-isogenic variety (Iso) the to genetically modified variety, without insecticide treatment. Individuals were counted (after classification to the species level) in two different dates in each year of the trial, where the the second date was of higher importance for assessment of impacts of GM variety on non-target species. In total 12 Species were observed during the trial.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 144 observations on the following 17 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Year")), list("a numeric vector, the year 1, 2, 3")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Date")), list("a numeric vector, 1 and 2 separating the 2 sampling date in each year ")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Block")), list("a numeric vector, with values 1-8, indicator variable for the 8 blocks")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Treatment")), list("a factor with three levels identifying the varieties: ", list("GM"), " is the genetically modified variety,
", " ", list(
    "Ins"), " the conventional variety with insecticide treatment and ", list("Iso"), " the near isognic line without insecticide treatment")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Plot")), list("a factor with 24 levels, identifying the individual plots")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp1")), list("counts of taxon 1")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp2")), list("counts of taxon 2")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp3")), list("counts of taxon 3")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp4")), list("counts of taxon 4")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp5")), list("counts of taxon 5")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp6")), list("counts of taxon 6")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp7")), list("counts of taxon 7")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp8")), list("counts of taxon 8")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp9")), list("counts of taxon 9")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp10")), list("counts of taxon 10")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp11")), list("counts of taxon 11")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sp12")), 
        list("counts of taxon 12")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: In a field trial, 4 treatments were arranged in a randomized complete block design with 8 blocks and 32 plots. Soil eklektor traps were placed in each plot, on six dates from 2005-07-12 to 2005-09-25, the number of individuals of Brachycera (Flies, Order Diptera) hatching from soil were counted. The individuals were classified to the family level. Interest was in assessing potential effects of the novel treatment (Novum) on the abundance of Brachycera, compared to a near standard (Standard) and two additional standard treatments, A and B.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 192 observations on the following 15 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Date")), list("a POSIXt variable, the time of counting the individuals in the eklektor trap")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Treatment")), list("a factor with 4 levels ", list("A"), " ", list("B"), " ", list("Standard"), " ", list("Novum"), ",
", "    where ", list("Novum"), " is the novel treatment of interest in safety assessment, and ", list("Standard"), " is the nearest standard treatment which commonly accepted.
", "    ", list("A"), " and ", list("B"), 
    " are two additional standard treatments.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Block")), list("a numeric vector, specifying the eight blocks 1-8")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Plot")), list("a factor with levels ", list("A1"), " ", list("A2"), " to ", list("Standard8"), ", indicator of the individuals plots")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Agromy")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Anthom")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", 
    "    ", list(list(list("Callip")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Chloro")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Ephyd")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Droso")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Hybo")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Musci")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("Phori")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sphaer")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals")), "
", "  ")

dataset_description: In a field trial, 4 treatments (A,B, Standard, Novum) were arranged in a randomized complete block design with 8 blocks and 32 plots. In summer 2005 soil eklektor traps were placed in each plot, on six dates from 2005-07-12 to 2005-09-25, the number of individuals of Nematocera (gnats, midges and others) hatching from soil were counted. The individuals were classified to the family level. Interest was in assessing potential effects of a novel agricultural practice (Novum) on the abundance of Nematocera.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 192 observations on the following 14 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("Date")), list("a POSIXt, the time of counting the individuals in the eklektor trap")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Treatment")), list("a factor with 4 levels, ", list("A"), ", ", list("B"), ", ", list("Standard"), " and ", list("Novum"), ", where ", list("Novum"), " is the novel treatment, ", list("Standard"), " is the standard treatment most similar to ", list("Novum"), ", and ", list("A"), " and ", list("B"), " are additional standard treatments.")), "
", "    ", 
    list(list(list("Block")), list("a numeric vector, specifying the blocks 1-8")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Plot")), list("a factor with 32 levels ", list("A1"), " to ", list("Standard8"), ", indicator variables for the individual eklektors")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Bibio")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Cecido")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(
        list(list("Cerato")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Chiro")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Myceto")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Psycho")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Scato")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("Sciari")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Tipuli")), list("a numeric vector, counts of individuals, belonging to the family")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("Total")), list("a numeric vector, total count of individuals belonging to the suborder Nematocera")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: personal communications, S.Prescher, JKI Braunschweig, Germany

dataset_title: Elephant seal Argos satellite data (2 individuals)
dataset_description: Example elephant seal Argos tracking data. Data were sourced from the Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) - IMOS is supported by the Australian Government through the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy and the Super Science Initiative.
dataset_format: .RData

dataset_title: Fit Bayesian state-space models to animal tracking data
dataset_description: Models provided are DCRW (for location filtering), DCRWS (for location filtering and behavioural state estimation), and their hierarchical versions (hDCRW, hDCRWS) to estimate parameters jointly across multiple individual tracking datasets. The models are fit in JAGS using Markov chain Monte Carlo simulation methods. The models are intended to be fit to Argos satellite tracking data but options exist to allow fits to other tracking data types (type list("?fit_ssm") for details).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Jonsen ID, Mills Flemming J, Myers RA (2005) Robust state-space modeling of animal movement data. Ecology 86:2874-2880 Jonsen ID (2016) Joint estimation over multiple individuals improves behavioural state inference from animal movement data. Scientific Reports 6:20625

dataset_title: Decontamination of the Digestive Tract Mortality, Short Dataset
dataset_description: This dataset gives number of deaths and number of subjects in treatment vs. control groups in 14 studies from a meta-analysis of studies on antiobiotics to reduce infection in intensive-care units.
dataset_format: A data frame with fourteen rows, corresponding to fourteen different, unidentified studies.  There are four columns: number of deaths in the treatment group, sample size in the treatment group, number of deaths in the control group, sample size in the control group. list("Burr and Doss (2005)") give the background for this dataset.
dataset_source: Selective Decontamination of the Digestive Tract Trialists' Collaborative Group (1993). list("Meta-analysis of randomised\n", "  controlled trials of selective decontamination of the digestive tract.") list("British Medical Journal 307") 525--532.
dataset_reference: Burr, D. and Doss, H. (2005). list("A Bayesian semiparametric model\n", "for random-effects meta-analysis.") list("Journal of the American\n", "Statistical Association 100") 242--251.

dataset_description: From the CAPRIE study comparing clopidogrel versus Aspirin, this dataset gives risk ratios and their SEs separately for patients who had stroke, heart attack (myocardial infarction or MI), and peripheral arterial disease (PAD).
dataset_format: A data frame with three rows, corresponding to the three risk groups. There are three columns: study (character, for the risk groups), psi.hat (numeric, the log odds ratio, and se.psi.hat (numeric, estimated SE of the log odds ratio).
dataset_source: CAPRIE Steering Committee (1996), A randomized, blinded trial of clopidogrel versus aspirin in patients at risk of ischaemic events (CAPRIE), list("Lancet") , 348, 1329--1339. Burr and Doss (2005) state how the SEs for the log odds ratios for the three risk groups are obtained from data on p.\ 1334 of the CAPRIE article.
dataset_reference: Burr, D. and Doss, H. (2005).  A Bayesian semi-parametric model for random effects meta analysis. list("The\n", "  Journal of the American Statistical Association") ,100, 242--251.

dataset_description: This dataset gives log odds of breast cancer for long-term aspirin users, and its standard error, derived from 17 cohort and case-control studies.
dataset_format: A data frame with seventeen rows, corresponding to the seventeen papers.  There are two columns: psi.hat (numeric, the log odds ratio), and se.psi.hat (numeric, estimated SE of the log odds ratio). The list("rownames") attribute gives the first author of the paper and the citation number of the study in list("Harris et.\\ al. (2005)") .
dataset_source: Harris, R., Beebe-Donk, J., Doss, H., and Burr, D. (2005). list("Aspirin, ibuprofen, and other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory\n", "  drugs in cancer prevention: A critical review of non-selective\n", "  COX-2 blockade (Review).") list("Oncology Reports 13") 559-583.
dataset_reference: Gonzalez-Perez, A., Rodriguez, L., and Lopez-Ridaura, R. (2003). list("Effects of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs\n", "    on cancer sites other than the colon and rectum: a meta-analysis.") list("BMC Cancer 3") 28. Khuder, S. and Mutgi, A. (2001). list("Breast cancer and\n", "   NSAID use: a meta-analysis.") list("British Journal of Cancer 84") , 1188--1192.

dataset_title: bspmma: Bayesian Semiparametric Models for Meta-Analysis
dataset_description: Two functions carry out Gibbs' sampler routines to estimate the posterior distributions from either a non-parametric Bayesian model for random effects meta-analysis, or from a semi-parametric model.  A group of three functions are used to compute Bayes factors to compare the two models.  Three sample datasets are included.  There are routines for graphing the posteriors and computing summary statistics.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference:
Burr, Deborah (2012). list("bspmma:  An R package for Bayesian
", "  semi-parametric models for meta-analysis.") list("Journal of
", "  Statistical Software") 50(4), 1--23. list("http://www.jstatsoft.org/v50/i04/.") Doss, Hani (2012). list("Hyperparameter and model selection for
", "  nonparametric Bayes problems via Radon-Nikodym derivatives.") list("Statistica Sinica") 22, 1--26.

dataset_description: These data correspond to daily ozone level measurements (in list(list("ppb=ppm x 1000")) ) in New York in May-September, 1973, from the New York State Department of Conservation.
dataset_format: list("ozone") is a data frame with 116 cases (rows).
dataset_source: Leiva, V., Barros, M., Paula, G. e Sanhueza, A. (2007). Generalized BirnbaumSaunders distribution applied to air pollutant concentration. Environmetrics, 19, 235-249. Nadarajah, S. (2007). A truncated inverted beta distribution with application to air pollution data. Stoch. Environ. Res. Risk. Assess., 22, 285-289. Gokhale, S. e Khare, M. (2004) A review of deterministic, stochastic and hybrid vehicular exhaust emission models International. J. Transp. Manag., 2, 59-74.

dataset_title: Birnbaum-Saunders model based on Skew-Normal distribution
dataset_description: It provides the density, distribution function, quantile function, random number generator, reliability function, failure rate, likelihood function, moments and EM algorithm for Maximum Likelihood estimators, also empirical quantile and generated envelope for a given sample, all this for the three parameter Birnbaum-Saunders model based on Skew-Normal Distribution. Additionally, it provides the random number generator for the mixture of Birbaum-Saunders model based on Skew-Normal distribution.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Vilca, Filidor; Santana, L. R.; Leiva, Victor; Balakrishnan, N. (2011). Estimation of extreme percentiles in Birnbaum Saunders distributions. Computational Statistics & Data Analysis (Print), 55, 1665-1678. Santana, Lucia; Vilca, Filidor; Leiva, Victor (2011). Influence analysis in skew-Birnbaum Saunders regression models and applications. Journal of Applied Statistics, 38, 1633-1649.

dataset_description: A monthly time series of retail sales in the US, excluding food services.  In millions of dollars.  Seasonally adjusted.

dataset_description: A weekly time series of US initial claims for unemployment. The first column contains the initial claims numbers from FRED.  The others contain a measure of the relative popularity of various search queries identified by Google Correlate.
dataset_format: zoo time series

dataset_title: New home sales and Google trends
dataset_description: The first column, HSN1FNSA is a time series of new home sales in the US, obtained from the FRED online data base.  The series has been manually deseasonalized.  The remaining columns contain search terms from Google trends (obtained from http://trends.google.com/correlate).  These show the relative popularity of each search term among all serach terms typed into Google.  All series in this data set have been standardized by subtracting off their mean and dividing by their standard deviation.
dataset_format: zoo time series

dataset_description: An intial state specified in Bonzanni et al. It contains a set of Boolean values for 11 genes.
dataset_format: A data frame with 1 row and 11 columns. Rows: each row consists of 1 set of Boolean state. Columns: each column is for 1 gene/variable.

dataset_title: Discrete simulated annual event log data
dataset_description: Data simulated using BG/BB model assumptions. Contains annual transaction behavior for a period of 14 years, for a cohort of 10,000 customers who made their first transactions in 1970.
dataset_format: A comma-delimited file representing an event log with 52432 entries. It has 2 columns: The customer's ID and the date of the transaction in standard R date format.

dataset_description: Data representing the purchasing behavior of 2357 CDNOW customers between January 1997 and June 1998, in event log format.
dataset_format: A comma-delimited file representing an event log with 6919 entries. It has 5 columns: The customer's ID in the master dataset, the customer's ID in this dataset (which represents 1/10th of the master dataset), the date of the transaction in the format list("%Y%m%d") (e.g. 19970225), the number of CDs purchased, and the dollar value of the transaction.
dataset_source: Can be found online at list("www.brucehardie.com/datasets") .

dataset_description: Inflation rate, unemployment rate and treasury bill interest rate for the US, as used by Primiceri (2005). Whereas list("usmacro") covers the time period studied by Primiceri (1953:Q1 to 2001:Q3), list("usmacro.update") updates the data until 2015:Q2.
dataset_format: Multiple time series ( list("mts") ) object, series names: `inf', `une', and `tbi'.
dataset_source: Inflation data provided by Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia (2015): `Real-Time Data Research Center', list("https://www.phil.frb.org/research-and-data/real-time-center/real-time-data/data-files/p") Accessed: 2015-10-29. The inflation rate is the year-over-year log growth rate of the GDP price index. We use the 2001:Q4 vintage of the price index for list("usmacro") , and the 2015:Q3 vintage for list("usmacro.update") . Unemployment and Treasury Bill: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis (2015): `Federal Reserve Economic Data', list("http://research.stlouisfed.org/fred2/") The two series have the identifiers `UNRATE' and `TB3MS'. For each quarter, we compute simple averages over three monthly observations. Disclaimer: Please note that the providers of the original data cannot take responsibility for the data posted here, nor can they answer any questions about them. Users should consult their respective websites for the official and most recent version of the data.
dataset_reference: Primiceri, G.E. (2005): `Time Varying Structural Vector Autoregressions and Monetary Policy', Review of Economic Studies 72, 821-852.

dataset_title: Bayesian Analysis of a Vector Autoregressive Model with Stochastic Volatility and Time-Varying Parameters
dataset_description: R/C++ implementation of the Primiceri (2005) model, which allows for both stochastic volatility and time-varying regression parameters. The package contains functions for computing posterior predictive distributions and impulse responses from the model, based on an input data set.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: list("The code incorporates the recent corrigendum by Del Negro and Primiceri (2015), which points to an error in the original MCMC algorithm of Primiceri (2005).") Del Negro, M. and Primicerio, G.E. (2015). `Time Varying Structural Vector Autoregressions and Monetary Policy: A Corrigendum', Review of Economic Studies 82, 1342-1345. Koop, G. and D. Korobilis (2010): `Bayesian Multivariate Time Series Methods for Empirical Macroeconomics', Foundations and Trends in Econometrics 3, 267-358. Accompanying Matlab code available at list("https://sites.google.com/site/dimitriskorobilis/matlab") . Primiceri, G.E. (2005): `Time Varying Structural Vector Autoregressions and Monetary Policy', Review of Economic Studies 72, 821-852.

dataset_description: PNAT study-based simulated data set of 122 variants as described in Quintana and Conti (submitted).  The first column represents the disease status of the individual, the remaining columns the counts of minor alleles (0|1|2) for each variant.  The simulation was created by using the genotype data from a systems-based candidate gene study of smoking cessation as part of the Pharmacogenetics of Nicotine Addiction and Treatment Consortium.  In particular, data set was formed from genotypes of 122 variants within 789 individuals. The 122 variants are from 7 unique gene regions and thus are comprised of a great deal of correlation between the markers within each gene.  In this simulation we assumed that the predictor-level covariate corresponding to the gene list("CHRNB2") was informative with regards to which variants are associated with smoking cessation.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Quintana M, Conti D (Submitted). list("Integrative Variable Selection via Bayesian Model \n", "  Uncertainty") .

dataset_title: Bayesian Variant Selection: Bayesian Model Uncertainty Techniques for Genetic Association Studies
dataset_description: The functions in this package focus on analyzing case-control association studies involving a group of genetic variants.  In particular, we are interested in modeling the outcome variable as a function of a multivariate genetic profile using Bayesian model uncertainty and variable selection techniques.  The package incorporates functions to analyze data sets involving common variants as well as extensions to model rare variants via the Bayesian Risk Index (BRI of Quintana and Conti (2011)) as well as haplotypes.  Finally, the package also allows the incorporation of external biological information to inform the marginal inclusion probabilities via the iBMU (Quintana and Conti (submitted)).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Quintana M, Conti D (2011). list("Incorporating Model Uncertainty in Detecting Rare Variants: \n", "  The Bayesian Risk Index") . Genetic Epidemiology 35:638-649. Quintana M, Conti D (Submitted). list("Integrative Variable Selection via Bayesian Model \n", "  Uncertainty") .

dataset_title: Fisher Test p-values for End of Trial Data Clinical Data
dataset_description: This data set the p-values for a comparison between adverse events on each arm of a clinical trial.
dataset_format: A dataframe with columns list("B") - body-system, list("AE") - adverse event, list("p") - p-value for two-sided Fisher exact test. The dataframe contains 45 observations.

dataset_title: End of Trial Data Clinical Data for Adverse Event Indicence
dataset_description: This data set contains the counts of adverse event incidence for the trial.
dataset_format: A dataframe with columns list("B") - body-system, list("AE") - adverse event, list("Group") - 1 for control, 2 for treatment, list("Count") - total adverse event incidence, list("Total") - total patients on the trial arm. The dataframe contains 90 observations.

dataset_description: This data set contains count of the adverse events over the first two intervals of a clinical trial.
dataset_format: A dataframe with columns list("interval") , list("I_index") - the interval order, list("B") - body-system, list("AE") - adverse event, list("Group") - 1 for control, 2 for treatment, list("Count") - total adverse events that occurred in the interval, list("Exposure") - the total time all at risk subjects spent in the interval. The dataframe contains 1860 observations.

dataset_description: This data set contains count of the adverse events over all intervals of a clinical trial.
dataset_format: A dataframe with columns list("interval") , list("I_index") - the interval order, list("B") - body-system, list("AE") - adverse event, list("Group") - 1 for control, 2 for treatment, list("Count") - total adverse events that occurred in the interval, list("Exposure") - the total time all at risk subjects spent in the interval. The dataframe contains 3100 observations.

dataset_description:
A data set from the MLC++ machine learning software for modeling customer churn. There are 19 predictors, mostly numeric: list("state") (categorical), list("account_length") , list("area_code") list("international_plan") (yes/no), list("voice_mail_plan") list("number_vmail_messages") list("total_day_minutes") list("total_day_calls") list("total_day_charge") list("total_eve_minutes") list("total_eve_calls") list("total_eve_charge") list("total_night_minutes") list("total_night_calls") list("total_night_charge") list("total_intl_minutes") list("total_intl_calls") list("total_intl_charge") and list("number_customer_service_calls") . The outcome is contained in a column called list("churn") (also yes/no). The training data has 3333 samples and the test set contains 1667. A note in one of the source files states that the data are "artificial based on claims similar to real world". A rule-based model shown on the RuleQuest website contains 19 rules, including: list("
", "Rule 1: (2221/60, lift 1.1)
", "    international plan = no
", "    total day minutes <= 223.2
", "    number customer service calls <= 3
", "    ->  class 0  [0.973]
", "
", "Rule 5: (1972/87, lift 1.1)
", "    total day minutes <= 264.4
", "    total intl minutes <= 13.1
", "    total intl calls > 2
", "    number customer service calls <= 3
", "    ->  class 0  [0.955]
", "
", "Rule 10: (60, lift 6.8)
", "    international plan = yes
", "    total intl calls <= 2
", 
    "    ->  class 1  [0.984]
", "
", "Rule 12: (32, lift 6.7)
", "    total day minutes <= 120.5
", "    number customer service calls > 3
", "    ->  class 1  [0.971]
") This implementation of C5.0 contains the same rules, but the rule numbers are different than above.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Sediment and stream discharge data for Fraser River at Hope
dataset_description: A dataset consisting of daily observations of suspended sediment concentration (SSC) (mg/L) and stream discharge (Q) (cu. m/s) for the years 1970-1979 at the Fraser River at Hope station in British Columbia, Canada (Water Survey of Canada station 08MF005). Samples are split into a seven year training period (1970-1976) and a three year testing period (1977-1979). In terms of structure, list("FraserSediment") is a list with four elements: list("x.1970.1976") , list("y.1970.1976") list("x.1977.1979") and list("y.1977.1979") . are matrices with predictor variables: list("logQ") , log-transformed Q; and list("dQ5") list("dQ30") , and list("dQ90") , 5-, 30-, and 90-day moving averages of daily changes in Q. are matrices with the predictand variable list("SSC")
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Conditional Density Estimation Network Construction and Evaluation (CaDENCE)
dataset_description: A conditional density estimation network (CDEN) is a probabilistic extension of the standard multi-layer perceptron neural network (MLP) (Neuneier et al., 1994). A CDEN model allows users to estimate parameters of a specified probability distribution conditioned upon values of a set of predictors using the MLP architecture. The result is a flexible nonlinear model that can be used to calculate the conditional mean, variance, prediction intervals, etc. based on the specified distribution. Because the CDEN is based on the MLP, nonlinear relationships, including those involving complicated interactions between predictors, can be described by the modelling framework. The CaDENCE (Conditional Density Estimation Network Creation & Evaluation) package provides routines for creating and evaluating CDEN models in the R programming language.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Cannon, A.J., 2012. Neural networks for probabilistic environmental prediction: Conditional Density Estimation Network Creation & Evaluation (CaDENCE) in R. Computers & Geosciences 41: 126-135. doi:10.1016/j.cageo.2011.08.023 Neuneier, R., F. Hergert, W. Finnoff, and D. Ormoneit, 1994., Estimation of conditional densities: a comparison of neural network approaches. In: M. Marinaro and P. Morasso (eds.), Proceedings of ICANN 94, Berlin, Springer, p. 689-692.

dataset_title: Tables of coefficients to compute p-values
dataset_description: These tables contain the response surface coefficients needed to compute the p-value of Hansen's CADF test (see Costantini et al., 2007; Lupi, 2009). list("coeffs_ct") , list("coeffs_c") list("coeffs_nc") are the relevant tables for the constant plus trend, constant, and no constant case, respectively.
dataset_format: The tables are saved as binary data list(".rda") objects. They are list(list("(1005 \\times 5)")) matrices, where the first column represents probabilities and the following four columns are list(list("\\beta_0, \\ldots, \\beta_3")) in eqn. (13) in Costantini et al. (2007) (see also Lupi, 2009).
dataset_reference: Costantini M, Lupi C, Popp S (2007), A Panel-CADF Test for Unit Roots, University of Molise, list("Economics & Statistics Discussion Paper") 39/07. list("http://econpapers.repec.org/paper/molecsdps/esdp07039.htm") . Lupi C (2009). Unit Root CADF Testing with R, list("Journal of Statistical Software") , list("32") (2), 1--19. list("http://www.jstatsoft.org/v32/i02/")

dataset_title: Weighting and Estimation for Panel Data with Non-Response
dataset_description: CalibrateSSB is an R-package that handles repeated surveys with partially overlapping samples. Initially the samples are weighted by linear calibration using known or estimated population totals. A robust model based covariance matrix for all relevant estimated totals is calculated from the residuals according to the calibration model. Alternatively a design based covariance matrix is calculated in a very similar way. A cluster robust version is also possible. In the case of estimated populations totals the covariance matrix is adjusted by utilizing the theory of Särndal and Lundström (2005). Variances of linear combinations (changes and averages) and ratios are calculated from this covariance matrix. The linear combinations and ratios can involve variables within and/or between sample waves. list()
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Langsrud, Ø (2016): list("A variance estimation R-package\n", "for repeated surveys - useful for estimates of changes in quarterly and annual averages") , list("New Challenges for Statistical Software - The Use of R in Official Statistics") , Bucharest, Romania, 7-8 April. list() Särndal, C.-E. and Lundström, S. (2005): list("Estimation in Surveys with Nonresponse") , John Wiley and Sons, New York.

dataset_description: Toy datasets that illustrate the package.
dataset_format: The list("D1.toy") matrix is 8 rows of code run points, with five columns.  The first two columns are the lat and long and the next three are parameter values. list("D2.toy") matrix is five rows of observations on two variables, list("x") and list("y") which are styled list("latitude and longitude") . list("d.toy") is the list("data") vector consisting of length 13: elements 1-8 are code runs and elements 9-13 are observations. list("theta.toy") is a vector of length three that is a working example of list(list("\\theta"), list("theta")) .  The parameters are designed to work with list("computer.model()") list("t.vec.toy") is a matrix of eight rows and three columns.  Each row specifies a value for .  The eight rows correspond to  eight code runs. list("x.toy") list("x.toy2") are vectors of length two that gives a sample point at which observations may be made (or the code run). The gloss of the two elements is latitude and longitude. list("x.vec") is a matrix whose rows are reasonable x values but list("not") those in list("y.toy") is a vector of length eight.  Each element corresponds to the output from a code run at each of the rows of list("z.toy") is a vector of length five.  Each element corresponds to a measurement at each of the rows of list("V.toy") is a five by five variance-covariance matrix for the toy datasets. list("X.dist.toy") is a toy example of a distribution of list("X") for use in calibrated uncertainty analysis, section 4.2. list("Brief description of toy functions fully documented under their own manpage") Function list("create.new.toy.datasets()") creates new toy datasets with any number of observations and code runs. list("E.theta.toy()") returns expectation of list("H(D)") with respect to ; list("Edash.theta.toy()") returns expectation with respect to list(list("E'"), list("Edash")) list("extractor.toy()") extracts list("x.star.toy") from list("D2") ; toy example needed because the extraction differs from case to case. list("H1.toy()") applies basis functions to rows of list("D1") list("phi.fun.toy()") creates a hyperparameter object such as list("phi.toy") in a form suitable for passing to the other functions in the library. list("phi.change.toy()") modifies the hyperparameter object. list("See the helpfiles listed in the ", list("see also"), " section\n", "  below")

dataset_title: Aspirin use and breast cancer risk
dataset_description: This data set can be used to examine the recent epidemiological studies on aspirin use and breast cancer risk published from 2001 to 2007 within a meta-analysis, and to investigate reasons for heterogeneity between the individual studies. list() We systematically searched for cohort-studies and case-control-studies from 2001-2007, which evaluated the association between aspirin and breast cancer risk. A total of 15 studies (seven cohort studies and eight case-control studies) met the inclusion criteria.
dataset_format: A data frame consisting of 15 data sets (rows) and 11 attributes (columns)
dataset_reference: Schlattmann, P.(2009) list("Medical Applications of Finite Mixture Models.") Berlin: Springer.

dataset_title: Meta-analysis if vitamin A supplementation of childhood mortality
dataset_description: Supplementation of vitamins is not only supposed to be beneficial for the prevention of cancer as discussed in Sect. 2.1. Fawzi et al. (1993) study the effect of vitamin A supplementation and childhood mortality in preschool children. They concluded that vitamin A supplements are associated with a significant reduction in mortality when given periodically to children at the community level.  All studies were community randomized trials from South Asia or Southeast Asia, except the second study, which was from northern Sudan. This data set contains the log relative risk and corresponding variance. The data is supplied in three different formats
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Meta-anaysis: noninvasive coronary angiography using computed tomography (CT)
dataset_description: CT  for ruling out clinically significant coronary artery disease (CAD) in adults with suspected or known CAD. The accuracy and clinical value of CT  was assessed in this meta-analysis. MEDLINE, EMBASE, and ISI Web of Science searches from inception through 2 June 2009 and bibliographies of reviews. Prospective English- or German-language studies that compared CT or MRI with conventional coronary angiography in all patients and included sufficient data for compilation of 2 x 2 tables. Two investigators independently extracted patient and study characteristics; differences were resolved by consensus. 89 studies comprising 7516 assessed the diagnostic value of CT.

dataset_title: Procalcitonin as diagnostic marker for sepsis
dataset_description: Procalcitonin is a promising marker for identification of bacterial infections. The accuracy and clinical value of procalcitonin for diagnosis of sepsis in critically ill patients was assessed in this meta-analysis. Medline, Embase, ISI Web of Knowledge, the Cochrane Library, Scopus, BioMed Central, and Science Direct were searched, from inception to Feb 21, 2012, and reference lists of identified primary studies. We included articles written in English, German, or French that investigated procalcitonin for differentiation of septic patients--those with sepsis, severe sepsis, or septic shock--from those with a systemic inflammatory response syndrome of non-infectious origin. Studies of healthy people, patients without probable infection, and children younger than 28 days were excluded. Two independent investigators extracted patient and study characteristics; discrepancies were resolved by consensus. This search returned 3487 reports, of which 30 fulfilled the inclusion criteria, accounting for 3244 patients.

dataset_description: Observational studies have suggested that low dietary intake or low plasma concentrations of retinol, beta-carotene, or other carotenoids might be associated with increased risk of developing certain types of cancer.  However, relatively few studies have investigated the determinants of plasma concentrations of these micronutrients. Nierenberg et al. designed a cross-sectional study to investigate the relationship between personal characteristics and dietary factors, and plasma concentrations of retinol, beta-carotene and other carotenoids. Study subjects (N = 315) were patients who had an elective surgical procedure during a three-year period to biopsy or remove a lesion of the lung, colon, breast, skin, ovary or uterus that was found to be non-cancerous.

dataset_title: Overview of the functions in the camtrapR package
dataset_description: This package provides a streamlined workflow for processing data generated in camera trap-based wildlife studies and prepares input for further analyses, particularly in occupancy and spatial capture-recapture frameworks. It suggests a simple data structure and provides functions for managing digital camera trap photographs, generating record tables, maps of species richness and species detections and species activity diagrams. It further helps prepare subsequent analyses by creating detection/non-detection matrices for occupancy analyses, e.g. in the list("unmarked") package, and list("capthist") objects for spatial capture-recapture analyses in the list("secr") package. In addition, basic survey statistics are computed. The functions build on one another in a logical sequence. The only manual input needed it species (and individual) identification, which is achieved by moving images into species directories or by tagging images in image management software. Besides, a table holding basic information about camera trap station IDs, locations and trapping periods must be created in spreadsheet software.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Niedballa, J., Sollmann, R., Courtiol, A., Wilting, A. (2016): camtrapR: an R package for efficient camera trap data management. dataset_description: Pre-stored dataset for project MDA231. A transplantable metastasis model system was derived from a heterogeneous human breast cancer cell line MDA-MB-231. Cancer cells from the parental line MDA-MB-231 were engrafted into mouse hosts leading to organ-specific metastasis. Mixed cell populations (MCPs) were in vivo selected from either bone or lung metastasis and grew into phenotypically stable and metastatically competent cancer cell lines. The parental line as well as the MCP sublines were whole-exome sequenced with somatic SNAs and CNAs profiled.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Mouse cross data from Reifsnyder et al. (2000)
dataset_description: Data from a cross between non-obese, non-diabetic (NON) mice, and diabetes-prone New Zealand obese (NZO) mice. The experiment is described in Reifsnyder et al. (2000). The data object is a list. The first element is a matrix of phenotype data. In includes insulin levels (ng/mL), plasma glucose levels (mg/dL), total body weight (g), all measured at age 24 weeks. The second element is the genotype matrix containing the genotype of each mouse at each of 85 markers across the  genome. The final elements are the chromosome vector, which indicates which chromosome on which each marker is found, and a vector of chromosomal positions indicating the location of each marker on the chromosome in centimorgans (cM).
dataset_source: Reifsnyder, P. C. (2000). Maternal Environment and Genotype Interact to Establish Diabesity in Mice. Genome Research, 10(10), 1568-1578.

dataset_title: Combinatorial Analysis of Epistasis and Pleiotropy
dataset_description: This package infers predictive networks between genetic variants and between genetic variants and phenotypes. It uses complementary information of pleiotropic gene variants across different phenotypes to resolve models of epistatic interactions between genetic variants. To do this, cape reparameterizes main effect and interaction coefficients from a pairwise variant regressions into directed influence parameters. These parameters describe how gene variants influence each other, in terms of suppression and enhancement, as well as how gene variants influence phenotypes.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Carter, G. W., Hays, M., Sherman, A., & Galitski, T. (2012). Use of pleiotropy to model genetic interactions in a population. PLoS genetics, 8(10), e1003010. doi:10.1371/journal.pgen.1003010

dataset_description: The dataset contains a molecular phylogeny of 249 species of British birds and a data frame containing information on the conservation status of 181 of those species. The dataset is taken from Thomas (2008)
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Thomas, G. H. (2008). Phylogenetic distributions of british birds of conservation concern. Proceedings of the Royal Society B-Biological Sciences, 275(1647):2077-2083.

dataset_description: These data files and model objects contain input datasets for benchmarking the caper package against other implementations and the results returned by those other implementations. For more details, see the benchmark vignette for caper.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_title: Comparative analysis of phylogenetics and evolution in R (caper)
dataset_description: The list("caper") package provides a set of functions to conduct comparative analyses using both independent contrasts and phylogenetic generalised least squares methods. It also provides functions to combine phylogeny objects with data frames into simple comparative datasets and some utility functions for manipulating phylogenies. In addition to linear models correcting for phylogeny, the package also provides functions to test tree imbalance, calculate various measures of phylogenetic diversity and simulate phylogenies and traits.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: This package includes functions for model selection via penalization. The model selection criterion has the following form: list(list("\\gamma_n (\\hat{s}_m)+scoef\\times\\kappa\\times pen_{shape}(m)")) . Two algorithms based on the slope heuristics are proposed to calibrate the parameter list(list("\\kappa")) in the penalty: the list("data-driven slope estimation algorithm (DDSE)") and the list("dimension jump algorithm (Djump)")
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: list("http://www.math.univ-toulouse.fr/~maugis/CAPUSHE.html") list("http://www.math.u-psud.fr/~brault/capushe.html") Article: Baudry, J.-P., Maugis, C. and Michel, B. (2011) Slope heuristics: overview and implementation. list("Statistics and Computing") , to appear. doi: 10.1007/ s11222-011-9236-1

dataset_description: A dataframe example for the list(list("capushe package")) based on a simulated Gaussian mixture dataset in list(list("\\R^3")) .

", "    ", list(list(list("pen")), list("a numeric vector")), ": model penalty shape values.
", "    ", list(list(list("complexity")), list("a numeric vector")), ": model complexity values.

", "      ")

dataset_description: This is a data set consisting of capture count data published in Banks et al. 2003 from northern hairy-nosed wombats (Lasiorhinus kretii). It is used as an example in the list("capwire") tutorial.
dataset_format: A two-column data frame capture.class: class assignment where individuals in class i were caught i times No.Ind: the number of individuals in each capture.class
dataset_source: Banks, S. C., S. D. Hoyle, A. Horsup, P. Sunnucks, and A. C. Taylor. 2003. Demographic monitoring of an entire species (the northern hairy-nosed wombat, Lasiorhinus kretii) by genetic analysis of non-invasively collected material. Animal Conservation 6:101-107. DOI: 10.1017/S1367943003003135

dataset_title: Estimate Population Size from Non-Invasive Sampling
dataset_description: capwire uses capture-recapture models which allow for sampling individuals multiple times per session to estimate population size from non-invasive samples. These models were originally implemented in the Java program Capwire (Miller et al. 2005) The models all assume that individuals can be identified with certainty (usually with, but not limited to) genetic data. The package also includes functions to compare models, get confidence intervals using a parametric bootstrap and simulate data under a variety of conditions.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Miller C. R., P. Joyce and L.P. Waits. 2005. A new method for estimating the size of small populations from genetic mark-recapture data. Molecular Ecology 14:1991-2005. Pennell M.W., C.R. Stansbury, L.P. Waits and C.R. Miller. submitted. capwire: A R Package for Estimating Population Census Size from Non-Invasive Genetic Sampling

dataset_description: The list("Adler") data frame has 97 rows and 3 columns. The ``experimenters'' were the actual subjects of the study. They collected ratings of the apparent successfulness of people in pictures who were pre-selected for their average appearance. The experimenters were told prior to collecting data that the pictures were either high or low in their appearance of success, and were instructed to get good data, scientific data, or were given no such instruction. Each experimenter collected ratings from 18 randomly assigned respondents; a few subjects were deleted at random to produce an unbalanced design.
dataset_format:
This data frame contains the following columns: list("
", "    ", list(list("instruction"), list("
", "     a factor with levels:
", "     ", list("GOOD"), ", good data;
", "     ", list("NONE"), ", no stress;
", "     ", list("SCIENTIFIC"), ", scientific data.
", "     ")), "
", "    ", list(list("expectation"), list("
", "     a factor with levels:
", "     ", list("HIGH"), ", expect high ratings;
", "     ", list("LOW"), ", expect low ratings.
", "     ")), "
", "    ", list(list("rating"), list("
", "     The average rating obtained.  
", 
    "     ")), "
", "   ")
dataset_source: Adler, N. E. (1973) Impact of prior sets given experimenters and subjects on the experimenter expectancy effect. list("Sociometry") list("36") , 113--126.
dataset_reference: Erickson, B. H., and Nosanchuk, T. A. (1977) list("Understanding Data.") McGraw-Hill Ryerson.

dataset_description: This is a three-factor experiment with each factor at three levels, for a total of 27 runs.  Samples of worsted yarn were with different levels of the three factors were given a cyclic load until the sample failed.  The goal is to understand how cycles to failure depends on the factors.

", "    ", list(list("len"), list("
", " length of specimen (250, 300, 350 mm)

", " amplitude of loading cycle (8, 9, 10 min)
", "    ")), "
", "    ", list(list("load"), list("
", " load (40, 45, 50g)
", "    ")), "
", "    ", list(list("cycles"), list("
", " number of cycles until failure
", "    ")), "
", " ")

dataset_title: Property sales data for the Greater Glasgow and Clyde health board between 2003 and 2013.
dataset_description: A data.frame object containing spatio-temporal data on property sales and the total number of properties for the 271 Intermediate Geographies (IG) that make up the Greater Glasgow and Clyde health board in Scotland. Yearly data are available between 2003 and 2013 inclusive. These data are used in a worked example in the vignette accompanying the CARBayesST package.
dataset_format:
A data.frame object containing 2981 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "        ", list(list(list("IG")), list("The unique identifier for each IG.")), "
", "        ", list(list(list("year")), list("The year the data relate to.")), "
", "        ", list(list(list("sales")), list("The number of property sales in each IG and year.")), "

", "    ")

dataset_title: Data Used in the Vignettes Accompanying the CARBayes and CARBayesST Packages
dataset_description: Spatio-temporal data from Scotland used in the vignettes accompanying the CARBayes (spatial modelling) and CARBayesST (spatio-temporal modelling) packages. For the CARBayes vignette the data include the Scottish lip cancer data and property price and respiratory hospitalisation datas from the Greater Glasgow and Clyde health board. For the CARBayesST vignette the data include spatio-temporal data on property sales and respiratory hospitalisation and air pollution from the Greater Glasgow and Clyde health board.
dataset_format: NA

dataset_description: These purely spatial data summarise overall lip cancer cases and possible covariate risk factors for the period 1975 to 1986, for 56 districts in Scotland. These data  are used in a worked example in the vignette accompanying the CARBayes package.

", "    ", list(list(list("observed")), list("The number of recorded lip cancer cases in each 
", "    district.")), "

", "    district computed using indirect standardisation using Scotland-wide disease 
", "    rates.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("pcaff")), list("The percetage of the workforce in each district 
", "    employed in agriculture, fishing and forestry.")), "
", "    ", list(
    list(list("latitude")), list("The latitude of the centroid of each district.")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("longitude")), list("The longitude of the centroid of each district.")), "
", "  ")

dataset_title: Data of a searcher efficiency trial
dataset_description: Data containing the number of seen and not-seen items of a searcher efficiency trial performed in 3 different vegetation densities (visibilities) and for various persons.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 17 observations on the following 4 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("person")), list("a factor with the names of the persons")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("visibility")), list("a factor with visibility classes (vegetation densities)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("detected")), list("a numeric vector indicating the number of found items")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("notdetected")), list("a numeric vector indicating the number of not found items")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Niermann I, Brinkmann R, Korner-Nievergelt F, Behr O (2011) Systematische Schlagopfersuche - Methodische Rahmenbedingungen, statistische Analyseverfahren und Ergebnisse. list("In:") Brinkmann R, Niermann I, Behr O, editors. Entwicklung von Methoden zur Untersuchung und Reduktion des Kollisionsrisikos von Fledermaeusen an Onshore-Windenergieanlagen Goettingen: Cuvillier Verlag. pp. 40-115.

dataset_title: Times until removal for brown mice carcasses
dataset_description: Experimental data to measure persistence time of bat-sized mammal carcasses. In total, 595 brown mice and 41 bat carcasses have been put on the ground at 30 different sites (turbineID). During 14 days, the carcasses have been observed and the number of days until their disappearance was noted. All carcasses that did not disappear until day 14 were marked as censored (status=0) in the data.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 636 observations on the following 3 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("turbineID")), list("a factor with site or turbine names")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("perstime")), list("a numeric vector containing the days until disappearance (persistence times)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("status")), list("a numeric vector 1 = disappearance is observed, 0 = no disappearance until end of study (censored)")), "
", "  ")
dataset_source: Niermann, I., R. Brinkmann, F. Korner-Nievergelt, and O. Behr. 2011. Systematische Schlagopfersuche - Methodische Rahmenbedingungen, statistische Analyseverfahren und Ergebnisse. Pages 40-115 in R. Brinkmann, O. Behr, I. Niermann, and M. Reich, editors. Entwicklung von Methoden zur Untersuchung und Reduktion des Kollisionsrisikos von Fledermaeusen an Onshore-Windenergieanlagen. Cuvillier Verlag, Goettingen.
dataset_reference: Niermann, I., R. Brinkmann, F. Korner-Nievergelt, and O. Behr. 2011. Systematische Schlagopfersuche - Methodische Rahmenbedingungen, statistische Analyseverfahren und Ergebnisse. Pages 40-115 in R. Brinkmann, O. Behr, I. Niermann, and M. Reich, editors. Entwicklung von Methoden zur Untersuchung und Reduktion des Kollisionsrisikos von Fledermaeusen an Onshore-Windenergieanlagen. Cuvillier Verlag, Goettingen.

dataset_title: Distribution of bat carcasses below wind turbines
dataset_description: The data contains the proportion of bats killed at wind turbines falling into different 10m-distance rings from the turbine. It is a collection of empirical and theoretical estimates from different publications.
dataset_format:
A data frame with 6 observations on the following 16 variables. list("
", "    ", list(list(list("studyname")), list("a factor with the name of the study")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("study")), list("a factor with the code of the study, see tutorial")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("rotor.diameter.m")), list("a numeric vector giving the average rotor diameter (in m) for the turbines investigated")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("nacelle.height.m")), list("a numeric vector giving the average nacelle height (in m) for the turbines investigated")), "
", "    ", 
    list(list(list("n")), list("a numeric vector indicating the sample size (i.e. numbers of carcasses found)")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("method")), list("a factor indicating the method used to obtain the carcass distribution. ", list("empirical"), ": based on field data, ", list("physical_model"), ": according to a theoretical ballistic model")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("species")), list("a factor with only one level at the moment ", list("bat"))), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop10m")), 
        list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 0 and 10 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop20m")), list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 10 and 20 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop30m")), list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 20 and 30 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop40m")), list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 30 and 40 m from the turbine")), 
    "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop50m")), list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 40 and 50 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop60m")), list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 50 and 60 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop70m")), list("a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 60 and 70 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop80m")), list(
        "a numeric vector with the proportion of killed bats lying in between 70 and 80 m from the turbine")), "
", "    ", list(list(list("prop50mplus")), list("a numeric vector: the sum of prop60m, prop70m and prop80m")), "
", "  ")

dataset_title: Estimation of caribou abundance based on large scale aggregations monitored by radio telemetry
dataset_description: This is a package for estimating the population size of migratory caribou herds based on large scale aggregations monitored by radio telemetry. It implements the methodology found in the article by Rivest et al. (1998) about caribou abundance estimation. It also includes a function based on the Lincoln-Petersen Index as applied to radio telemetry data by White and Garrott (1990).

dataset_reference: Rivest, L.-P., Couturier, S. and Crepeau, H. (1998). (1990). list("Analysis of wildlife radio-tracking data") . San Diego: Academic Press.
