dataset_title: Sets of focal and reference item parameters from Wright (2011).
dataset_description: This data set contains the item parameters found in Wright, K. (2011). Improvements for Differential Funtioning of Items and Tests (DFIT): Investigating the addition of reporting an effect size measure and power Unpublished doctoral dissertation). Georgia State University, USA.
dataset_format: a list with 'focal' and 'reference' elements. Each is a list("matrix") 1 row per item by 3 columns: item discrimination, difficulty and guessing parameters.
dataset_source: This data set contains the item parameters based on those found in Wright, K. (2011).
dataset_reference: Wright, K. (2011). Improvements for Differential Funtioning of Items and Tests (DFIT): Investigating the addition of reporting an effect size measure and power (Unpublished doctoral dissertation). Georgia State University, USA.

dataset_title: Sets of focal and reference item parameters from Raju et al. (2009)
dataset_description: This data set contains the item parameters found in Raju, N., Fortmann-Johnson, K., Kim, W., Morris, S., Nering, M. & Oshima, T. (2009). The item parameter replication method for detecting differential functioning in the polytomous DFIT framework. Applied psychological measurement, 33(2), 133--147.
dataset_format: a list with 'focal' and 'reference' elements. Each is a list("matrix") 1 row per item by 5 columns: item discrimination, four item step parameters.
dataset_source: This data set contains the item parameters based on those found in Raju et al. (2009).
dataset_reference: Raju, N., Fortmann-Johnson, K., Kim, W., Morris, S., Nering, M. & Oshima, T. (2009). The item parameter replication method for detecting differential functioning in the polytomous DFIT framework. Applied psychological measurement, 33(2), 133--147. doi: 10.1177/01466216083319514

dataset_description: This data set contains the data given in Table 9.2 by Ryan (2011, p. 323). The sample comprises 20 subgroups, each with 4 observations, on two quality characteristics list(list("X_1"), list("X1")) and list(list("X_2"), list("X2")) . According to Ryan (2011), the 10th and 20th subgroups are out-of-control.
dataset_format: A 2x4x20 array.
dataset_reference: T. P. Ryan (2011), list("Statistical Methods for Quality Improvement") , 3rd ed., Wiley.

dataset_description: This data set contains 189 ferric-oxide individual measurement collected in an aluminum smelter.
dataset_format: A vector of length 189.
dataset_reference: M. D. Holland, D. M. Hawkins (2014) list("A Control Chart Based on a\n", "    Nonparametric Multivariate Change-Point Model") , list("Journal of\n", "    Quality Technology") list("46") pp 63--77.

dataset_description: This data set contains the colonscopy times (minutes) for 30 subgroups of 5 patients given in Allison Jones-Farmer list("et al.") (2009).
dataset_format: A 5x30 matrix.
dataset_reference: L. A. Jones-Farmer, V. Jordan, C. W. Champs (2009) list("Distribution-free Phase I control charts for subgroup location") , list("Journal of Quality Technology") list("41") , pp. 304--316.

dataset_description: This data set contains 56 individual bivariate observations from a gravel-producing plant given by Holmes and Mergen (1993). There are two variables measuring the percentage of the particles (by weight) that are large or medium in size, respectively.
dataset_format: A 2x56 matrix.
dataset_reference: D. S. Holmes, A. Mergen (1993) list("Improving the Performance of the ", list(list("T^2"), list("T2")), " Control\n", "    Chart") , list("Quality Engineering") list("5") , pp. 619--625.

dataset_description: This simulated data set consists in 50 subgroups, each with 5 observations, on 4 variables. There is an isolated location shift involving only the first variable at time list(list("t=10")) and a step shift, involving the third and fourth variables, starting from list(list("t=31")) . The in-control distribution is Student's t with 3 degrees of freedom, zero mean and such that list(list("cov(X_i,X_j)=0.8^{|i-j|}"), list("cov(Xi,Xj)=0.8^abs(i-j)")) . See the example for the exact code used to simulate the data.
dataset_format: A 4x5x50 array.

dataset_description: c("\\Sexpr[results=rd,stage=build]{tools:::Rd_package_description(\"#1\")}", "dfphase1") list("tools:::Rd_package_description(\"dfphase1\")")
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference:
G. Capizzi (2015) list("Recent advances in process monitoring: Nonparametric and variable-selection
", "    methods for Phase I and Phase II (with discussion)") . list("Quality
", "    Engineering") , list("27") , pp. 44--80. G. Capizzi and G. Masarotto (2013), list("Phase I Distribution-Free Analysis of Univariate Data") list("Journal of Quality Technology") list("45") , pp. 273-284. G. Capizzi and G. Masarotto (2016), list("Phase I Distribution-Free Analysis with the R
", "    Package ", list("dfphase1")) . To appear on list("Frontiers in Statistical Quality Control 12") , eds. S. Knoth and W. Schmid, Springer. G. Capizzi and G. Masarotto (2016), Phase I Distribution-Free Analysis of Multivariate Data, list("Technometrics") to appear, list("http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/00401706.2016.1272494")

dataset_title: The data stan_f includes all the Stan models that dfpk package uses.
dataset_description: A character vector with paths to .stan files to include in the package.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Ursino, M., et al, (2017) Dose-finding methods for Phase I clinical trials using pharmacokinetics in small populations, Biometrical Journal.

dataset_title: A Bayesian Dose-Finding Design using Pharmacokinetics(PK) for Phase I Clinical Trials.
dataset_description: Statistical methods involving PK measures are provided, in the dose allocation process during a Phase I clinical trials. These methods enter pharmacokinetics (PK) in the dose finding designs in different ways, including covariates models, dependent variable or hierarchical models. This package provides functions to generate data from several scenarios and functions to run simulations which their objective is to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Ursino, M., et al, (2017) Dose-finding methods for Phase I clinical trials using pharmacokinetics in small populations, Biometrical Journal.

dataset_title: All Decomposable Graphical Models on Three Lists
dataset_description: This dataset contains all of the cliques and separators for each of the decomposable graphical models on three lists. On three lists, this is all of the models.
dataset_format: A list of lists. graphs3[[i]] is the list("i") th model under consideration. This consists of graphs3[[i]]$C, all of the cliques in that model, and graphs3[[i]]$S, the separators.

dataset_title: All Decomposable Graphical Models on Four Lists
dataset_description: This dataset contains all of the cliques and separators for each of the decomposable graphical models on four lists.
dataset_format: A list of lists. graphs4[[i]] is the list("i") th model under consideration. This consists of graphs4[[i]]$C, all of the cliques in that model, and graphs4[[i]]$S, the separators.

dataset_title: All Decomposable Graphical Models on Five Lists
dataset_description: This dataset contains all of the cliques and separators for each of the decomposable graphical models on five lists.
dataset_format: A list of lists. graphs5[[i]] is the list("i") th model under consideration. This consists of graphs5[[i]]$C, all of the cliques in that model, and graphs5[[i]]$S, the separators.

dataset_title: Capture-Recapture Estimation using Bayesian Model Averaging
dataset_description: Performs Bayesian model averaging over all decomposable graphical models, each representing a different  list dependence structure,  with the goal of estimating the number of uncounted elements from the universe of elements that could have been recorded or ``captured".  The code here is an implementation of the model described in Madigan and York (1997).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Madigan, David, and Jeremy C. York. "Bayesian methods for estimation of the size of a closed population."  Biometrika 84.1 (1997): 19-31.

dataset_title: Single-cell gene expression data from different brain cell types.
dataset_description: This data set has been filtered to include the genes that are in the 95th percentile or above in both oligodendrocytes and neurons. The total data set can be downloaded by following the links in the original paper.
dataset_format: An object of class list("data.frame") with 572 rows and 158 columns.
dataset_reference: Darmanis S, Sloan SA, Zhang Y, et al. A survey of human brain transcriptome diversity at the single cell level. Proc Natl Acad Sci USA. 2015;112(23):7285-90.

dataset_description: A vector specifying the ages of the brain cell types from the single-cell RNA-seq study. The total data set can be downloaded by following the links in the original paper.
dataset_format: An object of class list("numeric") of length 158.
dataset_reference: Darmanis S, Sloan SA, Zhang Y, et al. A survey of human brain transcriptome diversity at the single cell level. Proc Natl Acad Sci USA. 2015;112(23):7285-90.

dataset_title: Design matrix of cell type specifications of the single-cell RNA-seq samples.
dataset_description: Cell type specifications were performed by the authors. The total data set can be downloaded by following the links in the original paper.
dataset_format: An object of class list("matrix") with 158 rows and 2 columns.
dataset_reference: Darmanis S, Sloan SA, Zhang Y, et al. A survey of human brain transcriptome diversity at the single cell level. Proc Natl Acad Sci USA. 2015;112(23):7285-90.

dataset_description: This data set details microarray experiment for 44 breast cancer patients. The binary variable list("Status") is used to classify the patients into estrogen receptor-positive ( list("Status = 0") ) and estrogen receptor-negative ( list("Status = 1") ). The other variables  contain the expression level of the considered genes.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: M. West, C. Blanchette, H. Dressman, E. Huang, S. Ishida, R. Spang, H. Zuzan, J.A. Olson, Jr., J.R. Marks and Joseph R. Nevins (2001) list("Predicting the clinical status of human breast cancer by using gene expression profiles") , list("Proceedings of the National Accademy of Sciences of the USA") , Vol 98(20), 11462-11467.

dataset_title: Data from the microarray experiment done by Alon et al. (1999)
dataset_description: The data set contains the gene expression data origianlly analized in Alon et al. (1999). 62 samples (40 tumor samples, 22 normal samples) from colon-cancer patients were analyzed with an Affymetrix oligonucleotide Hum6000 array. The binary variable list("y") is used to indicate a normal sample ( list("y = 0") ) or a tumor sample ( list("y = 1") ). Two thousand out of around 6500 genes were selected based on the confidence in the measured expression levels (for details refer to publication).
dataset_format: NA
dataset_reference: Alon U., Barkai N., Notterman D.A., Gish K., Ybarra S., Mack D. and Levine A.J. (1999) list("Broad patterns of gene expression revealed by clustering analysis of tumor and normal colon tissue probed by oligonucleotide arrays.") list("Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA") list("96") , 6745-6750

dataset_description: This data set details microarray experiment for 52 breast cancer patients. The binary variable list("status") is used to indicate whether or not the patient has died of breast cancer ( list("status = 0") = did not die of breast cancer, list("status = 1") = died of breast cancer). The other variables contain the amplification or deletion of the considered genes. Rather than measuring gene expression, this experiment aims to measure gene amplification or deletion, which refers to the number of copies of a particular DNA sequence within the genome. The aim of the experiment is to find out the key genomic factors involved in agressive and non-agressive forms of breast cancer. The experiment was conducted by the Dr.\ John Bartlett and Dr.\ Caroline Witton in the Division of Cancer Sciences and Molecular Pathology of the University of Glasgow at the city's Royal Infirmary.
dataset_format: NA
dataset_source: Dr. John Bartlett and Dr. Caroline Witton, Division of Cancer Sciences and Molecular Pathology, University of Glasgow, Glasgow Royal Infirmary.
dataset_reference: Augugliaro L., Mineo A.M. and Wit E.C. (2013) list("dgLARS: a differential geometric approach to sparse generalized linear models") , list("Journal of the Royal Statistical Society. Series B.") , Vol 75(3), 471-498. Wit E.C. and McClure J. (2004) "Statistics for Microarrays: Design, Analysis and Inference" Chichester: Wiley.
